text: This is a great place for breakfast regardless of where you live. It's worth the ride or a long walk. I was lucky enough to discover this place thanks to Hotel Broad Ripple. The quinoa bowl was deliscious, just don't forget to add avocado. If you are lucky Mason will sing for you! Oh and this place has Matcha Green Tea and they know how to properly prepare a straight cup of matcha. A true blessing for matcha lovers.

CASH ONLY, SUCKA!!!!
Seriously, man, when you're selling dounts for like $0.50 and paying something like $0.75 per credit card transaction, it's easy to understand while many small businesses are cash Nazis. 
I can't tell, really, if Hilligoss is that good or if all donuts are awesome. It's pretty much what you'd expect. Comparable to Long's. I might say that it's slightly BETTER (gasp!!!) because they seem to have a little more variety but it's not a pissing match.

They have two different menus for you to order from. One is chinese/ Japanese American styled restaurant and one is authentic Chinese food. The regular menu is the same as other restaurant, nothing special about it. The ramen is delicious and I would recommend the black garlic broth with BBQ pork. The egg drop soup is kind of plain and my first take out order egg drop soup actually tasted lightly sour like it's about to go bad. The wonton soup is plain too, but you can tell the wonton are made fresh, not the frozen kind from take out chinese restaurant. The authentic chinese menu are  very good. I like their garlic stirred fried veggies. I can say these menu items are not full of MSG, but lot of spice and soy sauce, sesame oil to make the flavor come out.
Great find in our neighborhood.  So much better than anything in center city.  Come here and bring a couple bottles of red wine.  You will he happy!  We will certainly be back!

I visited this place for the first time tonight with two other couples. I did not particularly like having to pay $5.00 to "valet" park my car 20 feet from me. I was stopped when I arrived and told the price. I asked if I could park myself and was told "no, no one parks themselves." I'm perfectly capable of parking my own car AND it cost me $5.00 to park it very close to where I was stopped. I don't agree with that. There's no need for forced valet parking. 

To get to the positive-we were greeted by a friendly young lady when we arrived. We were seated quickly but we did have a reservation. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. The food dishes ordered at my table ranged from the burger to rabbit fettuccine, fried chicken, stew and meatloaf. Everyone said their meal was delicious. I would return for dinner other than the valet issue which may have me think twice.

Visited Voodoo Gumbo during our visit to Nashville since my husband loves Cajun cuisine which is not readily available in our area.  Drove about 1/2 hr from our hotel to the restaurant which was in a strip mall with TJ Maxx.  Since it was 3:00 in the afternoon the restaurant was empty.  We were instructed to order at the register, the food was freshly cooked &  brought to our table.  My husband had the seafood gumbo (his favorite) which he loved.  He also had the shrimp po'boy & I had the oyster po'boy with coleslaw.
There were so many oysters I had to eat 1/2 of them first in order to pick up the sandwich.  Both po'boys were excellent, crispy & "melted in your mouth" tender. The po'boys were filling but we had to have the beignets which were hot & delicious. We inquired if there was a Voodoo Gumbo up north but was told by William it was privately owned.   Hi to Joyce & DeAnna who were also friendly & welcoming! We will definitely come back our next visit to Nashville.
I have been a regular at the Meridian Boise Fry location for about 3.5 years now. The food, drinks, and staff are incredible. Check out the attached photos for a look inside!

I have been here 3 times since this place opened and been to the one on Kennedy as well. I love this q the bartenders are awesome in the hog & Heifers sandwich is one of the best I've had. The next trip we will be having the burnt ends plate and ribs. I live in between 3 other bbq places and drive past them all to go to this one.
This place has amazing burgers! The atmosphere there is down to earth and very welcoming. Our kids gobbled up their burgers and fries quickly. I highly recommend this place!!

My girlfriend and I went here based on a suggestion from a friend that used to live in New Orleans.  He claimed that the Po'Boys here are authentic.  Seeing as how I don't know what an authentic Po'Boy is supposed to taste like, I cannot compare.  That being said, I can rate the place based on its own merit of flavor.

If you are looking for a nice sit down place, this is not it.
If you are looking for a place to take a date, this is not it.
If you are looking for a quick light bite to eat, this is not it.

If you are looking for a flavor explosion in your mouth that can satisfy an army, you've come to the right place.

The decor is very dingy so don't expect anything high class here.  The food portions are not only large...but unlimited! (I'll get to this in a minute) The food quality is superb and the variety of things you get is excellent.

In a nutshell, how this place works is you go in and order a Po'Boy, there are only about 4 different options such as chicken and catfish.  Once you sit down, you get visited by someone from the staff that takes your order for Sides.  I do not recall how many sides there were, but it was around 10.  These sides are unlimited, once you finish you side, you can request more or try something new on the list.  While waiting for the Po'Boy to arrive we had some sides and were already starting to get full on those alone.  Here comes the Po'Boy...a sandwich big enough that the two of us could have shared.  MAN was it yummy.  We gorged ourselves on the food here to the point that the drive home felt very guilty :)

I recommend coming here with an appetite and maybe a few friends.  

Great job papa Roux!

I just don't get it. I guess there's not much around here in the way of burrito places, but to me, this place isn't the place that I got excited to go to after reading the reviews. Everything tasted really prepackaged to me. The menu was unique, and they're trying with the different sauces, but the honey Siracha just fell flat. The owners are really nice and the place is cool, but it's just not for us. We won't be back, the authentic Mexican places in glassboro and Washington Township are better choices.

I wouldn't say this is the best Sally's in the area, but it's literally like five minutes away from my house. It's a great place to pick up hairdye and knick knacks.

They offer a membership for 5 dollars that you will get much more in return. You get a membership pricing on certain items and some gifts on certain occasions when you spend a certain amount.

They have a website too for what you can not find in stores. The workers are usually helpful the times I went. The last time the girl offered assistance on picking up colors for my mom and I. I felt she was off on my mom's color a bit, but nothing I couldn't fix up.

I love picking up haircare products from here, but do be careful. I feel some of the products might be a little too old. I had gone to Cali and picked up a bottle of styling product but left it in Cali when I left. So I went to the Sally's back home and picked up the same bottle but the product wasn't clear like the other one. It turned out to be a really nasty yellow color. I wasn't sure if the product was bad or if that's how it was suppose to be.

So I'm going to be a little more cautious picking up some of their generic brands. I do however love picking up their deep conditioning packets that are almost always on sale for .99cents. Great for if you're always dying your hair!

They have tons of products for your nails, hair to do extensions, accessories for hair, and appliances. You might get a good deal here than you would other places on appliances. So it doesn't hurt to check in to see if you can pick up something here than running to the nearest Utla.

Quaint and cozy atmosphere - great for a date as it is somewhat romantic. Most memorable dishes included the Wild Mushroom Arancini and the Blood Orange Gelato. Can't rave enough about the blood orange gelato!!

This place used to be a lot better. I've not tried any of the Entree meals, just the sushi. The rolls are all now tasting the same. The mountain roll was one of my favorite rolls here but the last few times i've visited it's tasted very dry. The king kong roll had a bit too much cream cheese and the pieces of nigiri are small compared to other AYCE sushi places. Other than that, the mussels taste great, free appetizers and choice of ice cream or fruit for dessert.
Friendly staff, quick service, nice decor. 
I put Ijji below The Joint Sushi and Hiroba in the Reno/sparks area.

This place is great - all the tapas were delicious, super friendly and helpful waiters. Good atmosphere. Meatballs and mushrooms and bacon wrapped dates in particular were great. Would definitely go back!

Let me first state that i am originally from dearborn Heights Michigan , where its like little Beirut and u have all sorts of lebanese restaurant there ... 3 years later after i moved i can finally say i have had amazing Chicken Shawarma and even the beef shawarma was really good... I walled in to a nice setting , looks really good . Now this was my first visit and i am sure I'll be going back but for now i am completely satisfied ... This is in largo , so i hope a lot of people get introduced to Lebanese/Arab/Mediterranean food

This pharmacy is continually one of the worst I have ever been to in my life. I am now looking into how to report this pharmacy or escalate this to a higher authority. I am seriously doing my research on this because the staff at this Walgreens are the worst staff I have ever seen ANYWHERE. They all lack customer service skills or general skills for interacting with other human beings. I have only come here twice in my life and have had a horrific experience at this particular Walgreens not once but BOTH times I have ever been here. The pharmacist "Fred" is rude and disgusting and needs to be fired. He does not deserve to work here. He is the worst pharmacist I have ever come across and I'm quite surprised that he was even able to become a pharmacist with his atrocious treatment of customers. I came here because my normal Walgreens pharmacy is closed at this time (10:00 PM) and I needed a refill of a single-dose medication that my doctor told me I could have two of. I got the initial dose yesterday afternoon. I came back for the second dose tonight because the symptoms had been continually concerning. I was told by "Fred" the pharmacist that I have to wait 20 minutes for the medication. I came back around after more than 20 minutes and he looked at me like he had never seen me before and asked how he could help me. I stated that I had been here over 20 minutes ago and he said "oh, right, I didn't even start working on it yet." He then takes all of my information all over again as if this is his first time seeing me. He looks into getting me the medication and comes back and tells me that I am not able to get it today because I have to wait 24 hours from the last time I got the medication to be able to get it again. I explained to him that I had gotten it over 24 hours ago (around 3:00 PM yesterday and it is now 10:30 PM). He said "I don't mean to argue with you but..." and the rest was nonsense. I literally got the medication over 24 hours ago and met the guidelines to have the prescription filled again and was told I could not get it. He told me to come back tomorrow morning. He wasted my time and when I mentioned this he did not seem apologetic about it. I called the pharmacy a little while after I got home to see how I could go about taking action, and when he picked up the phone, without even hearing me say a word, he said "there are too many people here" and put me on hold! Wow, this guy is among the trashiest of employees I have ever seen! I will definitely be looking into another 24/7 pharmacy because of my odd work hours, but in the meantime I will also be spreading the word to others not to go to this pharmacy and finding out how I can report these horrible pharmacy employees.

I've had more than half their wing sauces over the course of 5 or so visits. I'm not a big fan. Many of the sauces are okay, but not one had me wanting to come back for more. The only sauce I think is above average is the newer buffalo sauce with a bit of sweetness. The sauce name escapes me. Half of my visits the wings were a little over cooked. The dining area has a cafeteria wanting to be a sports bar feel. I stopped in last March to watch a little of the NCAA tourney and they didn't even have it on their TVs.  

2 stars for flavor. 2 stars for the dining room. 2 stars for value.

Update: I have to bump this review up by 1 star. I stopped in for lunch yesterday because I was craving wings. I ate the honey buffalo wings again. This sauce is the one St Louis Wing Co desperately needed. A sauce that keeps you coming back for more. A balanced sauce with sweet, spicy, without too much acidity. Excellent sauce. 
I also had the rally squirrel sauce. I was very impressed. Carmel sauce and nuts on a chicken wing?  It works beautifully. Not too sweet Carmel sauce goes great with the crunchy exterior of the wings with a bit of saltiness. Well done.

I came upon the first review of UAHomes, and I was absolutely shocked. I lived in a UAHome for 3 years (2011-2014) while in grad school, and Sheila and Cy are THE BEST landlords I've ever had! Not only are they among the sweetest people I have ever met, they are also attentive, responsive, responsible, and respectful landlords. I was always given at least 24 hour notice if Sheila or a worker was going to show up on my property, usually to assess whether the property needed routine maintenance. 

Sheila knew I was always busy with school and didn't have the time or energy to keep up with the weeds that would grow in my yard after the monsoons, so she would periodically have a worker come pull my weeds for me (yes, I was always notified and grateful!). My refrigerator broke one summer, and I had a brand new sparkling (and bigger!) fridge within 24 hours! 

It's very difficult to believe anyone would say such bad things about Sheila and Cy. I know many of their tenants like to move within the various homes that they own, so they can keep having awesome landlords. Living in Tucson and especially as a grad student, good landlords and great property are difficult to find. Sheila and Cy are a gem in the renter's market. I miss them and their wonderful property I rented for 3 years. Truly great memories. If I'm ever back in Tucson, Sheila will be first person I call to ask for an available home.

My experience here is hit or miss, depending on what area of the facility you're in.  The key to having a good time here is to go during non-peak hours.

Service in the sit-down eating area - hit or miss, leaning towards hit.  Sometimes we get friendly, attentive service.  Other times, deplorable.  It all depends on the server and how busy the place is.  Food is solid.  I especially like the nachos.

They have good pool tables.  Again, service around the pool tables is hit or miss.  Pricing for pool table use is acceptable during non-peak hours.  

Arcade area and bowling area are standard D&B style.  There's sometimes a really long wait for bowling.  But there's enough other stuff to do in the meanwhile, if you're that set on bowling during peak hours.

Solid pizza and fast delivery.  Also, really good chicken wings.  I really like their cheese pizza, great sauce in just the right proportion, crust is thin but with slight chewiness, and a generous amount of cheese.  Plenty of other options as well, dinners, sandwiches, and appetizers.  Order from them a couple of times a month, never had a bad experience.  Once we gave a large tip and the manager actually called to make sure we meant to tip that much, nice touch!  

And there is a rumor that they are open late with plenty of food to service the alcohol soaked bunch on SOHO on the weekends, ALLEGEDLY.

The food here is only average and it's overpriced.  I had the veal parmesan and spaghetti, and $16 was way too much for bland, poorly cooked veal and what tasted like canned tomato sauce.  Others at the table had seafood, including the catfish almandine, and reported nothing special.

They did a good job rebuilding after Katrina, the service was friendly and it was kid-friendly, but there are much better places to eat in New Orleans.  The tour bus parked out front should have tipped me off.  Mandina's may have been good back in the day, but I think it's gone the way of a lot of New Orleans 'institutions' and is just trading on its name and history.

Our previous experiences at the omni have been good. small but clean rooms, friendly staff and good location. This time we were placed on the second floor which is mixed with meeting rooms. The view from the room was a roof and had no light. We called to request a room change but we're told they were full. No problem. However on Saturday night when we returned to our room we found out our room was directly above the ballroom. The music was extremely loud in our room. Now it was 9pm and most people would still be out, but I was in town to run my first marathon and wanted to try to sleep. We called the front desk and were told the music would be done at 10. Although we were told the day before they were full, they did offer to change rooms. Time wise I didn't think it would make sense to pack up and unpack if the music would be done in an hour. Well the music went on until after 10:30. I asked to have the manager call me on Monday-no call. There are many other options, will not be back to this one. If you do stay make sure to avoid the second floor.

Excellent service. The people here are very professional and courteous. They try their best to make you feel comfortable and the salon had a very relaxing atmosphere. I Went in for a haircut and got exactly what I asked for.My stylist took the time to make sure the cut was perfect and she was friendly and knowledgeable.
The cannoli king cake is amazing!  We had 2 this year and everyone loved it!  Call a day or 2 in advance to order.

I love coming to Cielo for Sunday brunch. It's a very non -St Louis experience. The service  is always professional and relaxed. They make a fantastic omelet and wonderful creme brûlée french toast.  My friends love the bottomless bloody Mary's. Have also had lunch but never dinner. That menu looks fantastic if a little pricey.
Great food, great prices and customer service. Their queso dip is amazing.

Food 4/5. Ambiance 5/5. Service varies from 3/5 to 5/5.

I like to tell both sides of the story. See the good and the bad.

The pizza is always great. I have also had the chicken BLT, the fries, and all of the salads. Everything is very tasty. The pork nachos are a must.

I love the selection of beers, and $10 flight nights on Mondays.

I have gone for quizzo, stayed at the bar for flyers games, stayed for live music, as well as I love the fire pit outside.

The bartenders are extremely nice and helpful, even when busy. However, I am complaining about servers as hit or miss. I understand that you get busy. However, when the rest of my friends (group of 7) get their meals, and I get mine 20 minutes later, AFTER everyone else is pretty much done with his/her meal, AND I don't get an apology or anything... whatttttt? I understand that the place was busy, but I got the chicken sandwich and my boyfriend got the ribs. I get it. Ribs can take long. That was too long. And no apology...

Sorry city tap. I love you. But bad service can make or break you.

Had to go the tourist route and get a cheese streak while in Philly. The hype is well deserved. I loved the sandwich and I'm not a cheese whiz fan but I didn't want to alter the meal. I was not disappointed at all. The food was good, service was quick, price was reasonable and I left there stuffed. I had a mushroom cheese steak and a bottle of water because it was a hot day. I'll try the fries next time because I plan to go back with no hesitation. The area was clean, parking is a challenge but if u get off the beaten path and park in the residential area and walk a block or two you'll be fine. Car was safe no issues or alarming concerns. I love the way both legendary restaurants are in the same area and they are both prosperous. A little friendly competition goes a long way and they have it down to an art. Just think they need to accept credit and debit cards in this day and age. The sandwich was $12 and that's a reasonable amount to use a card for your purchase.

Popped by Tijuana Flats for a quick bite on a sunny Saturday for lunch, with a few friends. It wasn't too packed, compared to some of the other restaurants around. We placed and paid for our orders with the cashier, and a food runner brought our food out to our table, in about 10ish minutes. I ordered the Chicken bowl, which was pretty filling. The bowl itself wasn't the most flavorful, but I was able to spruce it up with their hot sauces, which they had quite a variety of at a sauce bar. I'd pop by here again when I'm in the area, if I'm craving tex mex, but I'll definitely explore other options first if I'm feeling adventurous.
I liked the atmosphere but the Tuesday special doesn't include the gluten free option, even if you pay the difference in the crusts. Our waitress Carmen and Abby were wonderful!

I purchased a motorcycle there four years ago (2014); they could not be better as a dealership.  Besides the sales staff being very helpful and informed, the service staff is the best I've ever experienced -- and I've owned many, many motorcycles.

My experience here was nothing less than perfect. I came to have my hair and makeup done for a wedding. Nicole listened to what I had in mind and did a wonderful job with my hair and Jessica did an incredible job with my makeup. I will definitely be coming back!!

One of my fav sandwich spots in the city. Delicious options, great service, prices are affordable. I am a regular. Hard to back a bad choice. Today I tried the breakfast sandwich and it is soooooo good! I gobbled it up!! I also love the Atlantic (salmon sandwich) and the Jersey. My sister and i came here a few years ago for the first time grab sandwiches and eat in the square, and we loved every bite! Thank you for continuing to serve the Center City community!

I need for some dental services and a good friend recommended Dr Kashfi, I had a cleaning and general check up. Was very pleased with his services and professional recommendations on a whitening process.
One of the best breakfast spots in town!! The fried green tomato omelet was amazing!!

Came here during my Mardi Gras adventures. This place was free to get into (as it was 5pm on a Sunday) which resulted in a filled house both outside on the courtyard and inside on the dance floor. The dj was spinning good music and they had good prices on their shots and beers (one of the more cheaper places actually on bourbon st). Overall not a bad place at all, decent sized courtyard, cheap drinks, and not bad music. I can only imagine what this place is at like midnight (actually I have seen it, its hard to get into, but then again everything is during Mardi gra

If your looking for great roti, this is the place for it!  It's a Mom and Son run shop and they are both very pleasant and proud of their business.  The rotis are freshly made to order which means you have to wait a little but its we'll worth it.  Give them I try, you won't be disappointed.

So far I'm not at all satisfied. I'm in downtown Nashville.  I called my roadside assistance who dispatched twenty four-7.  twenty four-7 says it will be 44 minutes.  They are in a town 31 miles away.  Huh?  There's no one in downtown nashville who can help me change a flat??

1 hour later and still not here. GPS showed the truck as 39 minutes away an hour ago and 15 minutes ago I called twenty four-7 and they said he'd be here in 16 minutes AND they'd have him call me 5-10 minutes out.

Tasty food in a nice cozy home-like setting.  My lower ranking is based only on what I suspect is unlikely circumstances.  First we came a couple of weeks after Hurricane Isaac and they were clearly doing some work on one part of the restaurant.  However, their signage was not very good so we walked into the work area and were stumped for a little while on where to go.  Then once we found the right entrance we were greeted by a guy in a workout outfit (tshirt and shorts) which seemed pretty unprofessional.  The last disappointment was that there was a cockroach running around the dining room (as a midwesterner I am not accustomed to cockroaches and frankly am scared of them crawling over my sandaled feet).  On the positive side the food was very good and the waiter was particularly knowledgable.  The pace of the meal was a bit faster than I prefer, but we were on a schedule so it worked perfectly for us.  The atmosphere was really nice with lots of artwork on the walls.  I'd definitely not turn down an offer to return, but considering all the options in NOLA I won't ever seek out another visit.

Spent the afternoon at the bar...   Chips and Salsa were good.  2 types of salsa.  Awesome. Enjoyed some margaritas.  Drinks were good. Atmosphere was also excellent.  Ready...   The bartender seemed about ready to fight the whole night.   Maybe that's taking things too far..  Okay, you get the gist. Not the friendliest chap in Nashville that I've met.  Just a cautionary note to those sitting at the bar.

I couldn't get past the bathroom. There were mouse droppings EVERYWHERE. It made me reluctant to order food, so I just got some veggie soup. BF got some chicken dish which was an insane portion for the price -- he said it tasted okayyy -- but it may or may not made him sick the next day. For me it was a sanitary thing, him a food not delicious enough to risk feeling crappy (literally) over. Either way, we shan't be returning, which is a shame considering how limited the neighborhood options are.

Es el Restaurant dentro del Hyatt Regency! 
Vine a la exposición de mi Rubro y tuve reuniones en ese Restaurant ! 
Buen clima, buena música ! 
El sushi es muy bueno ! 
Recomiendo el corte de carne NY delicioso ! Pero a $ 28 otra opción la hamburguesa  a precio $ 18 !

La atención es buena ! 
Si piden la carne tengan en cuenta que demora unos 25 min ! 

Les dejo fotos de los platos que comimos ! 

Saludos !

Worst service ever I ordered a two for six and got charged for a whopper meal and then the three piece tenders that I ordered I total I was charged $6.89 whopper meal (only got the whopper) and then $3.99 for my tenders that should have both cost me six dollars... 
I should have checked the receipt before I left I know but when I went back the manager wanted to "void" out the previous bill and "recharge" me for the correct amount... I didn't trust her shady a** ain't getting me twice! 
She acted like it was my fault for ordering something off the menu even when the guy who took my order was telling her it was an honest mistake she threw shade at me... not cool Ashleigh...
Also the fries where cold...

This was our first visit. Tiffany was awesome. Our only complaint is our steak with pasta was burnt so she had to redo our order. Our sliders were burger meat and not steak we still paid the same price. We heard and read alot of complaints about the food being cold and long wait time. I must say we didn't wait long and our food was hot.

I had a bowl with pulled moist chicken, rice, greens, corn and green sauce. All was fresh and so delicious! This is not your average Mexican cuisine, plus it was very reasonably priced for the quality!

I haven't left a review in quite a while, but I had to leave one for this restaurant. The food came out quickly and was delicious. Andre was our waiter, and the service was excellent. Kid friendly. We are from the Caribbean, and we're also used to Caribbean food in NY-- and we're glad to have found this place!

My go to place for propane tank refills.  I'd been going to Lowe's or Maverik for exchange propane tanks for years and was turned on to Green's by a friend.  As you can see by my receipt the empty tank cost less than $7 versus $17.99-$21.99 at the places that exchange cylinders.

This place used to be one of our go-to's. It recently closed and reopened, and we were excited to go back and try one of our favorite lunch spots.

Whatever new ownership there is has absolutely ruined the menu. I ordered what turned out to be the worst salad I've ever had here; the lettuce was flavorless and wet, the chicken was absolutely disgusting, and they were out of multiple of the ingredients but charged me the full value of the salad before telling me. Used to be one of my most recommended spots in Nashville, now I'm just waiting for it to close again.

Falora was Devine. The atmosphere was beautiful, the service was top-notch, and the food was unreal. The focaccia and kale salad to start were amazing--which was just the beginning. The pizza was unreal tasty. Had the pizza with butternut squash and zucchini on it and the flavors were out of this world.
IOU's group enjoyed a fabulous dinner. Even managed a protein high!  The wait staff was fantastic!

Just bought a car from Dominic at DCH Lexus in Santa Barbara.  We had been to several dealerships, and he was, by far, the most friendly, helpful, and professional salesperson we encountered.  He listened to us and helped us the whole way through to get the car we wanted.  Thanks Dominic!

So got there prob around 9:30ish ... line was long but nothing too ridiculous, and I've been hearing about this place for a while so expected for it to be crowded. Surprisingly it was organized.. stood in line, order your food.. the cashier gave you a number and told you how long the wait would be( and my wait was just that ..about 30 min).. they call your number and you be on your way! No issues no problems

The food.... not that impressed, I ordered the crab legs,shrimp and mussels, w/ broccoli and corn. The best thing on my plate was the corn... the shrimp was over cooked the broccoli was under cooked.. and the sauce.. what is it? Fake butter.. idk I don't like it's too sweet or tangy, possibly the garlic it look like I had a whole minced garlic jar in my platter (and I love garlic) but this was toooooooo much. Idk what's in the sauce but it over powers the actual taste of the seafood. I mean I've tried it .. not my cup of tea ‍

Unfortunately I've only started ordering from here since quarantine happened and I wanted to get bagels and breakfast sandwiches from Uber Eats.  I ordered a dozen bagels and some cream cheeses for some of my family coming to visit this morning, and I thought one of my cream cheeses was missing.  I realized it was in the bag under my bagels but the girl on the phone was super nice and understanding even though I made a silly mistake!  My family also enjoyed them and they made for a very nice breakfast!  I can't wait until the restaurants open back up because I think Bagelati will also make for a nice place to get some lunch and a cup of coffee to spend the afternoon studying!

Such amazing Vegan food me and my girlfriend drove down here from Orlando on a recommendation from the lead singer of Municipal Waste and boy I was not disappointed one bit! Anyone who's vegan or just loves tasteful fresh good food has to check this place out! 5 stars

We had two positive experiences with Tom and Tom at Flourtown Heating and AC. 

They replaced an aging AC unit and compressor. They showed up on time, cleaned up after themselves, and most importantly the job was done right. 

The second experience was on New Years Day when our heater stopped kicking on. Tom came out (despite not installing our heater) and checked all the pressure sensors, cleans the flame sensor and other parts. Unfortunately it appears the problem is electronic it's the board. He referred us to a local Lennox dealer.  He was at my house for two hours, had to take apart half the heater to get to a poorly located flame sensor. And he refused to bill me or take any money for his time.  He also told me what the part should cost, and a ballpark of what I could expect for a bill and made a referral. 

These guys are honest, care about their customers, and I'll refer them every chance I get.  Thank you Tom!

Honestly never had a bad experience here. Staff is always kind and courteous and food is always great. We really appreciate this because the other fast food restaurants in the area unfortunately often disappoint.

Walked in for first appointment. Worker and patient not wearing a mask. When I asked about it she flippantly said "I have my reasons". I felt that since CDC recommends masks, since this is a medical office, they should set a good example. If they are sloppy for this, they could be sloppy and not follow guidelines for procedures etc. So I walked out the door and never started their services. It is just wrong and her answer was not good enough and too flippant.

UPDATE in response to Steve.

You're right, I left out the part where Steve told me they could "fight it out" with insurance, implying that he wasn't going to take ownership of their mistake. 
I DID call my insurance, as I stated in my review many times. I'm out the $100 deductible until they finish handling it with his insurance. 
It's been almost 2 weeks after waiting for a response from Fast Eddy's. My car is still damaged and the lack of communication still stands.
Thankfully my awesome insurance will definitely be handling it with them. 
The point of this review is to hopefully warn others of the potential for damage to your vehicle if it has any rock chips and fact that the owner won't be making the necessary repair process easy on you.

Despite not having anchor stores anymore the middle part of the mall is actually coming back. They got a pretty nice clothing store and furniture store in the middle that just expanded. The food court has a really good smoothie place and Philly cheese steak shop. The front half of the mall just got a facelift within the last year. Just don't use the bathrooms. They don't have soap or toilet paper.

We walked into Jason Aldean's Kitxhen and Rooftop bar but ended up finding a rooftop table at Luke Bryan's. We got a beer and ordered food at the bar. 

I asked for a darker beer and the response was a laugh and response of 'we don't have dark beer'. Ok then, Corona me. 

This was my first time in Nashville and there was a bowl game in town so not sure if crowds are always like this. The place was packed. The rooftop was an audio smorgasbord of music coming from every direction, so much so that it was impossible to actually focus on any one band so it felt more like noise. Sitting inside was a much better way to enjoy the music. 

I'll always be grateful to drink a beer on a patio. Wings were really good. California wrap was ok. Make sure you order beer from the right rooftop bar because they don't let you go across roofs with liquor.

Seriously the freshest fish I've ever eaten. NO DEEP AT THE BOTTOM OF THE OCEAN TASTE :D

I've always been flippy floppy on eating fish. I'm not a fan of it but Frenchy's has changed my mind! If I could eat fish as fresh as this... I would eat it everyday!

We went to Sake Hana's tonight.  The food was very good.   The service was absolutely terrible.  It took 30 minutes to get our drinks, 15 more to get our appetizers.  We finally recieved our food an hour and forty minutes after we sat down.   Also, carrying  a martini with your hands wrapped around the top was also a turn off, I am hardly a germ freak, but drinking from a glass that had someones hands around it is a bit disgusting.  

We will think twice about going back.

3-31-3012 - Pretty damn good steak. Steak was good and hot, decent quality meat, broccoli rabe good, onions very good.  Roll was good quality local bread.  Counter staff were polite.

Mac & Cheese was just OK because kind of bland, and it was reheated by "Chef Mike" so there were hot and cold pockets. I would suggest that they either make smaller batches during the day, or reheat it outside of the styro cup and stir it once or twice while reheating before handing to the customer.  The ambience is good, it's warm and indoors for Californians freezing their butts off.

THE BAD: CASH ONLY - CASH ONLY - CASH ONLY. BE WARNED. DING THEM A STAR FOR THIS.
Best sushi I've had in a while. We got the hot shrimp soup, tutsie roll, and the Las Vegas roll. Everything hit the spot. If you order anything get the Las Vegas roll. Just get it.

Great place.  The classes are very professional. There are beginner classes and for more seasoned yogis (or not), the teachers are very hands on to adjust and correct. The facility had plenty of parking, as well as showers and changing facilities for your convenience.

I can't say enough how tasty this place was.  Went with a friend on a Wednesday night.  Seated promptly and the waitress informed us that Wednesday was taste testing night.  One small item was to be brought to us complimentary for sampling.  We ended up with some kind of curried wings that were to die for.  No sauce just obvious that wings had marinated for a while before cooking.  Melted in my mouth.  As for the regular items we ordered, it was wonderful.  Three flavored potatos (Kishka?) was light and the sauces were excellent.  Chicken in both dishes was moist and tender.  Portions were decent and rice was refilled quickly .  Can not wait to go back,

Was on vacation in Santa Barbara, and came across this place. Did a walk-in, waited ten minutes to get  a full set of gel acrylic nails done by Nathan, who was by far the most thorough and friendly nail technician I had. Thank you!
Super cute trendy spot in Santa Barbara. Great friendly service they have a breakfast lovers dream menu all the good all day - great spot!

Always dependable, good quality food and drink. Excellent choices for kids as well and it's a ton of food for that price! Have had several things on the menu but last night had the tuna which was really nice...wife had the salmon which was yummy too. Not a sushi fan so can't speak to the sushi but others at our table got it last night and had rave reviews. It gets packed on weekend nights, so highly encourage a reservation!

I love this place. Great food and excellent service. The amount of food you get for the price is great compared to the other donair places in the SW. I will be coming here more often. Also their soft drink choices are awesome. They have quite the selection of bottled soda!

So good! The pick 3 sampler is awesome for a first timer! You get three nice servings of gumbo with garlic bread and so far they're all delicious. The staff is super nice and create a fun friendly environment with their cheerful demeanor. I'll be back for sure! Also be sure to get the boudin balls they're great!

Every bite was worth it. The burgers are amazing. Very good bun. Super fast service. Real feel good ambiance. Love everything about this place, it's worth going outside of downtown Nashville for one of these gem burgers. You can't go wrong no matter which one you pick!

My boyfriend and I very much enjoyed our experience at Mesa Verde. I ordered the jackfruit tacos with a side of avocado, which were served in lettuce cups and beautifully seasoned (you would never guess it's made from the smelliest fruit in the world) and very yummy. I also really appreciated the generous size of the avo side (1/2 the fruit) when you normally only get a couple slices at other places. BF had the potato latkes with a side of poached egg and also really enjoyed it. We're both meat eaters but I just wanted to try something new. The kombucha they had on that day was also really good (passion green tea, I believe) and even after we had declined dessert and paid the check, they presented us with a sample of their delicious baklava and soy ice cream, which was just the perfect finish to our meal! I've had baklava in Turkey and this was really amazing, so that should say something. Really worth trying this place!

I like this salon, but definitely make an appointment I've had to wait for over an hour multiple times. I have gotten my nails done by Ben every time and he has done a very good job shaping and painting my nails, he is also very nice. Not a super high end place or anything but nicer than a lot of other places I've been to.

This is a warning for any bridal party members who can't physically be present for fittings. My daughter was a bridesmaid in a wedding last month. Since we live out of state, my daughter had to give her measurements over the phone. When the dress arrived, it was too small. We took it to our local alterations shop to see if they could alter it, but there was not enough fabric. Angel Bridal would not refund the amount of the dress (about $300), despite the fact that my daughter had given correct measurements. Angel had not asked for the measurement across my daughter's back, just her bust and waist size, and though she has a very small waist and bust, she is a swimmer with a broad back, hence the dress would not zip due to that. Angel refused to refund any of the cost of the dress, even when I explained that we had given the correct measurements as asked by them. Given the fact that it was just before the wedding and my daughter did not have a bridesmaid dress, I found a similar dress online (one with a full refund policy, imagine that??!), and ordered that, but it meant that I ended up spending a total of $600 for my daughter to get a dress that didn't even match those of the other bridesmaids.  This policy of Angel Bridal seems completely unfair to out-of-state bridesmaids who are unable to be fitted in person. Essentially, if the dress doesn't fit, too bad - no refunds. What way is that to run a business?

So this review is ages, even years, late, but it's better than never. This place, OH what I can say about this place. I spent 5 years in Philly for school and work, and I haven't had better fried rice than the fried rice here at Beijing. The best. And I'm from New York. Not only is everything here so fantastically delicious (the fried rice!), but the staff are incredibly welcoming. There's never a long wait, they are attentive without being pushy or overwhelming, and the prices are so reasonable! If the fact that it were a BYO without a corking fee didn't sway you, know that whenever I come back to the Philly/Mainline area for Penn alumni events or work conferences, I ALWAYS make sure I eat here and get fried rice to take home!

Pretty good, but not as good as the staples downtown that do steak and seafood well. CharBlue was good, not great. I wouldn't put it on the same playing field as Morton's, Harry & Izzy's, St. Elmo's, etc. If you go, don't miss out on the lobster pops or the cheesecake. The cheesecake may be the best cheesecake I have ever had. Overall, not disappointing, but not memorable.
Such a wonderful museum. The building is so unique. The staff is very helpful and pleasant. Every few months they bring in a different artist. So much to learn.

This place was great! Driving home from our grandparents house, we wanted a quick and tasty lunch. The Habit was just what we needed. Kind of an In & Out meets Islands vibe, and flavor, the burgers were delicious and the fries didn't leave my hands covered in grease. We left feeling satisfied that we had a good lunch, without feeling like we were going to have a heart attack. The salad options were nice too.

First of all. The people working there were awesome and so helpful. It was our first time and they were super helpful and patient with me. There is so much to choose from and it can literally paralyze you. But they had great recommendations and genuinely seemed excited and proud of their product.
.
I tried a couple of the mason jar desserts and some of the cake. It was absolutely amazing. I'm not even big on desserts and usually find then to be overrated and overpriced but these are worth every cent. Definitely recommend giving them a try! I cannot wait to go back for more

I just got a call from these people. The women was super excited and kept saying I won a free "anniversary" cruise.  Well anyway she was giving me her whole spiel, free 4 day 3 night cruise to Bahamas, all inclusive except for alcohol and gambling, free airfare to and from Miami, etc. etc. Then it changed to, you haven't won this, we are giving this to you for coming in and watching a media package, no cost to you and no pressure to buy. Thank god as soon as I started talking to the women I came online and found these reviews. The more she was saying, I got a worse and worse feeling that it wasn't legitimate, but thank god for these reviews! I ended up making an appointment for tomorrow night just so I can get her off the phone, but needless to say, we won't be going.

Pat's serves up simple fare, much as they have been for decades. In the past 20 years I've eaten here a few times and the food has always been consistently average and modestly priced. Chili dogs are kind of their specialty but for some reason I've never tried one.  Burgers are slim, fries are greasy good.
Been coming here everyday for the past week. Excellent coffee. Mega friendly dudes and just a good vibe. Would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting NOLA.

Love the experiences we have every time we go! Tonight was no exception and thank you to the wonderful Anita who is always so kind and remembers us every time. She always says hi to our little baby girl, makes sure we know all the specials, and never fails to ask us about our experience shopping. She remembers that we are first time parents and even asks us how that is going. So Anita, thank you so much!!!! You make our shopping for groceries with our daughter special!

AN AWESOME SURPRISE!

This place a not your average chicken joint.  They serve chicken that has been marinated for at least 24 hours.  Everything is full of flavor and there are traditional sides such as rice but there are fun sides such as quinoa and plantains.  

The Staff is friendly and they bring your food to your table after you order.  

Generous portions and excellent food!

I can't recommend AMOSO Properties highly enough! Joe and his team are attentive, responsive, communicative, and highly professional. As an out-of-state investor, I felt confident that Joe and his team at AMOSO were always looking out for my best interests. Whether you are an out-of-state investor like me looking for peace of mind, or a local property owner looking for 5-star customer service and top-flight professionalism, Joe and his team at AMOSO Properties is your #1 go-to source for your property management needs! They are--quite simply--the very best!
Fantastic softball facility with turf fields and an excellent food restaurant!

One of the best breakfasts I've had.  We booked a reservation after a walk that my family and I were participating in.  From the first phone call to to the last cup
Of coffee we had the best experience.  The service was impeccable!  Thank you to all for accommodating our group.  We will definitely be coming back!!!

Would never use this company again.  The guys were late getting here, joked around the entire time, very careless, and damaged several items, and I'm missing a part to a scooter.  They only offered $63 for broken dresser mirror, damage to front door, missing ironing board rubber pad, damage to container that sewing machine was in, thus, damaging sewing machine, damage to garage cabinets.

So, I don't eat BBQ often and it's not because I don't want to, but because I have certain standards a place has to meet for me to consider it worthy of trying. I will say, I was highly impressed with this place! I had the pulled pork, Mac and cheese, and green beans. Everything was absolutely perfect! The selection of sauces was great and the portions were huge! This was a great place for families. I thought it was nice that they play the national anthem at noon every day. The service was friendly (typical order then sit down style BBQ). Parking lot was accommodating. I cannot wait to go back!

I gave them 1 star because their Paneer Tikka App had Artificial coloring(Red/Saffron Color) which i absolutely hate! 

Unfortunately, Taj India didn't live up to my standards in terms of quality of food! Sorry for disappointing folks!

If you come to Nashville and not go to 5 daughters your totally missing out on one of the best bakery experiences in the US, but today as I was checking out I saw a menu for breakfast sandwiches and what caught my eye was the Nashville Hot Chicken breakfast sandwich on a croissant with a fried egg, this sandwich was simple amazing and by far the best breakfast sandwich I have ever had, the chicken had just enough spice, the croissant was fantastic and with the egg and peppers and sauce , let me say OMG !!!!!!

And the best part the amazing donuts make for a great Desert

They were prompt, knowledgeable, professional, and really generous about helping us. We hired them to get our fireplace inspected and cleaned,  which they did very well, while explaining and educating us along the way. They gave us tips on our dryer which we hadn't even asked for and helped us with some firewood problems too. Couldn't be happier. We will use them every year from now on.

We went there yesterday afternoon and naturally it was a rather unique experience.  There's lots of interesting material posted on the walls at frequent intervals and there are self-guided audio tours (there are also guided tours at 2:00 p.m., but we were there later).  Irrespective of the reasons for the inmates having been imprisoned, there were two rather poignant things:  a tiny synagogue (one of the very few prison synagogues) which was built & maintained by volunteers in Philadelphia, and a framed prison newsletter article beautifully written by an inmate about the long-time prison doctor (who was originally there for many years on a voluntary basis).

Go for the experience-  the ice cream was great, but know that you'll be paying 'boutique' prices. Lovely view of the STL Wheel as we enjoyed our desserts. The food looked good, too. Dreamsicle Shake, All American Hot Fudge Sundae, Hawaiian Sundae were top notch. The Hawaiian used real pineapple, so it was not too sweet--perfect with the toasted coconut and the macadamia nuts.

Went in for a first time consultation. Be prepared for sticker shock. The price for a 12 week program is outrageous. Once I realized this was out of my price range,  I was looked at like I had three heads when I mentioned I could not afford the weight loss program they offered for me. I quickly became uncomfortable and left the appointment. A little while later, I received inappropriate text messages from the consultant asking what is wrong. I definitely do not recommend this place of business. I cannot speak if this place helps you lose weight but I can say that their sales tactics seem questionable. I will lose weight by exercising and watching my diet and will save money in doing so. All others, be warned.

This restaurant gives you a lot of food for the price. You have a salad bar with your dinner & this amazing bread that melts in your mouth. The wait staff is very helpful & friendly too. I can't wait to come back.

Home Depot just lost my business. I'll go to Lowe's from now on. 
Veteran discounts they've given for years. They will not accept state issued ID proving your status. 
Lowe's generally has better pricing and a better selection.

I really like Asian supermarkets and I don't often find major variation in them. They have hard-to-find supplies at good prices and have a fishy smell. This one is near my weekly grocery commute, so I want happy to use it. Plus, it's connected to Tasty Place which I love!

Wonderful happy hour outside tonight, and in the cozy bar as well! A nice, quiet place to drink great wine and talk....our server was excellent - wish I'd caught his name (he's 6'9") because he didn't hover, but was really attentive. I'd given up on this place when it transitioned from Piatti, but now I'm sold. A great little hideaway spot to have good food and good vino!

Oh look, another "I hate Comcast" post.

Seriously, wtf Comcast? 

I moved from NJ where I've had Comcast for several years. Since I was moving to Philly and that's a different state, I had to close my NJ account and open one in Philly. Okay! 

But wait! The people who used to live in my apartment ran up the bill and never paid it. Great. Now I have to prove I am not them. Excellent. That rep tells me to go to the office on Columbus Blvd with my lease. Okay! 

I wait in line for 45 mins with 30 other people who wanted to be anywhere but hanging out in the Comcast line. I get up there, explain my story, hand over my lease and I am told "Oh no we need your lease, ID, Social Security card, and a current utility bill from your old address" I'm sorry, what? Since I don't normally carry my SS card and utility bills on me, I question why I was never told this and the heffer behind the glass says "It's noted here that you were told to bring these items" uh, no ? If i was I WOULD HAVE BROUGHT THEM YOU COW. So, off I go, annoyed and ticked off.

I call Comcast the next day from work to drag some fax numbers out of em. I get 3, 2 dont work. WTF. Fine so I will go stand in line for 45 minutes AGAIN to deal with the heffer with mad cow disease behind the glass wall. Now I understand WHY there is a wall b/c I can only imagine how many people would chuck a cable box at their dumb heads. Anyway, I go, give the cow my info and Im told the security department will review and have a decision  in 5-10 business days. WHAT. I want internet NOW!

So I go home and send what I shall refer to as the EECB (executive email carpet bomb) to 80 Comcast Execs, asking why its so hard to continue to give them my business? Who calls me 20 mins later but Comcast to setup my account ? Score! Until I have to call back to tell them what equipment I wanted (had to double check with the roomate) and was told there were setup fees (yuck), and to get them ASAP (the next day) Id have to pay $30 for overnight shipping. Grr. Fine. Gimme the goods. So my roomate stays home alllll day the next day (Friday) waiting for our Comcast goodies. No show. So I call Comcast AGAIN to ask em wtf and oh my stuff didnt ship. YOU DONT SAY!!! And they "think" it will ship the next day. Oh. Awesome.

Saturday rolls around and I get a call from Comcast who says they cant setup my account b/c they need the dl/ss/utility bill of the other person on the lease. What. The account is solely in my name, to which Im told, the other person on the lease could not pay and stick Comcast. Uh, hello? Im the ONLY person on the account. So after I go back and forth with this woman, shes not getting that Im not having this crap and Ive given em everything they asked for & now a few days later its not good enough? I snapped, to be honest and told her to find whoever had the authority to fix my problems to call me back. 10 minutes later I get a call that my account has been setup and they have a tech coming out to do the install on Sunday morning. Free of charge I ask ? Crickets. Uhhh, yea, free of charge.

So Mr. Comcast man comes out on time (yippeeeeee) and sets us all up, minus a router since he had none. That's ok, Ive got a spare around here somewhere. 1 DVR, 2 cable boxes, and 1 modem later, we can has Cable and Internets...1 week late.

Oh and on the following Thursday (one week after I was supposed to get overnight shipping) Guess what shows up at my door via UPS ? 1 DVR, 2 Cable boxes, 1 modem, and 1 router.  

The thought of going BACK to the Comcast office to hand this crap in makes me want to jump off the Ben Franklin.

Comcast is sooooo lucky I can't get FIOS in my building.
OMG my very first Poke experience. It was DELISH. the fish was fresh and the entire meal was very light and flavorful. I cant wait to go back.
If you come to and don't eat here,  you a fool!  This place rocks with unique twist on old favorites and your next new favorites.

We were able to get a seat outside and were quickly greeted with menus and our server. Warning... they do not have Mimosas...this is sad for a breakfast place. I had the Mexican skillet which was very filling and had a bit of a spicy kick. My wife had the steak burrito,  which for those who might be interested in this... it is ground steak more like burger or sausage. It is not flank steak. She was a bit disappointed based on this but still said it was good and filling. Would definitely recommend for a quick inexpensive breakfast and we will go back...just not for steak and mimosas!

food was surpisingly delicious, did not taste like cafeteria food although somewhat presented like that, no offense
All in all, will return with the family. Roast beef, green beans, creamed spinach, everything we got was soooo delicious! busy mom, gotta go....

Never been treated so poorly or heard employees complain so much about having to work past closing. Got there at 7:45 to hear both employees doing nothing but bitching that is was SOOOOO busy (two people in the whole restaurant) and that they couldn't finish closing before they actually closed at 8:00. Planned on spending $50...walked out after ordering. Won't be back!

Met a friend here for breakfast. His name is Mark too...but he spells it with a K which is pretty ridiculous if you ask me. I decided not to punish the Oxford Exchange by taking away a star because my friend doesn't know how to spell his own name. 

Anyway, I could spend the whole day here. They have a really cool book store and shop with a lot of interesting stuff. For some reason they also have a section with glasses. I'm not so sure I'm going from breakfast to glasses in the same place, but I guess someone is doing it. 

There are plenty of places to sit and get some work done. It's an awesome place to meet someone (just make sure they spell their name right). 

And for the real reason you are reading this review.

The food here is great! They always have some interesting things on the menu. And as much as I want to point you in the right direction, anything on the menu is great!!! If you haven't already come here, you need to!!!

I haven't eaten fast food since my last visit to this Hardee's. You gave me food poisoning. Thanks for turning me into a healthy individual I guess. Wish I could give you 0 or negative stars for food so awful it makes you sick with poison.

Hutch's has gone downhill lately. 

If you're just paying for a basic wash, its not bad...or if you get a free wash with old change deal. But the last two times we made the mistake of asking for something more...once we asked for the deluxe service and found that the time spent on our truck was exactly the same as every other car in the place. Nothing was done extra.

This time we had a large problem with tree sap on the truck, so the attendant suggested that nothing but a hand wash would take care of that. So paid the $55 and waited an hour. The results were probably worse than just the basic wash. Mud was left under the doors and there were still bug splats above the windshield. More importantly, they removed 80% of the sap drops. So you know they can remove them...they just gave up on it. 

It's time for a new wash place....

My boss and I found Shaker and Peel recently and decided to check it out for a new work-lunch spot. Katelyn, the Unicorn-Care Bear hybrid, has changed our lives for the better. We didn't have a spot where we could call home for our lunch meetings, but God-in-Heaven, we found it. 
Here me now: If you have not tried this place out, do so IMMEDIATELY. Also - the manager, Jolene, is super nice and communicative. The food, quality, and experience is unmatched in the area. If you think I'm lying, go back to the Communist Party. This place is bangin'!

Sold my home, and went to cancel my account. They changed their policy and won't pro-rate anymore. In other words, I had to pay a full month because I called them 3 days after last billing cycle when the house was sold. Lousy policy, and this will continue to drive business away to others. I will never again subscribe to so-called "cable" service again. I guess they're desperate to get every nickel and dime they can. Surprised this is even legal. I smell a class action lawsuit any day now.

Super disappointed! We've been without air conditioning for a month! Apparently they don't know how to deal with American Home Shield, and didn't have the customer service to let us know they didn't know how to do it! Why sign up with a contract that you can't handle?! They even screened our calls to not talk to us when we called. BTW it reached 101 degrees today. Thanks Ross for nothing!!

I was visiting from out of state and always have to stop in to the Wild Muffin, when I am there.  I love, Love, LOVE their vegan muffins, so yummy.  The staff was so friendly, knowledgeable and so very helpful.  A unique gem in Nashville!

The place looks like a typical pizza joint. When you taste the food, The pasta, oh man is it ever good. It's so good it's worth a long drive.The staff is friendly and the coffee is very good. I think they do a great job and if you are in the area or feel like making the drive you will be in for a treat. Maybe you are lucky enough to live right around the corner!!!
The portions are decent. You get bread, soup, salad etc. The salad is made well and the soups are really good. There is flavor in this food, nothing bland here. 
Writing this review I am craving it now. Why are there not a million reviews up here raving about this place?!?!?!

really good salads and wraps! the staff is okay, some of them don't want to deal with customers which is odd because this is a food service/customer service based job. it is very expensive tho. i paid $13 for a salad and i wasn't the happiest with the price but the salad was delicious! i come here once in a while, when i feel like spending a little more money on lunch

I just did the infrared sauna which felt so amazing! They have fluffy towels, robes and even have a tiny refrigerator that has cold wet wash clothes with a beautiful EO blend on them to cool down afterward! 
Then I had a colonic with Esther! I have been getting monthly colonics with her for over 6 years! She is so knowledgeable and professional! 
I just absolutely love her new Buisness she opened up! Very conveniently located, easy in/out. 
Can't wait to try the ionic foot bath!
Highly recommend this place!
Solid local restaurant that never disappoints. A little higher priced for Mexican food in town, but well worth it.

Before trying Joe's Next Door for a lunch break, I was told that the BLT would change my life. That's a pretty high bar of expectation to set, but wooooow... yeah, I loved it. 

Joe's is located right on main street in Carmel, so you can't miss it. Stop in for a wide variety of spices, sauce, frozen meals, wine, sandwiches -- and obviously, meat. 

For lunch I've opted for the BLT twice and the Cuban once. Both were delicious, but they really do work some magic on the BLT. It only takes about 5 minutes for them to make it, and the staff is very friendly. 

Be sure to grab a small bag of Broad Ripple Chip Co with your sandwich... and definitely, opt for the BLT.
Muy Bueno Comida.  I didn't have time to take a photo of the food because it was so good it was gone before I could think to snap a shot.  Great for kids too.

This is one of my all time favorite spots for a perfect Sonoran hot dog..
Clean, friendly & fast
Most of all great food

I loved the original Cafe European and was so excited when they decided to open a new location after selling the previous. This location is more cafe style- which was actually perfect bc I would always stop to pick up lunch anyway. The owners are such lovely people. Everything is homemade and tastes absolutely delicious, and I was glad to see them keep some of my favorites from the old menu (like the cilantro chicken sandwich). They're so accommodating too. They have a regular menu and specials that always sound amazing- it's so hard to choose! My only qualm is that parking in that little plaza can get terrible so sometimes I don't stop just because of parking. It isn't their fault so I didn't knock off any rating and I know they have an agreement with the lot across the street, I'm just a snob and I don't want to cross Westshore in my heels ha- but it is disappointing sometimes nonetheless.
What a concept!!! Wish we had this in Cali. We have access to some of the best food in the country in so cal and I've not seen a place like this. Amazing meatballs. Amazing service. Cool vibe.

Ok - so I was born & raised in the area but have since moved to FL ... When I get back this way, I ALWAYS get my cheesesteak fix & usually attempt to try different merchants.  Especially avoiding Pat & Geno's ... 

Let me start at my arrival.  Upon entering the establishment I was glad to see most of the tables full at 3 pm -- good sign.  

I was first in line to order ... And there were 2 gals present to assist w/ the order ... Surprisingly, I wasn't greeted or even acknowledged for 5 minutes!!!!!  The chick answered the Phone while I patiently waited ... Not even once making eye contact!!  That should've been the sign .... 

Two (2) cheesesteaks ordered; 1 American wit & 1 Provo wit/out .... They charge an extra buck for the cheese on a cheesesteak (what?!?) ... Ended up getting one as a combo which included fries & a soft-drink ... Total was $22 bucks!!  

Waited about 7 mins for my order.  Upon calling my number (same rude chick at the counter) I expressed my order was to go & politely asked for a bag ... To which her reply was, "you'll have to wait a minute!" Excuse the *^#¥ out of me ... But she did manage to hand me a bag this allowing me to bag my own food - how Customer Service is that?! 

Now on to the food review -- the sandwiches were average size.   Cheese was properly melted & distributed throughout ... The drip factor was present but the meat wasn't chopped up ... Ok, not a big deal ... But upon biting in the meat was a little chewy .... Flavor was mediocre but enough to fill the roll.  Onions had a decent flavor but that was about all I can say about that.  

Overall, I would NOT go back.  There are many better places to give your money for a better quality experience & service.   Try Campos nearby for a much better experience from friendly to quality!   In fact, I've got a better local location in Orlando, FL from a Philly transplant who opened his shop called Brianto's!!  Well worth it as he uses best quality meat & flies in Amoroso rolls to add that authentic experience!

BEST TACOS IVE EVER HAD. NOT KIDDING . They make their own tacos and everything is super duper FRESH. 

Don't be mislead by the outside appearance this place is super authentic.

If you find yourself stuck in Old City on a weekend and you are looking to dance...this is the best place to do it.  The DJ is decent and they play a good combination of pop and hip-hop hits that you can definitely boogie to.  Also the dance floor is not usually super packed and people are generally having a decent time. 

It is usually pretty dark in the whole place and I wouldn't recommend coming here to have  casual beer with your friends and chat.  This is more of a bar for the end of the night when you just want to let loose.  Drink prices are reasonable and they usually have some solid beer choices on tap.  I've never been here for the food...it feels more like a dirty dance floor club to me but I imagine it looks nice during the day too.  A very interesting building from the outside though I've seen one too many drunk girl fall down the stairs out front...

We stopped by here for dinner with some friends because the menu looked good and they have a good selection of drinks. 

The atmosphere of the place is great and fun and there's lots to look at! The service was fantastic, very efficient and our waitress was very friendly and even helped us with our meal choices as there is a lot to choose from on the menu and everything looks good. 

My husband had the Jambalaya that he said was really good, my friends husband got the Jerk Chicken which looked amazing and he said was delicious but the highlight was the Taco Salad! I got chicken and my girlfriend got beef and it comes in a huge taco she'll bowl and is filled with fresh lettuce, tomato, cheese and avocado and it was one of the best salads I've ever had. I give 5 stars just for that meal! 

It's also not too expensive so try it out with friends for a great night out.

Truthfully not as good as my first visit on opening night.  First off they were told us that they didnt have any monkey bread at 6 pm on a Monday night no worries that happens.  But all the items we ordered were just not as good.The brussel sprouts were over cooked with a little too much char on them.  The cioppino seafood also was overcooked too.  We asked if the Restaurant upstairs was open on Monday night for a night cap beacuse we dont care for Itailan wine.  Two different employee told us it was open and surprise it was closed.  dont your employees know your hours?  Service was fast and friendly.

Holy moly, this was an amazing lunch. Ordered at the bar and sat down at a booth, got the Grilled chicken mushroom and Swiss sandwich with an appetizer of chicken quesedilla egg rolls (flautas). DELICIOUS.  Shot a game of pool in the back of the bar.  21+ to enter. Great moderate noise level, friendly staff, good lighting, cleans bathrooms, stocked pool table.
This place is still amazing. I'm. I'm unsure what else to add.

I wish I had thought twice before signing a year contract. From the beginning they tried to upsell me on various training programs which were quite costly. I found that parking was difficult if not impossible  at the 12th street location. When I tried the spring garden club, the fellow next to me on the treadmill had a loud phone conversation and the staff did nothing to stop him. Getting out of contract  is a $50 charge and a thirty day notice totaling $100. All in all, I went twice and paid $550. If you think this club might be for you, try it for a month before making a long term commitment. They have a strong sales pitch and from what I found seemed more interested in emptying my bank account with different tiered clubs and fancy plans. I was definitely not their audience and have found decent gyms with better parking for a fraction of the prices they charge.

UPDATE: 7/10/2019

Today I got a burger with American cheese, bacon, and extra onions. I've got to say, I have found my new favorite burger place and that goes for all of US as far as I'm concerned. I don't know what they put in it but it's got me coming back for more.
Just look at the photo and you can see the pickles are perfectly sliced thin, crispy, they're not too thick, the onions are sliced perfect, tomatoes are sliced perfect and all laid out in the right order. The shredded lettuce is just enough to hold it all together and keep things from sliding off. The buns are toasted perfectly. All together every bite was great. I hate when you buy a meal like a burger and every other bite, or only three or four bites, are good. Every bite of this burger was balanced with everything. That's a hard thing to do.
Keep up the good work!

Ok, I do not understand how this place receives 3.5 stars. 
Staff are amazingly friendly and professional. Food is fantastic. Easy in and out. Big diverse menu. Real quality meat. What else could you ask for?
I have hade the classic cheesesteak with extra cheese about 7 times now. Always great. Hot, fresh, packed with yumminess.
I tried the French Dip recently and it's now my absolute fav in Boise area. The AuJus is rich and piping hot. Good flavor, not watered down. 
I will share a "mishap" that happened yesterday though. 
I ordered this sandwich and got something that didn't even look close to what I had last time. Meat was fine, as usual, but the provolone cheese was grated and lumpy. WHAAAAAT?!?! No go. 
I took it up to the counter and explained politely that doesn't even look good. 
They gasped exactly as I did then after apologizing hurriedly remade a new one. They explained why that happened, which usually I don't care about but because I really like this operation I appreciated, then brought me my delicious masterpiece. 
Ok, maybe not masterpiece but it was fabulous. Juicy, cheesy, bread was so soft and lightly toasted it was as if it came out of the oven two mins prior. SO fresh. 
Incredible meal. 
Don't forget to get a frequent buyer card and always ask for your military discount (if applicable). They'll ask for proof so no fakeys or posers. 
Get ther
Enjoy

First time in Nashville and was recommended to check this spot out. Awesome casual cantina feel and stellar tacos. Cash only so come prepared, but well worth the visit if you are craving some delicious tacos. Amazing value for great food.

Was looking for something good to eat and Peí Wei hit the mark. Peí Wei is awesome as far as airport food goes. Everything was delicious and well prepared. Service was excellent. Great dining experience.

My daughter attended summer horse camp here- we picked it because it was closest to our house, but we love it! It's a shady ranch and the owner is super friendly and makes you feel like part of the family. Loved the dogs running around  (Veeda was my favorite) We we're impressed with the level of training they gave and they even provided snacks and breaks during the daily trail rides. I look forward to going back for a sunset trail ride myself!

This was my first wine bar after moving from Atlanta to St Pete. What makes this place so freakin awesomely versital is the layout and multiple seating options. It has a nice but small bar around the bartendar that seats about 10 people. It has another ledge and stool chairs that acts as a bar (but no bartender there). It has multiple tables and sitting areas to accomodate groups of people. And it has a couple of handsome sofas (and not something that looks like it wasa reject picked up on frat row) that allow for an intimate experience that great for a date where you could actually carry on a conversation. They even have a very small patio area too - only big enough for a small group though.

There are waiters assigned to the seating areas, so this is not one of those help-yourself to a wine spout on the wall establishments. They also have beer here if you want to be that way but no open bar. 

The reason I chose this as the first wine bar was because it did look elegant and not like some hole in the wall but also b/c it was the only one open until Midnight on a Friday. Most of the other wine bars in the area close at 10pm! Wussies. 10pm is a pathetic closing hour for a wine bar on a Friday night.


What also makes this place kinda cool and they seem to always have events or specials or something going on here. From the calendars I've seen they seem to consistently have a "SUPER" happy hour every last Friday of the month that last from 4pm to Midnight.

My only complaint was the music. No, the volume was fine; it was suicide-inducing theme that ran with every song selction. You know - sad Adel songs, Bruno Mars songs and the like. I'm like - are they purposely playing these depressing tunes to engage you to drown more of your sorrows in more wine?

We'd go back though. Hopefully Pandora or whatever they decide to play will be less depressing.

Just left this Kroger and revived very poor customer service as family was trying to do the scan as you go service and a lady was very rude to my family and I instead of trying to help us she was horribly rude. Then turned around and was nice to the next customer she helped I am in the hospitality industry and was appalled with the service received.
This is an updated review after trying their gluten-free shroom burger and fries. The gluten-free bun was thick and soft, but a bit crumbly. The fries were very good. Overall great GF burger.
Considering this is actually a chain, their pizza is fairly decent. They have a very thin crust option and the prices are reasonable.

This store is definitely a store for high schoolers who need books off their book list for the semester. (They also have a used book section that is quite limited - more mystery and romance books than straight up lit.) The books are organized just like the bookstore I used to grab books at when I was a high school student. I still would have bought a book anyway (some books that high school students are assigned are great books! Amerika by Kafka? Never read it. Should read it.), BUT they are cash only! At a book store!! Where a typical purchase is probably more than $10! But cash only. So I put my books back, apologized for not having cash, and walked out (probably never to return). If you're a high school student near Franklin or a parent of such a student, this store is probably great (so long as you have cash on you), but for regular readers/book lovers, it's not a great store. B&N in Cool Springs or Landmark Booksellers are probably better options.

It was my first time in Nashville and Rae's was the first restaurant I stopped at and can now say, I made a good decision. The staff is friendly, knows regulars by name and order, though welcome newcomers and make recommendations upon request. Conversation is abundant here, as friends, not as staff and guests. And the food matches the service; my choice was the wicked chicken- flavorful with soft bread...so good! If you are downtown looking for lunch, Rae's is your place.

Well, the low stars may be our own fault. We didn't realize they aren't always open and we came during low-season. So, when we went in the only options for us to choose from were ribs and pulled pork. We also got the baked beans and cole slaw.

The ribs were good, very moist. The pulled pork was nothing special. We did like the hot BBQ sauce (mild was very bland), and the sides we ordered. They felt bad they were out of all their food and did throw in extra ribs and pulled pork to help make up for it. Because of their great service, we will definitely come back during a busier time (maybe Summer?) and give them another shot!

Home away from home, Fat Dan's is one of my favorites! 

Love the bartenders, love the wings, Wednesday's they have a killer meatloaf sandwich, great rotating craft beer selection and of course all of the Chicago sports games your heart desires!

Go Cubs!
Amazing. I have never had a better Reuben in my life. These guys are awesome. I highly highly recommend them and am looking forward to returning for something tasty,
Guided me in then left me there without acknowledgement for so long that I left. Will stick to Woodbury location.

I want to apologize as I begin this review because I know some people put some time and money into opening this restaurant, and they could stand to lose it just from the words I say.  But, every business, even restaurants, must offer a reasonable amount of merchantability with their product, and we did not find this here.
