It basically was an open roll. All the tomatoes and onions rolled off the top. The roasted peppers embedded in the sandwich were very good. 
The bacon cheese fries, I wouldn't give to my pups. The cheese was very lumpy and thick, the bacon was very greasy and flabby and the French fries themselves were very soggy.  I can't believe people actually order these. 

Like I mentioned before, maybe this was a bad day for Pudges, but after reading all the raves from here, I definitely expected something edible and good.

Ive been to a lot of Millers being that I live in the Fort Lauderdale area.  This one is great, super clean, beautiful. Food was awesome!  Omg, the french dip, unreal! Our bartender Ashley was great, knew the menu, had great opinions, I wish this place was near my house!  Bravo!

I love this place. I have eaten in and taken out and the quality is excellent.  Great guacamole, excellent burritos, and the taco sampler is a great value.  I have only ever seen one waitress working at a time, so it can be slow at times...you just have to know what you are getting yourself into.  BYO and be patient, its worth it.

Great Priceline price of $55/night! Location is centrally located near train stations, Chinatown, The Trocadero, across street from Reading Market. Bed was comfy, bathroom spacious compared to comparable hotels. For your convenience, there's an airport shuttle departing every half hour for only $12, great if you have luggage.

I've been to Urban Farmer twice and my only gripe is the service (hence the four out of five stars). My first visit was spent at the bar area where I waited 15 minutes to order a drink! Then another 15 minutes to get a menu. Mind you it was a Tuesday night and they were not busy at all! Maybe I should sit in the middle of the bar as opposed to the side but regardless, patrons should never have to wait that long to be served... Or acknowledged. For my second visit, I decided to take my sister and her husband to dine in. We were seated right away. Awesome. We were offered bread! Hell yes we want bread! You would think the bread would come right away but it didn't. It actually came out with our appetizers.... No big deal though. Our main courses also came shortly after. I can continue to complain about the service but it really wasn't completely terrible. 

Overall, I think the place is amazing! I am also obsessed with the interior design... I seriously could live there! 

So let's talk food. Everything I had was amazing! I ordered the duck and my sister and her hubby ordered the steak sampler to share. We also ordered brussels, mushrooms, butternut squash,  foie gras and bone marrow to share. Out of all the appetizers, I enjoyed the foie gras and marrow the most... but everything was just delicious! If you're a big meat eater, I suggest ordering the steak sampler! Worth the money! For my next visit, I'm going to go for the cheese cart and some dessert!

This is not only a great place for locals to dine, but a place tourists or guests at the Logan Hotel can appreciate. 

Can't wait to go back!

Three Sixty is a great place for drinks and appetizers with spectacular views and good ambiance. I've been there about a dozen times. I've used valet every time. The reason for my negative review, however, is that on my last visit, the valet driver damaged by vehicle and did not say anything to me. It wasn't as if they didn't know they did it - they hit the frame directly and hard. And my vehicle which is only a few months old stays parked in my garage all day every day. I wash it twice a week. I know exactly when the damage happened. I called the hotel and asked for the valet manager. Someone took a written message yet no response was received from the valet manager. I called again, asking for the valet manager, and had to leave a voice mail. Again, no response was received. That's poor business etiquette and shows apathy towards a good customer. The reputation of Three Sixty is highly tarnished in my mind. The date of the incident was April 3, 2013.


Update, July 2013:

After posting this, the valet manager did call me and they rectified the situation completely. Today will be the first time I've visited Three Sixty since the incident.

The small plates were delicious, the service was amazing and the decor is very cool. ( I love the giant Ganesh in the doorway). My only complaint has to do with the desserts. The fruit plate was uninspired and the rose ice cream tasted like bubble bath.

Initially when we moved it in seemed great, till move in day. Cheap paint, cheap everything. Floor is peeling up by their fake wood, which they will most likely try to charge us for even though it was like that the day we moved in. But that little compared to other issues.

Since day one my wife and I experienced humidity levels in the 75-80% range. I told management a total of 3 times, which they never did anything about, because why would they do their job? The result of the humidity was MOLD starting to grow on decorations we have, which we ended up throwing out. The response I got from the complex was "buy a dehumidifier" or "change the ac unit". The ac units in the building are oversized ptac units which result in little to no dehumidification because they only sense dry bulb temps. Mix that with the cheap windows (I feel the draft coming in, plus a consistency of spiders I find in my apartment). Management said they would "check on the humidity issue" which they never have. And to management, the issue is fine now BECAUSE it's winter and there's a lack of humidity in the air. So that you for your "concern". But this will become an issue again in the summer. If you like to sleep comfortable do not live here. I can only imagine mold growing inside the walls this summer and us getting charged for it. 

Next issue,

My wife had been contacting the lady in the management office (I call her out because I don't know her name and she is the only one my wife has contacted) for our utility bill because we like to pay our bills on time. 2 months later it took a negative yelp review from her (which she took down because she is nice and the other lady who comments on these yelp reviews asked her to in exchange to waive the previous months utility bills we were waiting on). They finally sent us a bill, which was not waived, and as my wife fulfilled her end the manager who said she would waive it did not. We have all this communication in writing, and I might take this to court just for principle, because my wife also emailed her 4 times for verification the utility has been waived, but my wife has been ignored ever since she removed her yelp review (which is why I am doing one now). 

I have also been waiting for a parking pass for almost 2 months. The only reason that vehicle hasn't been towed is because security now knows my work vehicle. 

If possible this would be zero star rating for this "complex". But because I can't, I guess the positive star goes to the front desk staff and security because they're always friendly and ACTUALLY DO THEIR JOB. Maintenance as well, they always do their job well. 

This is not all the issues I have just some of them. I would not recommend to move into this place. We are almost sure we will not be renewing our lease due to the multiple failures of management, and "upper management". 

To the lady who comments on the yelp reviews and lied to my wife, you can be sure this review will not be edited or removed. Y'all have lied to us entirely too much for you to be trusted. And I have all your communication with my wife in writing too, which I may use as evidence. But for the time being, we are just going to pay our bills on time. And management stop giving my wife dirty looks or ignoring her because she called you out. 

Do not be fooled by the mimosas and smiles when you come in and look. The leasing office didn't even know the place takes money orders for rent payment (because paying online they just steal more money from you).

Orlando gave my family horrible costumer service. Not to mention the company LIES in order to make money from customers in need. My stepdad went in to see what was wrong with his car, and was told he needed his alternator replaced. Firestone wanted to charge $150 for labor and over $300 for the part. We found the part listed for cheaper elsewhere and asked if they could just do the labor if we brought in our own part, they said YES but that labor would be $160.
As soon as we actually purchase the part and headed into Firestone for the labor, they changed their mind and said they could not do the labor unless the part was purchased there. That is a total lie and a scam! Horrible customer service and company policy. I am appalled and this company should not still be in business.

Due to how close we are and the limited options  for dining in our area we have been going to Merryman's on Main Street in Pitman.  It is in an old bank but has plenty of outside dining.   I don't know when Pitman stopped being a dry town so this is the first restaurant/bar in the town that we know of. The service is very good, the menu diverse and their beer selection includes local brews.  I would have given 5 stars were it not for the high prices.  We paid $17.00 for a flatbread pizza which did taste very good.  The wings are $14 for 8 split wings, once again done very well and tasty but a bit pricey.  My hope is that these prices are in effect to allow them to stay in business during the pandemic and employ people in a newer establishment but these prices may stop repeat customers.  We have been there three times, we love the ambiance but paying center city prices in this area is tough.
Hey just moved back to area..Good basic pie..I will be back..Fair price and cooked with love
Amazing food. We got the dry rub ribs and burnt ends and they were both amazing! Their rub is on point. Also got the pulled pork and macaroni and cheese and just as good. This is my new bbq joint!

Slow. Slow. Slow. We came in based off reviews on Yelp. It was 11 am, no other customers. Our server came right up to ask us for drinks. It was super cold and I asked for a hot drink with something fun in it, she said let me check with the bartender. I heard her ask and then they gave her a hard time with recommendations. She never came back with suggestions on what we could order for drinks. Then she disappeared for at least 15 min. No one came over during that time. We were just about to leave when finally the bartender came out to ask us what we wanted. Really?! We already told the girl and you were the one giving her lip. It was so cold outside and we really wanted to warm up so we just ordered two coffees and a shot of Kailua, $17!? Another 10 min later our drinks came. We wanted to eat but after how long the drinks took we decided coffee was it. Unbelievable poor service. We're on our way to K-Paul's for lunch instead. Management should be ashamed of that kind of service.
First time there-very fast service and good food!  Had my five year old and 19 month old-staff was very friendly and accommodating with the kids.  Big food for reasonable prices. Reuben was awesome!

It's a bit hard to find in the shopping center but certainly more than worth it! We had an excellent afternoon tea. I also had the tomato soup, which was lovely. The shop is charming, and the service is good. The tea selection was impressive. I'm looking forward to my next visit.
To expensive for bowling! I'm glad lazer tag was included in the all inclusive price. The drinks were a lil whack, but overall had a Good time with my family.

I was driving by and I stopped in for a slice.  The service was excellent. The pizza is probably one of the best that I have had in Reno.  The chef made the crust crispy and the Italian sausage was awesome.  I am going back there for lunch tomorrow
Lots of upside potential here if they can pull it together. Dined w three for lunch, food was tasty and fresh. I will try again in a couple weeks.
Great flavor, maybe the best southwest food I ever tasted. Fish taco is absolutely delicious. And the chicken tortilla soup - wow!

We ate there Saturday night. The bartender was good and gave advice. The menu is small, but we tried most of the items and they were all excellent. The kitchen did a fantastic of pacing our food our so we didn't feel rushed.  Overall great place for a group, romantic dinner or simply if you want excellent "fancy" food.
Went to the show over Memorial Day weekend and had a wonderful time. Superb vendors and stores, great staff, delicious BBQ, and overall lots of fun!

Went here for lunch after walking out of restaurant across the street. Service was quick, friendly. Had the fruit tea, nice. The sweet potato with coconut was nice. All the other food lacked seasoning. Not true Caribbean flavors, the chicken was tasteless, seasoning  wasn't there.The black bean and corn salad dish too lacked flavor, needed lime juice, ginger, curry, something to pick up the flavor.The jerk sauce although nice was/is not true jerk. The corn muffins were a bit dry.  With the right chef this place could be great. Decor, service, price all were great.. just need a chef to update the ingredients on the menu items

It want to busy when we went at 11 am on a Friday, and there were only 2 wait staff on, despite about 12 tables being full. Service, however, was prompt, friendly, and over all left a good taste in my mouth. Unfortunately, the food did not. I must say, they have some of the best priced big dishes in town. $10.99 for 3 eggs Benedict and a heaping pile of what could have been delicious potatoes. But, I guess what they do is not purchase, or use, seasoning in the kitchen. They also don't believe in proper plating. 8 thick, full spears of asparagus (slightly under done) was the bed on which my 3 perfectly poached, yet cold, eggs were placed on.

Stopped by today for a Reuben & Cuban sandwich.  They were ok.  Better than average but not nearly as good as some of my favorite sandwich shops.  I'd return again if I was in Dogtown, but if I was to go out of my way, I'd drive to Fozzie's, 9th Street Deli, Adriannas, or Blues City first.

I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.

You pay $30 for two giant deli sandwiches, with $1.50 premium for sweet potato fries.

The quality and quantity of the food justifies the price, but there's just nothing about this that makes me want to come back. The food, the interior, the wait time, the service: nothing was bad or good.

If I had to go again I wouldn't complain but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Up until today I thought Eiffel was a pretty cool club CONSIDERING it's New Orleans and most of the clubs are not well regulated and are too smokey. - after co collaborating with a goof friend, it was decided that we rent the VIP section for her Graduation party. The section was $350 and we rented two. Fine. It came with 2 bottles of Ciroc- blah blah. Well when we arrived, we also had food trays for our guests to be placed on the tables in the section we paid $700 for. When we arrived, the we asked the Manager Rife Whiting if we could bring the trays. He replied "no problem. Place them on your tables in your section." Somewhere between transferring the trays in and walking past him again, he said "well there's really no food policy. We've never allowed food. It's $20 per tray". Mind you, we had 5 trays in our section. I turned and said, "$700 for the section and another $100 for the trays? If there isn't a food policy, where did this fee come from?" I kid you not-- he told me, "well I'm the manager and I can make up whatever I want to when I want to and if you dont want to pay this fee you can either take your food back to your car or I will take it for you." --- at that point. The situation escalated and my friends had to calm me down. That's bogus. It's not even about the made up fee but the tone and abuse of position. That was the last time Eiffel will ever be recommended by me.

The star rating does not go high enough for this delightful dining experience. This was amazing food cooked with love and joy. Everything was perfect and amazing don't plan on a rush visit this food is meant to be savored

I would like to apologize for my previous review as it turned out the owner was running late and did arrive shortly after I sent the review. My Mom and myself were upset making the trip to find the store closed since I had not been able to take my Mom since May. 

I thought I deleted the negative review but had not. The owner was very courteous helping both my Mom and another customer at the same time. She was very patient and trimmed the wig to my Mom's satisfaction. Wig World has a wonderful selection and I would recommend them to anyone in need of a wig.

Went here for lunch today after years and it didn't disappoint, food very incredible! The toasted coconut marg is delicious and the cauliflower tacos are AMAZING! Best cauliflower I've had restaurant wise. Can't wait to go back

We went through the drive through at 9:15pm and their signs say they close at 10pm. There were 8 employees in the window that we could see and some even looked at us in our car and pretended they didn't see us!!!! What? We waited and then just went somewhere else. They were all just sitting around talking. Are you open or not??

Recently purchased a king size bed from Ricardo and Lee. Both of these gentlemen were extremely knowledgeable about the beds in the store and helped us to pick the right bed for our comfort and budget. They also made sure that we got the best deal possible. This is the second bed we purchased here and would recommend them to all of our friends and family.

If it's not the usps not delivering, how about this one. Package was supposed to be delivered yesterday to our home. No door tag on my door. My girlfriend made arrangements to leave work so she could be home at the delivery time of 10:30 am today. When I left for work at 10:00 am, there was a door tag on the door ACROSS from my door!!! So not only did my gf race home for nothin there was no delivery!!! No door tag on my door, no package. Get this, they stated we need an adult signature which is why we needed to be home. But last time we got this delivery it was left in a secure pickup box similar to an amazon storage self pick up. Why do we need a signature this time beats the hell outta me. 
WTF!!! Good one FedEx

This place has a great drink selection and wonderful food. The service was very good - friendly and attentive. My server, I unfortunately don't remember her name, gave me useful suggestions. I had the roasted duck and chevre salad. It was amazing! I generally don't eat all of the food I order, and I would have licked the bowl if I thought no one would notice. Highly recommend.
The pork and chive dumplings were delicious. The noodle soup wasn't too salty and the greens in the soup were flavorful. The service was fast and casual. Great experience!

Came here with a group of 5 to have a rather late dinner - not a lot of places were still open.

We had a mix of drinks, burgers, sandwiches and salads.

Was it remarkably great? No. Was it great for the price/size/location? Totally! If I was looking for a late-ish night meal I'd be happy to come back.
The salads are so good! Fresh ingredients. You pick what you want on it. Surreal is so nice- the whole staff is friendly! Mango dressing is amazing. The turkey chili is on point as well.

No drinks special. No free wifi (it says on their site and ad) slow service.  Food is ok nothing special.  Came here because a friend wants to watch greenbay game. Beers here are flat.  Taste like overnight left over beers.  Over all. Don't come here unless you have to  watch games that's not on tv.
Impact Carpet Cleaning did wonders to our carpets! We hired them twice for our last apartment and our house. They made our carpets look brand new. I would definitely hire them again!!

Normally my experience here is amazing; however today it was horrible. We were told that our wait would be 20 mins but it was a lot longer. My husband decided to walk to grab champagne. He wasn't gone long at all, but they kept putting people in front of us because he wasn't here. I was here and we told her he was leaving, that was her opportunity to tell us that the entire party had to be here to be seated. When I addressed it she was rude and condescending. I hope that the managers will take time to teach their staff customer service. This was a bad experience and I'm highly disappointed because I love Sabrina's.

I would give this spot a 3.75/5.00 if possible. Since I can't, I rounded up to 4.00/5.00 for the delicious wine and great atmosphere.

On my visit to Nashville, a friend who has lived in Nashville for 3 years suggested going to Rumours. It is labeled a Wine Bar for a reason - the waitress recommended a medium body French Pinot Noir that was easy to drink and did not break the bank. The wine went down like water, resulting in splitting two bottles between two people.

We paired the wine with the cheese plate, the meatballs, & the mussel bowl with spaghetti. The cheese plate came with four wedges of cheese, including a delicious goat cheese, tomato marmalade, nuts, and an array of bread and crackers. I enjoyed all of the cheeses, except the Dijon, and would recommend asking to substitute this cheese for an additional goat cheese or the server's suggestion.

The mussel bowl came fresh to order in a white wine & capers sauce topped with feta cheese. I will most definitely order this plate on my next visit to Rumours and highly recommend it to any guest.

Lastly, the meatballs were tasty but tiny. I expected the serving size of 4 meatballs as it was on under the small plates section on the menu. I was surprised that the 4 meatballs were roughly 1 inch in diameter. Still, the carrot-apple-fennel slaw complement the dish perfectly. At $8 a plate, I would suggest a try if you like meatballs but recommend ordering at least 2 for tables of more than 2 people.

Two bottles and a few small plates later, we stumbled out vowing to revisit the next time that I visit. I hope to go back when the weather is a nicer to sit in the gorgeous outside area.

Horrible customer service.  Customers should be allowed to try on another size.  The sales associate actually refused to get me another size, which is not what I have experienced at other stores.  I wasn't asking for anything out of the ordinary, I only took in 2 bras and wanted ONE of them in a different size.  The store wasn't busy so I don't understand her reluctance. You can give me advice on how it should fit, but don't make me stand there peeking out of the fitting room doorway, half dressed, trying to justify why I just want to *try* the next size up.  I know how I want my lingerie to fit and will go elsewhere where I won't be put in such a humiliating situation.

A little place to grab a quick slice and for $1.25 you can't beat it. Fast, convenient and cheap plus the pizza is actually good. The owner is an old school Italian kinda guy and I had the joy of shooting the shit with him while he heated the slice up. In this day and age these kind of places are far and beyond getting harder to find but look past the low key interior the rough edges on the place just remember $1.25 a slice.

Holy crap, we had an awesome time here. We did the $35 customized lunch and got a lot of special attention. The chef (Yun) was from Puerto Rico but had spent time in NC and we talked some about that. The sushi started out terrific and just got more creative and tasty from there. The flavor combinations were not only creative, but sensibly ordered so that they complemented eachother, culminating in what felt like a gourmet meal from appetizer to dessert. The slightly odd feeling of sitting at a campus dining hall take away counter at Penn State quickly diminished as we realized we were getting the best seats and the best deal in the house. We might as well have been out for a nice dinner.

I just leased a 2017 Jeep Wrangler Unlimited. The salesman was great.  Service, not so!  On a side note, I love how the manufacturer sends out a survey within days of buying a vehicle wanting to know how much you love the vehicle.  Not just jeep but they all do it.  I always respond with...give me 6 months to a year so I can drive it in different conditions.  Then I'll let you know.  I never respond with "I love it" in the first few days.  On my drive home from the dealership I noticed an excessive amount of wind noise coming from the passenger side roof area.  I know this vehicle isn't aerodynamic so don't go there. I understand! But the noise on the passenger side was far more noisy than the driver side.  So, I decided I was going to take it back to have it checked.  In the meantime, the blinker that is supposed to blink three times automatically when you move the lever up or down (not locked) worked intermittently.  Most of the time it did blink three times but occasionally it would only blink once.  So, I added this to the list.  They kept it for two days.  Famous quote..."nothing is wrong".  So I asked, what did you do for two days.  The answer;  We drove it and the wind noise is normal and the blinker never malfunctioned. So I asked, do you believe me that the blinker occasionally malfunctions or do you think I'm making this up?  They said they believe me.  I asked: So if it did malfunction when you were driving it what action would you take?  It was like a dear looking at me in the headlights.  A blank stare.  He finally said he'd have to call technical service.  I asked why he didn't do that in the first place?  He said he had to diagnose it.  I asked, rather sarcastically, did you have some diagnostic equipment connected while driving it so that if it did happen you could troubleshoot it?  He said no, they just need to see it.  Unbelievable!  He said, as long as it doesn't happen for him, there is nothing wrong.  So, reluctantly on my part, we moved on to the wind noise.  Again, he said there was nothing wrong but...they put down a bead of silicone.  I asked why?  If there is nothing wrong, why put down a bead of silicone?  Because we felt it might help.  If there is nothing wrong and its, as you say, normal, why put down a bead of silicone?  Is there a problem or not?  No problem, we just decided to put down a bead of silicone.  A couple of weeks later (4th of July) I ran my jeep through a car wash in West Chester.  Within an hour, and on a 90+ degree day the A/C unit malfunctioned. Air flow went to a minimum.  I changed fan speed and while I could hear the fan increase in speed there was no change in output.  Minimal air flow and the vehicle started getting hot.  After about an hour and a half of this it finally began running properly again.  I called the dealership and told them what happened.  The answer, unless it does it for us we can't do anything about it.  Are you serious?  Are there louvers in the duct work?  Could one of them have gotten stuck?  Is there an area where water from a car wash could have affected or gotten into something to cause this?  Again, where is the diagnostics in all of this?  Simple answer is always, unless it happens for us we can't do anything about it.  Most frustrating group I've ever dealt with.  I HATE THIS JEEP and the fact there is not one competent person to work on it or someone who will take the initiative to diagnose the issues.  Worst purchase I ever made and what makes it so difficult is now that the sale is done, no one cares!  No one!  Oh, but the survey's keep coming.  Such a joke, an absolute joke.  Oh, to top it off, I was told to take it to David's Jeep in Glen Mills.  Perhaps they can find the problem.  Now that's a comforting thought. Just pass the problem on to someone else and in the meantime I'm having to run all over the place.  Never again.

Three out of four times I came for servicing (oil change, tire replacement, and inspection) I had an early morning appointment and was told they probably couldn't get the job done....it got done, but took several hours. Today, I went in for oil change (no appointment) ready to drop my car off for the day and was told (after waiting in line for 25 min) that there were no available appointments for 3 days. This location clearly can't handle basic servicing, so they surly won't  have to worry about my car anymore.

Mediocre service at best, pretty decent French food though. 

Upon arriving to the restaurant you are greeted by a large sign in the middle of the walkway that says "Please seat yourself." I typically have no issue with places that ask you to seat yourself, in fact, I rather enjoy picking my own seat. However, I wasn't greeted by an actual person for 10 minutes after finding a seat. 

When I was finally welcomed the person brought me water and took my order for coffee which she promptly returned with then told me someone would be along shortly to take my order. 

...10 more minutes pass before a waiter comes to take my order. Keep in mind that the restaurant was only 50% full when I came in to eat. 

The food came out promptly after ordering as a nice change of pace and was pretty good. Not the best Croque Madame I've had but certainly not the worst either. 

If they improved their service I would be tempted to return.

I was disappointed for sure!  My mother and I went because we share a love for flowers and we hoped to buy some bulbs, flowers and get ideas for  planting.  Instead we learned about cookware, jewelry cleaner, beds (for sleeping not gardening), and many more gimmicks that "travel the country doing this".....Their words, not mine! Many of them didn't even have marketing material, just a promise for warranty.  I am giving this 2 stars because I was able to enjoy time with my Mom and did get one idea for landscaping otherwise it would be 1.  Unfortunately, I will not be attending this again and will be happy to spread my experience so no one else wastes an afternoon!

SO. FLAVORFUL. O.M.G.

Heard about The Pepper Pott on Yelp and after seeing pictures on Instagram, I had to try it asap! Especially love that they have contactless ordering and curbside pickup! Super easy online ordering/payment and pick up was quick and ready when promised. Everything was neatly packed and the food was still warm by the time we drove back home to eat. There's no indoor seating, it's a takeaway set up, but we saw a few other patrons eating in their parked cars. Service was very friendly and the guy who helped us wore a mask. 

On our first trip, we ordered the jerk chicken and curry chicken. Both were excellent! Hubby described the jerk chicken as "fall off the bone." Our sides were fried plantains, 4 cheese baked mac, veggie fried rice and rice & peas. All were tasty, but the plantains were the standout for me. We also tried one each of the pastries: pine tart (pineapple filling), ground beef patty and 4 cheese roll. Again, all were delicious! They threw in a caribbean lemonade and sorrel (hibiscus tea) that were the perfect things to top off our meals! 

In addition to their standard menu, The Pepper Pott offers rotating specials, which are announced on their Instagram along with pictures to make your mouth water. Some of the specials have been jerk salmon, bake & salt fish and curry goat. 

Definitely give this family-run small business a try!!
The food was very good. The onion pedals were phenomenal and service was good. Recommended coming here.

The veterinary art hospital is simply AMAZING. Our pup has stage 1 IVDD and wasn't voiding and we took him in and they treated him immediately and showed us how to handle the situation at home. The young Vet who helped us couldn't be more patient and answer all our questions and explain everything thoroughly.   

I can't say enough about this group.  Thank you so so much for your professionalism, and empathy!!!!   Thank you from Sully  and his family.

I needed to renew my contact lens prescription. I called this office to get a quote, and they told me with my insurance it will be $10. I explicitly asked: "are you sure? is the contact lens exam included?" and I got "yes". Guess what? After the visit i was billed for $85. On top of the contact lens exam being not included, they added some other services without asking me first.

Aaand, upon paying that bill, two weeks down the road, I still haven't got my prescription! The doctor couldn't write it because I did not remember the diameter that I typically wear (you would think paying for a  "contact lens fitting exam" would imply they have some lens to fit - but no, they do NOTHING). When I emailed that information to the office, I didn't get a reply for a week. When I finally called they told I should go and download it from the patient portal. I still cannot log into the portal because they apparently did not enter my information correctly. Bracing myself for another round of calls.

Do you ever feel like sometimes you were born inside The Matrix? While everyone one else's brain is receiving signals that say the food is juicy and delicious, all you taste is 'a single cell protein combined with synthetic aminos, vitamins, and minerals... everything the body needs' but taste buds don't desire.


THE SCENE

I read the reviews and came here with the highest of expectations. Immediately this place began to sweet talk me. I saw the meat smoker, which was a huge turn on! The sides were open exposing delicious pink meats being slow cooked right in front of my eyes like a sexy dance! I also saw the real wood stacked out back below a large tree with branches full of REAL LIVE chickens... yes I said chickens! (BTW the way, did anyone else know chickens climb trees or am I still inside the Matrix?) As a final act of foreplay, the interior decor was just right, like candles burning around a hot bubble bath. It had that seductive gritty down home feeling I like when enjoying BBQ. The only thing missing from this BBQ romance was blues music playing live!

The chef allowed me to sample several items since I just couldn't decide what I wanted my sides to be. They'd run out of mac n' cheese, which would have been my first preference, however, the collard greens and chicken n' rice were amazing! This took my BBQ expectations even higher as I anticipated a foodgasm once I got my hands on the pork ribs I ordered. Unfortunately, this romance was not meant to be.


THE FOOD

The ribs were smoked to the point of tasting like cigarette ashes. I've learned since being  an active yelper than many people crave this type of smoky flavor, but it was just too much for my extremely picky BBQ palette. I would much rather have well seasoned meat with just a kiss of smoke than eat meat that should probably have a surgeon general warning label!

I also don't care for BBQ sauce. If the meat is well seasoned, to me sauce is unnecessary. Yet I found myself drowning these ribs in sauce to hopefully compensate for the ashy flavor. I emptied an entire table bottle on my order, and still with little desire to eat them, I threw away my leftovers later that evening. Other items to my disliking include the potato salad and baked beans. Growing up my mother used brown sugar to sweeten her beans and that is the flavor I'm used to, but these beans tasted of syrup or molasses, which I did not enjoy. They were also practically as thick as peanut butter.


FINAL THOUGHTS

I'm not sure why people find this place to be worthy of 5 stars, but I most definitely do not. This brief encounter felt very much like being in a relationship where everyone tells you how great the person is before you meet them. When you finally do meet them, they are presentable, attractive and say all the right things. However, in the end, they just don't perform!

I'm breaking up with you Al's Finger Licking Good Bar-B-Que I didn't lick my fingers, not even once.


SIDE NOTE - This review should really be a 2.5, but I really liked the staff. They were accommodating, hospitable and kind. Not to mention the chicken n' yellow rice was simply amazing! So I have chosen to round up instead of down.


2016/4

Not a huge fan of chains but these guys got a good thing going. Straight up food tasted better than every other PE I've eaten at. Excellent pride of ownership. You could could tell they care and are trying hard. A smiling face always makes the food taste better. I like the vibe here! Way to care about your food!

I have never been to a barber before. I dyed my hair and beard so I used to go to a salon. I went on vacation to Orlando and I visited my first barber ever. I was amazed so as soon as I got back to Indy I decided to look for a barber. It took me 3 barber shops later (not great experiences) and I ended up at Commisary recommended by at least 6 people and telling me : get Phil Get Phil !!! 
So I was like fine I'll get Phil. First of all Phil is booked like 2 months , and I was thinking that could be very good or very bad. I finally got an appointment. That was about six months ago. Since that first haircut Phil has been my barber every other week. I mean .. not even kidding. And sometimes I even go once a week. The feeling of professionalism is outstanding. You can see the people coming out of the barber shop looking Sharp!!!
Everyone is extremely cool , they are all super good and you feel always very welcomed. My hair is always on point , my beard is perfect!! 
And is a plus you can have a Espresso or a beer there . 
Cons:
They don't do color , I tried everything to convince them . So I still go to the salon to get my color and then I get my haircut there. Doesn't bother me. Still worth it.

Neat PopUp in Gravois Park. Interesting spin on Indian food. Delicious and fresh!

Menu is divided into small plates, medium plates, and big plates. The small plates are pretty big, and the 1/2 order of tandoori chicken wings was more than I could eat by myself. The bell puri was a real treat and I highly recommend it. Any of the curries can be ordered as a smaller portion for only $6 on the mid section as "The Little Plate."
This is burger king wide, not just this location. The impossible burgers are NOT vegan. They are vegetarian. They contain egg.

This place advertises thirty-minute oil changes. So I made an appointment for 9am. Three hours and fifteen minutes later they were finally done. Need I say more? Okay, I'll break it down for you. I arrived at my 9am appointment about five minutes early. The person at the service desk said, "It'll be just a couple of minutes. I've got a mechanic who is finishing up and you'll be next." So far, so good. Unfortunately, that's where the 'so good' ends. One hour and fifteen minutes later, finally, a mechanic comes to the parking lot to get my vehicle. He backs out of the parking space, and starts forward. A person from the service desk comes outside and stops the mechanic. After a brief conversation, the mechanic pulls my vehicle back into a parking space, gets out, goes inside and gets the keys and paperwork to another  vehicle, and pulls it in and works on it. To make matters worse, when the mechanic pulled my vehicle back into a parking spot...it was a handicap parking spot. There is nothing about me, or my vehicle that's handicapped. it disgust me when I see people parking in handicap space when they are not handicap. Yet, my vehicle sits in a handicap space thanks to the mechanic, who was pulled out of my vehicle to work on another. What happened to, "You're next", and "It'll be just a couple of minutes"? At this point, I'm about to 'blow a gasket', as the saying goes. Rather than create a disturbance inside their business, I decided to take out my frustrations here at the keyboard. So here I am. Besides, I wanted to see how this played out. At no point did anyone from the service desk call me to the counter, or come to me in the waiting area and apologize for the long delay. After more than two and a half hours, they finally pulled my vehicle in. At the three hour and fifteen minute mark, they were finished...and so am I. I will never return to this place, for any reason, as long as I live. Their website, and signs on the door advertise thirty-minute oil changes. Not true. Lastly, I will say that if you need an oil change, do not ever, never ever, go to Pep Boys. I would go to Jiffy Lube, or Valvoline. Hell, I can get a faster oil change at the dealership. It's interesting to note that there were customers who came in after me, got their vehicles worked on, and were able to drive away before me. And I had an appointment!

When I tell people in Philadelphia that I'm Greek-American, invariably one of the first questions I'll get is "What's your favorite Greek restaurant in Philly?" which is quickly followed by "What do you think of South Street Souvlaki?" I have always been at a loss to answer either because I don't eat out often, and when I do it's almost never at a Greek restaurant. Also, as a vegetarian, I just wouldn't go to a restaurant whose name celebrates meat. 

So when my friend Brad mentioned that he'd heard about a new Greek restaurant and would I check it out with him, I was immediately interested. From the initial reviews it sounded legit, more like the food I'd grown up eating at home rather than Greek food catering to American tastes (the many complaints about the lack of lettuce in the Greek salad were a good sign). The menu does still lean more towards the preferences of meat-eaters (gotta give the market what it wants) but there are several vegetarian options. No fish entrees, which seemed like a pretty major omission for a Greek restaurant, but the garidomakaronada sounds like the shrimp Santorini I used to love, which isn't something you find often. 

But anyway, for my first visit the seafood test was the xtopodi (grilled octopus). Because if a Greek restaurant can't do THAT well, it'll never be great. The verdict? It has potential, but I have to admit it's not the way I'm used to having Greek-style octopus. Usually it's cut into pieces (thus more thoroughly cooked), and here the tentacles were served pretty much intact. The flavors were right though, and maybe this is the way it's actually served in Greece? It's tasty so still worth getting, but it's a huge portion so you probably want to have at least 4 people in your party who love octopus if you're going to order this.

I chose the spanakopita as an entree, and that was definitely excellent. The pita was clearly house-made (not ready-made phyllo-dough) and delicious, and the spinach filling was really well done. This definitely stacked up against plenty of the better homemade spanakopita I've had. Brad got the meat-eater's version, the kreatopita (which had chicken, pork and lamb). I've never seen that in a Greek home or restaurant before, so I'm guessing this was made, again, for American tastes. But it must work, because he liked it. Both dishes came with the horiatiki salad - yes, this is what Greek salad is supposed to be like!

Moving beyond the menu, the decor reminded me a lot of the more minimalist Greek tavernas I've been to, though still with a good dose of Greek art and elements (wall tiles, prints, statuettes, etc.) I could heard traditional Greek music over the loudspeaker but the noise level mostly obscured it - the restaurant was PACKED. Lots of big parties, families, etc. Everyone seemed like they were having a great time, and the hosts and servers ran around frantically to make sure that was the case.

So I'm happy to now know a great Greek restaurant in Philly! Well, close enough - a Philly suburb. Since most of the Greeks I know seem to prefer the suburbs anyway, this actually makes sense. In the meantime, I still need to find a good Greek restaurant in the city itself (eventually).

I've been seeing this place all over social media and have been wanting to try it for the longest time!
As luck would have it I go the chance to go this weekend since I was on the south side of Indy. 
I love it! Located in what was the old ice house bar is Dukes and it is set up like a honky tonk bar, neon lights old signs.. the works! 
They also have pretty legit live music and this comes from a person who didn't grow up with country music. 
Awesome service! I hope people understand that that they are making moves with how packed they are, I even had a guy who was hanging out drinking and was helping a friend bus tables.. 
If you go at night the menu is limited but that's ok! Get the whole fried chicken and all the sides and you won't be mad! 
The chicken is cooked to perfection! And had this seasoning on it that is sweet and spicy and I wish I knew what is was, but it tastes great! 
Hash brown waffle is to die for! The hatch Mac is the right amount of spice and the Brussel sprouts were seasoned and charred in just the right way.
Can't wait to go back to try lunch foods

Fantastic! I ordered The Gatsby (vanilla cake with champagne pastry cream & champagne buttercream) for a co-workers birthday. I was afraid I ordered too last minute but Sam was totally accommodating and great. She delivered them to me the night before which was super convenient. Everyone LOVED the cupcakes and asked where I got them from. On top of being delicious, they looked amazing covered with the silver sugar.

I can't wait to order more - the only problem will be trying to pick with flavor to get! They all sound amazing.

Happy hour is incredible here! Definitely make a reservation. You will not be disappointed as the pizza is amazing and the price for this delicacy is unbelievable. We couldn't believe what a great deal we had received in our delicious pie. Don't miss your chance to eat here if you're in New Orleans!

Brunch was so loud, obnoxious really. Food was amazing, coronarita amazing, and service was pretty great too. The ambiance was really it's before noon, we are brunching let's get smashed. That might have just been the other guests that day, LOL. Really it was yummy and a great time.

I visited Comfort Food and Kitchenette last night for the first time and I am impressed!  It's very unassuming from the outside, located in a little shopping center in Morrisville, but don't pass this place by - it's delicious.  

The decor of the restaurant is vibrate and inviting.  We sat along the wall of the restaurant where they have a long bench with chairs on the opposite side.  The benches have lots of pillows, which makes sitting down and enjoying your food a comfy experience.

I ordered the eggplant parm stack with cashew cheese and my date ordered the falafel salad - both of them were great.  I am vegetarian, but my date is not, and even he got in on my vegan eggplant.   I definitely go back to Kitchenette and try more things on the menu, the blackboard specials are ever changing so I am excited to see what I get to try next.
Awesome place great daytime DJ, don't remember his name. Great drinks and great staff all around.

The bad: The soup is chicken broth, carrot and potato. No spice or flavor at all.

The Good: The place is small and warm and the staff is attentive and knowledgeable. I had the red curry and my friend had the sweet and sour. They were fantastic I already want to go back and stuff my face again. I got a 5 on the spice meter and it was perfect. 

So to wrap it up. Soup Bad, Everything else Good.
Awesome Creole Vietnamese fusion. Small menu centered around flavor (not a bad thing!). Friendly knowledgeable staff. Fair priced bottles of wine.

This is a great place for traditional Mexican food on Cherokee Street.  I had the tacos el pastor and the lingua (tongue) taco- both were excellent!

Not a fan of the margaritas - too heavy on the sour mix.

No frills just tasty food.

I think the lunch buffet is around $10 per person? That makes it a really good deal, especially if you just load up on the sushi as I did. Lots of different rolls, but the nigiri selection wasn't great or compelling. 

The little I tried of the hot food was pretty bad. Fried stuff tasted stale, everything else tasted bland. And $10 for a regular lunch buffet is pretty expensive anyway - it's not cost effective to use your appetite on the sesame chicken type stuff.

If you think about it, getting two sushi rolls from the grocery store will probably run you at least $10. You can eat a greater quantity and variety of sushi rolls for that price at Journey, which makes it a good value.
The staff was extremely rude to me and my wife while we were staying at the hotel. The hotel staff was very short with me and rude on more than one different occasion.

Really, 3.5 stars because I didn't know how to do a 1/2 star. We tried to join another party, they were unable to accommodate us unless we ALL moved to another table so I moved to the bar. Interesting layout as they have a second ring of 4 toppers AROUND the central bar. We got our first waters within 5 minutes of sitting without asking. Within 3 more minutes, our waitress appeared for drink and appetizer orders. Got our wines, (Xplorador, Chile) my glass was dirty and the pour was below my normal expectation of a normal pour. Didn't say anything. Appetizers come next. Got the slab cut maple bacon and the "famous for" shrimp cocktail. OUTSTANDING!!! If Ur a bacon and spicy shrimp cocktail lover, you MUST get this. WARNING: shrimp cocktail is NOT inexpensive. Waitress returns to ask if I want another glass of wine. Yes, I'm running low at this point. I tell her about the dirty glass and the "poor" pour. She says she'll tell the bartender. Glass arrived poured about 3/4 FULL! Now, THAT'S what I meant by a good pour! Main dishes come. We got the St Elmo's Prime Rib sandwiches with house onion rings and cut fries. The onion rings came with a spicy ketchup/cocktail sauce-VERY good! The sandwiches were excellent.  The meat was super tender and tasty. U could easily bite thru the meat after dipping in the au jus sauce. I liked the creamy horseradish sauce better tho. I ask for the bill. No room left for dessert. $110.00 pre tip for 3 glasses of wine, two appetizers (shrimp cocktail $35.00 alone) and 2 entrees. The servers were all attentive, the food VERY good, but the price I thought a tad on the high side.

Wonderful service. As soon as we walked in, two guys greeted us, asked if we needed anything, and then helped us select some cheese to go with our wine. Wine was great, cheese was awesome. The cheese also comes with bread, pickles, olives, and three different marmalades. We're out of towners and we wholeheartedly recommend this place, and will come back the next time we're here.

I love this little place so very much.  Luckily, I work just a few blocks away so I have plenty of opportunities to purchase the delicious smoked meats before or after work despite residing in South Philly!  

The dude who works the front at this place is incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodates customers to the best of his ability.  That alone makes me more motivated to frequent this spot.  You will always get personal treatment here whether it is your first visit or if you have been a long time customer.  

Oh, and the smell of the delicious smoked meats...I swear, I could wait in line forever if necessary as long as I can smell that smokey goodness all around me as I prepare to make my purchase.  Just imagine, the food you purchase will actually taste even better than it smells.   

So far, I have tried the bacon, kielbasy (garlic and breakfast to be specific since there is a great variety of kielbasy to purchase), and pierogies (3 cheese and the loaded potato types, to be specific as well).  

Best bacon ever.  I love the places I frequent in the Italian Market in Philly and back home in rural NC, but the best bacon I've ever had in my life came from Czerw's.  

Without even being asked, the guy at the front took time to tell me the best way to cook the kielbasy and pierogies as he rang up my order.  He seemed invested in making sure I truly had the best possible food experience with the delicious Polish goods that I purchased. 

I have never been disappointed with this place.  If you are in this neighborhood, then definitely make a stop at Czerw's.  Check out the history of the place too by taking a look around at the pictures on the walls.  

Oh yeah, check this place out on the most recent episode of Bizarre Foods with Andrew Zimmern, too.

*Edit*

They totally welcome phone calls if you want to order anything by phone and pick it up later in the day.  This place will often sell out of items, such as the bacon.  If you are able to get there bright and early to ensure that you have the best selection of items, then do it, but if not, you should call ahead or else you will be S.O.L until next time.

This place is great in a lot of ways. I enjoy the food. I usually order basic breakfast-type foods and they prepare them quite well. The decor is a very cute Aussie-inspired something or other. Cute, whatever. THEY HAVE MAGAZINES!! Sometimes you have to wait a while to get seats during the brunchy/breakfasty prime-time hours. They have a little stash of books, magazines, and kiddy toys hanging out by the side so you can occupy yourself with that nonsense whilst waiting. It makes the time fly while you wait. The beverages are good, good teas and coffees, and the have little impulse treats you can grab on the way out. It should also be noted that their customer service is exceptional. They're very friendly and helpful.

Cool little spot I'm always in the mood for during summer. Spicy shrimp taco is one of my favorites but really they are all good. Not a fan of the salsa but love the queso and guac. 

I get 2 tacos and a guac all to myself. DO NOT leave without having a FRESHLY SQUEEZED margarita (on the rocks, no salt)! Best margarita in town.

So... I'd been to Kuzina a few times for lunch and thought it was OK so I went for a late dinner with my boyfriend last night. He's not a connoisseur of foreign foods so Greek was not familiar to him. I was excited to introduce him to the cuisine and know how delicious it can be, but was pretty disappointed by well, everything we got. The greek salad had a minimal amount of feta and WAY too many salty items on it. Olives - ok, that's pretty typical. Capers? well, sure whatever. but you cannot put olives, capers AND anchovies on one salad.. it's just too much. not to mention they were SO clearly canned anchovies which is kind of just gross.

Secondly - we ordered the moussaka to share. I cook, and recently I took a stab at making moussaka myself. it was delicious, so i figured most greek restaurants would make it even better. Also - i thought it was kind of like lasagna which my bf likes, so I knew it'd be a hit. Well? not so much. It came with a side - we chose the green beans which were soggy and covered in what seemed like canned tomato sauce. And of course, then there's the actual entree. It was like a ground beef stew with eggplant mixed in.. ok normal enough there - but then it came with a literally 1/2" layer of HARD THICK unappealing bechamel "sauce" (if you can call it that) on top. It seemed like it had been prepared a long time ago and was just heated up. And it was disgusting. When the waitress saw that we didn't eat much of it, she didn't say anything. I did - I told her it wasn't very good, that I know moussaka and this wasn't too great. I acted like I liked the salad so she wouldn't feel like all was lost.. but it didn't matter, she didn't really care. It was late and very clear that she just wanted to go home. 

The worst part of the whole experience... my boyfriend and I both feel totally sick today, so we know SOMETHING in that disgusting meal had gone bad. We will not be back.

The food is fresh, fast, and delicious, just like a food truck should be. I had black bean patties on top of tostadas topped with a fresh salsa. My friend got a sort of chicken wrap with a bunch of goodies inside with sriracha. Both of us were very happy with our orders

Best Vietnamese and Southeast restaurant in Delaware. I used to drive to Philly for Vietnamese food but not anymore. 

The owner really cares about his food and the customers.

Service and ambience were 5 star. Coffee was excellent as well. Food was just a 2. I had the special omelet with beef and cream cheese. It was good. My wife had waffles and bacon. She thought it was okay.
The food here is ok.  I heard great things about the coleslaw but it wasn't really my thing.  The beef brisket was alright, but not the best I've had.  I liked their bbq sauce though.

So fresh!  Better than chipotle.  The bowl and empanada was delish.  I got it through uber eats, their packaging holds the heat just like it was made in front of you.  Guacamole is homemade and super yummy!

I had Wild Eggs in Louisville several years ago while visiting a friend, and when I saw the building sign pop up off of 31 on my daily commute from work, I think I immediately began salivating.  I've been anxiously awaiting a visit once they opened, and I wasn't disappointed.  I went with a friend and we opted to share a savory and sweet dish.  We got the buffalo chicken omelet and cinnamon roll.  The buffalo chicken wasn't what I would typically order, but it was scrumptious.  It basically tasted like the buffalo chicken dip you have at parties, but made with an egg and hot sauce.  Hello!  The cinnamon roll was large and perfectly soft in the center.  Yum yum yum.  I can't wait to go back and try more options.

A classic brunch place. It is a relatively small franchise that Reno is lucky to have. The menu is vast, so there should be something for everyone. Unlike most brunch places, Peg's has a Hawaiian portion on the menu, which includes teriyaki pork chops with rice and macaroni salad. But it also has the classics such as omelettes and eggs Benedict. Best part is there are multiple locations all over Reno and Sparks.

I honestly was trying to figure out one reason not to give Papa John's 5 stars! I can't.

I order online! I pick my pizza up! I eat my delicious pizza! I eat the crust with garlic sauce! Life is good.

Every time I come into this location I am greeted  by friendly employees who appear to be hard at work.

Not only is the pizza delicious, they have these hot and gooey  cinnamon pull-a-parts! OMG! If you haven't had them, you must. Thank me later.

I have not tried this location for a while even though it is the closest to my residence.
The restaurant is still poorly managed. I went for lunch with my son and opted to eat outside. One table was open but still not cleaned and we waited for 5 minutes until I decided to clean the table. 
The wings I ordered were dry and greasy. It seems they were cooked frozen. The curly fries were bits and pieces once I picked the top fries.
Waitress did not ask if we needed anything else and we had to request for condiments. 
This location would not still be open if it was not for Covid relief. I am done with it.
Worst Hooters.

I love The Royale. The decor is great, especially around Halloween. The people are great. The music is great. The food is great, and I love how late they serve it. The drinks are thoughtful and delicious. I especially love how they require vaccinations to eat indoors--it's nice to not have to stress when I go there. Thank you for being wonderful, Royale!

Nola Caye's atmosphere was nice and the decor was on point I loved all of the plants around the restaurant. The dish that I had (Jerk Chicken) was flavorful with aromatic spices; the dish was however missing that heat or "spice" normally associated with Jerk Chicken. I also had a featured cocktail called the "Bayou Breeze" that was decent with a nice balance of alcohol to juice. Will try again to hopefully push my review to 5 stars.

I'm visiting my family here I live in NYC and I was told that this deli is truly New York style deli.
I ordered the pastrami and wasn't that thrilled with it.
I'm used to the NYC delis pastrami with the juicy taste and the darker ends of the meat this pastrami had little flavor and was a bit on the light side and not a flavor I  recognized.
However that said next time I  will try other items just to be fair cause even in the NYC delis their meats aren't perfect every time
The atmosphere was Excellent the staff Excellent with many N.Y. posters and train stations actual signs hanging on the walls that was as delight.
The place was crowded people seemed to be enjoying themselves so I  will re write this review if in the future some other dish their tickles my mouth
Delicious dessert and coffee! We got the cococino and the frutti di basco! Highly recommend this place to come take a little break from all the crazy !

Support local business! 

Great service and product availability. The scooter I rented is going to give me a way to stay active while my broken toe heals.

This place is awesome! Food was excellent but the service was amazing!!! We saw an "off the menu" item on their instagram and just had to try! Unfortunately, when we got there they had no idea what we were talking about. I posted on the instagram picture our disappointment and within 5 min we had our waitress (kaylea) and the manager (Andy) at our table ready to help! They were so great! They made it work and sent us home with exactly what we wanted! I would definitely recommend this place!

The best authentic tacos in Goleta. Great value, can get 4 tacos and a drink for under 10 bucks. Place can get busy, but the line moves fast.  Closed on Tuesday  (taco Tuesday -- hahaha! )
Try it, you won't be disappointed.

Good pretzels of course, though I felt very hurried through the line. I didn't even get to order everything I wanted before she had me all rung up and out with our food. Lost a star for customer service.

Great location, a quick walk to the Circle Center Mall. Close to Lucas Oil Stadium as well. Hotel was very clean, rooms were beautiful with high-ceilings and were very spacious. Each room has kitchen, microwave, large fridge, kitchen table, stove, sink, paper towels, plates. etc. Great for families. We had a nice view of the city from our hotel room. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of options. Fitness center was small but nice and clean and had standard hotel equipment with one elliptical, one treadmill, free weights, etc. Hotel is close to several restaurants. Kilroy's (bar/restaurant) delivers to the hotel, it is also right next to the hotel, therefore we walked a couple feet, and enjoyed a good dinner there. 

Valet parking is the only option at this location and was pricey. We wanted to leave our car there until 3pm but had to take it out by 1pm or we would be charged for another day of valet parking ($30 bucks/day). This was inconvenient as other hotels have not charged us for staying in their lot 2-3 hours after checkout. 


Otherwise, staff and valet workers were very attentive and nice. Had a decent experience overall and this would be a nice hotel to stay at again in Indianapolis due to its great location downtown and proximity great shopping, restaurants, and Lucas Oil Stadium.

After driving by a million times (give or take a couple), we finally stopped here on a Friday evening for a quick dinner, and we are now fans. 

Based on Yelp reviews we ordered the Bavarian pretzel with Obatzda, the wurst platter and the mussels in beer.  The house-made pretzel had a thick, chewy exterior which was the perfect foil for the richness of the Obatzda.  The deliciousness was further enhanced by Mr. M's micro-brew and my light and bubbly hard cider.   I would have been content to stop right there.  

Mr. M ordered the wurst platter, which he declared excellent (not a surprise given the distinguished pedigree of the wurst).  What really sold him on the meal, however, were the handcut fries and spaetzle, which recalled Mom's recipe.   The mussels were uber-delicious (and comparable to Monk's), and only the rules of decorum prevented me from slurping the remaining broth. 

We loved the intimacy that the low-lighting created in what is not an intimate space.  The service was attentive, efficient and patient with newbies.
Best pizza I've ever had!   Service and selection can't be beat. A must visit for anyone in the downtown area.

I have been to Smith Bros many times over the past 10 years. It was fairly consistent until about a year and a half ago. Today is the last time I will go there. I just paid almost $30 for a mini-van to be cleaned. The result was an exterior wash that was fine but not even a halfhearted attempt to vacuum the interior and a cursory window cleaning. It was very poorly done and given it is a trend, I would rather drive further to get a better result.

More than anything, this place is overpriced for a poorly constructed sandwich. Ingredients didn't really mesh together well; the bread to meat ratio was terrible. The bread was hard and chewy. Pulled pork was watery and everything just lacked flavor. There was really nothing special about this sandwich. I would maybe pay $5, not $10.

Arrived 15 minutes before reservation and was told that the seating was on time. No big deal as we made our way to the bar. Bar was moderately crowded but extremely loud for the amount of people. Drinks were mediocre at best. Sazerac was underwhelming and Moscow mules were some of the worst I've experienced in Nashville. For the price I'd expect them to be on par with Morton's or the Oak Bar. 

Sat on time, but took longer than expected for waiter to approach table. After trying the pickles and bell peppers, the bread came which was delicious. We decided on the smoked salmon and bacon as an appetizer. I must say the bacon may have been the highlight of the meal. It was deliciously prepared with a great sauce. Salads arrived and contained surprising delicious tomatoes, especially for the time of year. Going into the entree I had high expectations. However  my ribeye, although prepared fantastically visually (medium rare) lacked the flavor I typically expect from the cut of meat. My wife ordered the shrimp pasta which even though the shrimp was cooked well, lacked flavor. The best part of the meal was probably the skillet fried potatoes and gravy... absolutely delicious.

Overall not a bad experience, but for the price and ambiance I'd much rather go to one of the other steakhouses in Nashville. Definitely worth checking out, if for nothing else then to reaffirm your favorite restaurant.

Came in late-greeted by friendly staff. when i called fr additional water, they brought it to my room without me having to ask. had insanely early flight but coffee stand already decked out with fresh coffee. shuttle to airport also running early at 3:40am. wish I had a chance to check out pool. Overall-GREAT short stay!

Overrated. Lacks some kind of sauce. The broccoli rabe does nothing for the sandwich. Preferred it w/o.  Sharp provolone was a little strong so if you're not use to it, opt not to get it. The Italian sausage was actually better in my opinion. Good spice to it.

I love Iztaccihuati and order from them pretty often. But unfortunately, for my last order there was a long black hair right in my grilled steak burrito. This is simply unacceptable. 

I have eaten food from here over ten times and this is the only time I have had a negative result. Pretty disappointing.

Pros: Simple, good, and great value. 
Cons: no hot sauce. Anywhere...
 
So, this app will not let me post the above mentioned pros & cons because it is too short. I am writing this to provide filler. Jimmy johns was alright. Generally, the lack of hot sauce is not limiting in any way. My particular case is an exception to the preceding rule. 

Good bye. 

Eric

My family and I have been here for breakfast several times and the food has been great.  We like that it's open Sundays and they have seating for larger groups. You get nice size portions.  Pancakes were yummy and quite large.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because at times the waitress was not very pleasant but that can happen to the best of us! We will definitely return, this place is a keeper!

Seeing that I was dining by myself I opted for the small lower east loop (thin crust) and I wasn't disappointed at all. Wish I would have eaten at the actual restaurant but I got mine to go but it seemed like a great place to sit down for a beer. Pizza was delicious and very tasty, will have to try the deep dish and their wings next time in town. I just didn't want to embarrass myself on my first visit  :)

I'm between a 3-4 stars, but I'll opt for higher at present. Upside: on Mass Ave, and even if it's not on the 'by the glass' list, if you order 2 glasses of something, they will open the bottle for you. How's that for a helluva nice host? Had a decent salad and the entrees were pretty good. My fella had a chicken dish that was quite juicy and tender. 

Decor was a little disjointed and odd, but hey, we live in a disjointed and odd sort of world. I had some sort of fish special that was edible and filling, but not super memorable.

Will be back for further diving...

Love love love! their tuna on rye and the Greek salad!  Burgers are yummy, so is spinach dip. I had the "Pick-a-Peppa", and didn't love it. Menu description was a little misleading, but it's been my only misstep there so far. I've always had great service there too.  Prices seem high, but you get lots of food so I guess it works out.

Excellent staff, comfortable environment, affordable/ well executed cuts, coffee and tea and a ton of magazines... There is even a very nice kitty that wanders around, and they are always playing good music... Best value hair cut I've gotten in Philadelphia-- just know they cut hair dry. My hair is extremely thick and they always do a great job!

I love marias pizza. And I used to love their fries. But lately they have been over cooked. I got an eggplant parm sandwich and it was just blah. No sauce. Soggy eggplant. Pretty sure I found an eyelash on the mozzerella. They are a small family run business and they are friendly but idk what's happening with the quality of the food lately. I hope it gets better.

I'm not much for writing reviews on Yelp; I usually only read others. However, I had such a terrible experience with this company that I actually feel obligated to write one (even though there isn't a single positive review anyway).

I was in Santa Barbara for a dear old friend's wedding this past weekend. SIx of us needed to take a cab from our rental home to the Four Seasons. I called at 5 PM asking for a cab to pick us up at 5:40. The woman rudely informed me that they don't take orders for cabs in advance. Surprised, I said okay, and that I would call back in 20 minutes. 20 minutes later, I called back and asked for two cabs. The woman remembered me and was incredibly rude asking for my address and phone number. She said they'd be there "momentarily." We used the opportunity to take some photos of us all dressed up for the wedding, but at 5:45 realized the cab was STILL not there (I had called at 5:20). We started to panic; I called back and the woman told me that the cabs were "dropping off other customers" and would be there in "around 15 minutes." I was VERY peeved and said we would have to cancel our cab. We ended up having to drive ourselves to the wedding and leaving our cars at the hotel, meaning we had to go pick them up in the morning. It was so frustrating, considering we were only trying to be safe by taking a cab so that we could all drink comfortably. 

This woman knew that I was trying to plan in advance, yet was incredibly incompetent and rude. I have worked in many different types of service industries and have never treated anyone with such disrespect, even if they were being rude. I can honestly say that I was not being short, rude, or annoying in any way, and yet she treated me with complete disregard. I wish I had gotten her name so that I could call the manager/owner, but based on other reviews it seems that this is not a good cab service at all. 

Please take my advice and don't use this company. They are incompetent and incredibly RUDE!

This place is full of one health code violation after another! Originally when this place first opened up me and my coworkers raved about how good their burgers were! One day things happened to take a turn for the worst! My meat was tough and drenched in so much oil that the bread fell apart. They changed their fries from shoe string cut, to zig zag, and now to this thicker cut and none of them were ever crispy. I've asked them in the past to place my fries in a bag to keep them from getting soggy and eventually they started doing all of their orders like that, but now even in the bags they're still soggy. After not ordering from them for a few months my coworker and I went against my better judgement and decided to give them another try. By now hoping things may have gotten better plus I've never been to the actual location before. Before leaving my office I ordered my food on my Grubhub app. My office is 10-15 mins away plus we stopped to go to CVS for a good 20 mins so I figured that was ok because it's next door to the restaurant yet my food still wasn't ready once I got there. As I waited my coworker went and ordered a slice of pizza. They were busy so I waited and I waited in horror! The staff was all over the place and not a single glove was worn in site! I watch one employee take a rag and wipe food, paper and some rolls to the edge of the cutting board so he could prepare a pizza. That wasn't before he took that same rag and tossed it onto the roll which another employee proceeded to make sandwiches with! Next an older woman began making sandwiches along with the other young lady and because she was short she couldn't properly reach some ingredients she needed. She then proceeded to lean over the cutting board boobs mashed completely against the sandwich and once she had what she need she proceed to finish making the same sandwich! Mind you NOBODY was wearing ANY GLOVES! Between that and the pizza man rubbing his ungloved hands on his nose while making pizzas the cashier woman finally asked me had I been helped. I hesitated because I was in a state of shock but told her no and gave her my name. She couldn't find my food so I waited some more....Now I started looking at the food on the floor and then my eye began to watch the man on the grill. Jesus Christ where do I begin...well for starters a lot of cross contamination with the meats. Beef, steak and chicken prepared in the small spot on the grill and shoved off to the side. Cheese sat in a metal pan next to the grill melting and clearly not kept at the temperature it should be. I found out why my burgers have been so oily it was because the man was pressing the meats so hard against the grill cooking out all of the natural oils and grabbing this bottle of oil dumping it all over the meat. After waiting over 20 mins, my coworker asked if our food was ready. We were advised that her pizza was forgotten in the over and that my order wasn't anywhere to be found. I was finally able to get someone's attention and asked them to cancel my order because I couldn't stomach it. The young lady was ready to give me a refund and this old woman started yelling at her "I told you her order was ready! The bag is right here!" all while she's slamming my bag of food on the counter. The young lady still being polite says she didn't know and the old woman has now marched towards the kitchen and is yelling towards the girl speaking to a guy who I believe was the manager. I whispered to the girl "If you're going to get in trouble for this then don't worry about it I'll just take the food" she apologizes again and I got out of there. I get to work and the fries are soggy, the burger is burnt, tasteless, full of oil and the lettuce were wilted. I threw the whole bag out and proceeded to write this review...I will never go to this dump again!

It was VERY quick service. I ordered, went to get salsa and when I came back to my table and the food was right there when I sat down. The chile verde burrito is the best burrito I've ever had, it was spicy but not to spicy and the pork was so tender. Honestly, one of the best Mexican restaurants I've ever been to.

Bubble tea is definitely quality over quantity and for the prices on the menu, I was not surprised by the quality of the drinks. You get what you paid for and at Tea Do, it will be your basic bubble tea that's a bit watered down and highly artificially flavored with a powder of some sort. I also got some bits of boba that were a little underdone and just not pleasing to chew. 
Good place to try if you want a quick drink to cool down for an affordable price.

I used to go to Harry's in the 70's and it was a lot of fun. Not so much now. The martinis are strong but pricey if you order top shelf vodka. The Tee Off and Joe's have the same drinks for a reasonable price and the bartenders are much more personable. I went to Harry's last week and ordered wings and a martini and my bill was $28 before the tip. There are way better options in town with much better food.

Made my way here with the recommendation from a close friend.  Even on a weekday, this place was hustling and bustling - always a positive sign! The tables are pretty cramped, so it does create an intimate but noisy setting - part of the charm.  I had ordered the short rib pasta, kale salad, and a goat cheese mushroom toast.  Everything was to-die for, especially the kale salad and the goat cheese and mushroom toast.  Normally, I am not a big goat cheese or kale guy, but every last bite was had here.

Highly recommended! Great food and great service.

Best sandwiches in Philly. If you're giving this place bad reviews because they support BLM you're more sensitive than the liberals you claim to hate.
Order the Herschel Waker and shut the f*** up, you wrong-side-of-history mother f******!

Now this is a streak salad! Whistle stop you always please. Thank you for being consistently consistent! Great food, great service, great atmosphere! Had a steak salad that was awesone! Hey @waterandoak take notes!
Gina, along with the amazing Tom, made my Chapter 7 less of a headache, and helped lead me to my new chapter of my life, during this crazy pandemic!

My boyfriend won a football bet and his prize was to choose dinner. He wanted to go to Seoul Kitchen, but after reading Isabella J's SK review, we decided to try Kimchi Time instead and we're so glad we did! 

The tables were full at 8 pm, which is a testament to their popularity and solid food. The servers were very friendly, but not the most attentive. I did have to flag them a few times but they were especially responsive. 

We ordered the mandu, spicy Korean wings, dolsot bi bam bap, and grilled gal bi - all dishes I highly recommend! They serve everything piping hot, maybe too hot. The wings weren't too spicy in my opinion (I can barely do hot cheetohs). I loved my sweet delicious gal bi. They also provide 5 sides including different kimchi vegetables and sweet mashed potatoes (I asked for extra).  Finish your meal with red bean ice cream and I guarantee you'll leave with a happy belly.

Very good food and service at this local spot. I have eaten here on several occasions and normally order the Gyro combo, Gyro/fries/drink. On my last visit I requested a little extra Gyro sauce since the last one way kind of dry, and they charged an extra 75 cents for about a teaspoon of sauce. THIS IS A SURE WAY TO KEEP CUSTOMERS FROM RETURNING BY GOUGING THEM FOR A LITTLE EXTRA CONDIMENT WHICH COSTS ALMOST NOTHING! Your restaurant has attracted a good following in the area, please don't tick off people by adding extra charges for things that should be free.
