Went in for an early dinner. Wife ordered medium rare steak which came out well done. The waiter was not attentive and rather rude I thought. Not what I expected for this type of place and more over not what I expected when they are only serving a few at a time. 
I'll try somewhere else next time the wife and I want to go out. Not happy experience for $100 worth of food/service.
The French onion soup was exactly what I heard it was....:DELICIOUS!!! Prices weren't over the top for New Orleans.

Wow. So good. The best pizza I've had in Florida hands down. 
So I'm from Chicagoland, and have lived in NYC-so I know my pies. This place is legit. 
The crust perfectly charred with that amazing combo of crunchy and chewy. 
The toppings are fresh, delicious, and aside from maybe a bit too much garlic on one the pies (whole cloves-tasty but Wowza) I can find no faults. 
Service was ridiculously friendly, knowledgeable and quite frankly I can't wait to return. 
Now as soon as my tummy settles I'll get to work on the cannoli I brought home. 
This is must do for any foodie in Tampa Bay

Horrible Horrible Horrible!!! I literally sat at the bar for 15 mins and the young female NEVER said anything until she was prompted to by some other guy who completely ignored the fact that she blatantly refused to serve me. I have been here many times before and had never felt this disgusted. After watching her take a to go order and continue to wait on others I decided it best for me to leave. I will NEVER come here again. Total waste of my lunch break. I mean the food is average at best so whatever.

I've been here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner---and I know I'm gonna meet my burrito/taco craving! Forget about chipotle. This is the place to be. It's cheap, delicious, and flavorful. They make their own special hot sauces and pickles. 

For breakfast, I recommend the chicken tacos with sausage.
For lunch/dinner, my personal favorite is half chicken and half sweet potato burrito! This burrito is by far the best combo.

Also, how cute are the animated burritos and tacos on their menu board? Space is limited so try to go at off times. :)

My first visit to Dunkin Donuts will be my last! I had to ask the employees to move from in front of the donuts so I could choose. No less than 8 people standing right in front, at the register, and behind them! They did not have honey for the coffee! They did not have my favorite dunking donuts "Buttermilk Bar" and "Old Fashioned" although they did point to a plain Jane donut they dub the old fashioned.

There were 4 tables open all in the sun but no one put the sun shade down so people could sit at them. The management is not trained or something, or maybe they were on a break! maybe over time they will improve, but their donuts were just OK. With Ellers and Spudnuts so close, the choice is easy now, but at least i tried!

After one too many cups of joe at Morning Glory's, a fellow local and I found ourselves in Fante's in search of a toilet room.  While buying some oh-so-crucial almond paste (and passing on a $22 biscotti pan), the friendly cashier recommended we use the restroom in the visitor's center.

I spend an unhealthy amount of time in the Italian Market - what visitor's center?  We have a visitor center?  Many assurances later we headed out the door to walk the walk we traversed no less than three times earlier that day.  Lo and behold somewhere near Frank Rizzo's face (opposite side of the street) was the Visitor Center. 

Well stocked with familiar items from Claudio's, DiBruno Brothers, and Fantes the shop boasts lots of Italian flare and a tidy little restroom.  It's a great place for tourists and locals alike.

I write reviews to share info that I want when I'm looking for something and to help other's find unexpected spots. There is so much to explore & enjoy within a short distance. Ive been searching for the perfect Salon for years and years and all along "THE ONE" has been literally 5min from my house (if that). Check out my sons new trend. Going from "THE LOOK" to "THE NEW TREND". Check out these curls. We are in love with the look, the pricing we were charged and the care we were given. SHEAR IMPRESSIONS in Riverview is like no other. They go above and beyond and they're so amazing at what they do. Most trendy salons are to full of themselves to make their client's feel like family. Not this place. Im in love  #microphonedrop
This place has great service and food.  I had the shrimp and grits. It was tasty and filling.

Update: we received a phone all from the manager Jake. He was incredibly apologetic and understanding of the situation. He offered to replace the battery if it fails to hold a charge and promised to speak to his team. 

We dropped my wife's car off to get painted after some gravel damages. After a while of it being there we were finally able to pick up (insurance company kept delaying and avoiding communication). We arranged to pick it up on June 2 2020. We showed up an hour and half before closing time and the car was still not ready so we had to wait until 1200 the following day. When we showed up at 330pm, the vehicle was still not washed (that's why we couldn't pick it up the prior day) so we had to wait a few minutes for that. We drove off to get some prescriptions filled. When we tried to leave the pharmacy the car was dead. Turns out the battery died from sitting so long and they had to jump it to bring it around to us. They never told us this. Now it's 4pm and 89 degrees outside and we are trying to get a car started. When we called they just said that they were sorry for not telling us. I wanted to speak to a manager and was told he wasn't in and would call me first thing in the morning. It's now 120pm with no phone call. I'm very disappointed at the lack of communication from this company to their customers. They put my wife and I at risk by not telling us the car battery is dead and should be driven a while before turning it off. The only thing that makes this whole situation worse (disclaimer: they didn't know) is that we just spent 4 hours in the ER for a back injury of mine and now I'm out trying to move around under a hood).

This place is incredible! I've been coming here since the doors opened and have made quite the relation with Mike and Allyn. They have shared their vision of this place and have worked very hard to get it where it is today. It's been amazing to not only taste their great wines but also learn the process of making them.
 
They have quite a few varieties in wines, which is surprising considering our climate. Mike makes weekly, long trips to distant vineyards for the different types of grapes that they use to make their wines. It's truly been a beautiful thing to watch and be a part of their vision come to fruition. 
 
 
They have 2 other wineries in this location that do just about the same thing. I have had the honor meeting the owners as well and are very nice and can't wait to try some of their creations as well. Nevada Sunset was the first one to open so I have a little more experience with them than others.

The Rocky Statue and the Rocky Steps are one of the most famous attractions in Philly, both located at the Philadelphia Art Museum. 

Before Rocky III came out, Sylvester Stallone had his character, Rocky Balboa made in bronze. Originally this statue was placed at the top of the stairs of Philadelphia Art Museum for the movie and then left there as a gift from Sylvester Stallone. However the museum did not consider this to be art and more of a "prop" from the movie and refused to allow the statue to be kept here. So eventually this statue was placed at the bottom of the stairs, to the right of the museum, where it lays now. 

With both arms raised, this statue gives that feeling of hope since Sylvester Stallone's Rocky Balboa was that underdog who took on the boxing champion of the world and went all 15 rounds in Rocky I. What a movie!

Just as other fellow Yelp members had mentioned, there will most likely be a line to get a photo with this free attraction, any time of the day (even if the weather is not the most desired). But the line does move kind of quickly. Although you do see some people over do it and take more than a few photos with the statue, which will hold up the line. We saw several people doing that, which was a little annoying. 

But anyways, definitely a nice keepsake photo for your travels.

Please note that if you decide to come here, there is limited street parking. Right at the bottom of the museum are loading zones only so just be sure to be aware of the signs so you don't get a ticket.
I've tried a different nail salon every month the past year that I've lived in Nashville and this is the first one that I'm happy with. My nails look perfect!

We did take out from pop-up. The communication with when your order is ready is terrible, we got a text literally right when we were finished eating that our food was ready. 

We both got the Tennessee Tonkotsu, I chose to add spinach for a whopping $2 extra. I'm glad I did. The broth and meat were extremely flavorful but the only thing besides noodles was scallions and some weird mushroom(?) that reminded me of seaweed.  For $14, I would have liked a bit more in my bowl. 

The hot chicken buns were absolutely delicious and honestly, I may just go back for them.

BEWARE!!!!! Absolutely terrible business that doesn't stand behind anything they sell. Purchased an engagement setting from them for upwards of 4K and already in just about two years after getting regular inspections, THREE stones have fallen out. They fixed the first for free because it was within a month of purchase, but after that told me I was on my own. I highly recommend that you do NOT purchase from here.

Matt is fantastic - going to him is definitely an experience, not just a hair cut. He listened to what you are looking for and aims to give you exactly what you've asked for. He also gave me some good tips to go home with.
I have no negatives, he even put up with me having to take a few work calls during my appointment which I really appreciated.
Will definitely be back again
5 stars. 4 words. Foot.Long.Banh.Mi.

I am always surprised at how great and consistent any WAWA I walk into is regardless of location.   The owners of Wawa do a great job ensuring their stores are clean, staff are courteous and friendly .  Great sandwiches and the free fixings are virtually limitless!

I went to see Dr. Davis on a referral from one of my friends after hearing about the ailments I have been experiencing. I've been playing baseball my entire life and knew there was some problems in my shoulder and throwing arm. One doctor even recommended Tommy John surgery. During my first appointment we went over all of the potential pain points through some normal exercises. Once had finished the exercises, Dr. Davis realized that I was suffering from Tendinosis, basically a drawn out version of tendinitis. After a few appointments and some extra strengthening and stretching, I have felt a lot better. If you are in some pain and other doctors couldn't help, see Dr. Davis I'm sure he will have a solution.

So I came to view an apartment I already applied for and was approved for. Before I came, I did verify that I will be showing up on a Saturday around this time. Came around 12 and waited for an hour with no avail. There was no one!! Not a great first impression for a buisiness that duels on great customer service to attend immediate needs

Returned later because I left something there. The guy was really nice very welcoming. He had to attend to his dogs and apologized for it

I happened to find this truck by accident and was drawn to it because of the lovely flowers and plants on display in front. 

I want to love this food truck because it has an air of mystery (no written menu!) and is run by a couple of fun characters, but the sauce was too spicy/garlicky and I did not care for the homemade pasta/spaghetti that came with my falafel. I asked for no chicken, so I only got the falafel, which was excellent (except it was doused in that overly spicy sauce that leaves a gasoline taste in your mouth for hours). And who serves pasta with falafel? The fresh greens served on top were delicious. I'm not sure what they were but they were yummy. Also, the red grapes sprinkled throughout were a great touch and added a succulent, sweet taste to the dish.

The guys in the truck were so friendly and nice, and I know a lot of people love this truck, but I wish the food preparers gave you a little more control over what you want. They do seem a little Soup Nazi-esque in that regard.

Went for breakfast, had the brisket, egg and cheese. Didn't try the roll, looked average at best, the brisket was tender and tasty. The egg and cheese were institutional style, very gross and disappointing. They provide a free donut, that must have been fried to two week old oil. Finished a quarter to the sandwich and I'm reeling from the grease. Stay away, if you want crap Micky D is cheaper.

A very small and quiet place to hang out with friends. Food was good. Ordered the scallion pancake, shrimp fried rice, seafood soup, and beef chow fun. Was very delicious. If you want a cozy and warm place to chill with friends. Totally come here. :) BTW staff was very polite.

Wanted a cheesteak and this place was the closest.  After checking yelp I gave it a chance and I'm glad I did! The cheesesteak was very satisfying and served on a freshly made panini-like roll. It was very thin and loaded with meat.  The pizza looked pretty good to! Popular lunch spot!

I love, love, love this place! I always try to stop by whenever we are in Philly, we actually came here a few times from NY just to have dinner here.  Did I mention that I love this place?  My ultimate goal is to try all of the dishes on the menu, which has been difficult as I always order the same 2-3 dishes each time.  See below for the dishes I have tried, which are ranked based on my preference:

Prah-Hok Kateeh - My absolute favorite dish and I have to order it every time I come here.  It doesn't look much in pictures, but trust me, you will love it.  It is basically ground pork that is flavored to perfection and you eat it with an assortment of vegetables.  I can eat this dish everyday!  Actually Khmer Kitchen inspired me to try to replicate this dish at home, I have tried a bunch of different variations of this dish using recipes from the internet, and none have even come close to the ones served here.

Sah-Law Machue Yuin - Another dish that I always order. It is a sweet and sour soup that comes with either chicken, fish or shrimp.  My personal favorite is the fish version.  Due to the fact that there are no Cambodian restaurants in NYC, I try to order a similar dish when I go to Vietnamese restaurants, but needless to say, none have come close to this dish.  I love the fresh pineapples (most other places use canned ones), and the gourd melon, which I have never had before I came here, now I love it!

Cha Throp - stir fried eggplant that comes with either pork or chicken.  I love the pork version, the pork just melts in your mouth.  The flavor could be similar to eggplant with garlic sauce from Chinese restaurants, but Khmer Kitchen uses big pieces of perfectly flavored pork instead of group pork, which I think makes a huge difference

Cha Mussels - The sauce for this dish is out of this world.  True story, my friend actually took the leftover sauce to go so that she can eat it over rice for lunch the next day, no mussels, just the sauce.  The mussels are great too, but the sauce this the star of this dish, and I kind of wish they serve bread with this dish so I can sop up that delicious heavenly sauce.

Pleah Sak-Koe- It is basically a rare beef salad.  For people who are a bit squeamish about eating rare beef, this is probably not the dish for you. For the more adventurous eaters, give this a chance.  It is super refreshing, particularly during the summer.  Could be a bit spicy, so be forewarned!

Sah-Law Machue Kr'ung - another soup with either chicken or beef.  I liked the aforementioned sweet and sour soup better, but this one has my favorite protein, i.e. beef.  The beef is super tender and flavorful.  I picked out all of the beef while everyone else was busy talking (no, that's not rude at all)

Kuh-Puh Ch'in - Shrimps that are lightly battered and fried to perfection.  I am not a huge fan of shrimp, but if I have to eat shrimp, I would eat this any day.

Cha La-Pauh - stir fried pumpkin with either chicken or pork.  I don't like pumpkin, but the pork in this dish is so yummy.  I had to be sneaky and pick out the pork as I did with the previously mentioned soup.  Everyone that liked pumpkins at the table raved about this dish.

Cha Kr'ung - stir fry dish with celery and pepper, comes with either chicken or beef.  It was just ok, nothing too spectacular to report.  

Cha Lok-Lak - my least favorite dish.  It is basically beef cubes on a bed of lettuce.  Perhaps I should've dipped the beef in the sauce longer, but it is not as flavorful as the rest of the menu.

This is a family restaurant with the mother and grandmother in the back cooking, and coming here feels like going home to mom's cooking, well if your mom is Cambodian and an amazing cook.  The waiter is super friendly, I assume he's the son/grandson to the chefs.  He's always very patient in answering whatever questions we have, and always accommodating with all of the annoying requests I have (i.e. more vegetables for the Prah-Hok Kateeh, more napkins, takeout containers for the leftover sauce).  The only downside is that the hours can be unpredictable, so definitely call beforehand.  I have been disappointed numerous times because they had to close early, or open late for various reasons, as I don't live in Philly, I couldn't wait around for them to open.  It has been a running joke between us that we are 'lucky' if the place is actually open when they say they would.  However, they have a loyal customer in me, I will come back here again and again!

OK, I lied.  I decided to give this place another try. In all honesty, I drove by Acajutla to go to another Mexican restaurant but I found that one to be closed. So, last time I came here, the soup was good enough to allow me to convince myself that I may have ordered the wrong entree. Here we go again.

I ordered the Tortilla soup again. It was even better this time. This stuff is delicious. It really isn't worth $6.99 but what bowl of soup can be. I must admit, this is as close to being worth it as you get. It has a little feta, cilantro, avocado, onion and chunks of chicken in a slightly spicy broth.   This is a must for any new customer.  I'm sure it will hook you.

I decided to have the Combonation plate and a side of re-fried beans. The combo had a beef taco, chicken fajita, chicken tostada and a deep fried thing with potatoes and pork in it called a pastel. Kind of like a really big perogy that was deep fried. 
The chicken tostada was delicious. With re-fried beans, chicken, lettuce, cheese and egg it was definitely the best thing on the plate. The crisp taco on the bottom made it almost impossible to eat but the flavor kept me trying.    
The beef taco was chunks of steak and onion on a soft shell. It was good, but plain. I was impressed that it was actual chunks of steak instead of ground beef. I added some Pico de Galo and dipped it in my beans and it made it pretty good. 
The chicken fajita was ok but I could have done with out the pastel. It didn't taste terrible but for as bland as it was, I'm not sure my cholesterol spike was worth it. 
I don't know what the spicy vinegar cabbage is called but it seemed to be "Mexican cold slaw" if there is such a thing. It was quite nice.  I enjoyed it so much that I have tried to duplicate it at home, with out any luck I might add. 
The plate didn't come with re fried beans so I ordered a side. They looked like paste, but they were very good. I like the beans to be baked a little and with melted cheese and these were neither. 
All in all, this place was ok. If I'm in the area I will probably try it again.

My wife and I have eaten at the Gas Lamp many times over the years and finally decided to take the time to write a quick review as it's one of our favorite places to eat in Reno.  If you haven't eaten at the Gas Lamp yet, it's truly worth a visit and recommend the happy hour, but the regular dinner menu is also a must.
The best chinese food I've ever had. We ordered 2 appetizers: wonton soup Zha Jiang Mein, and 2 entrees: pad thai ,filet mignon. Each dish had so much flavor. I strongly reccomend this restaurant.

George,

A deposit WAS cashed by Roger for $1000 on American Express, which he returned later in the day. However, you miss the point, my husband called and spoke to Roger at 9.15 am to see if the car was available and was told it was. Any decent person with integrity and honest business practices would have told the person who bought the car later that morning as we were driving up to purchase it in cash, that someone else was on the way and would have offered that person first refusal in the event that the sale did not go through. Roger left a message when we were 10 minutes away that it had been sold. Then, instead of apologizing for being the unscrupulous shark that he is, proceeded to tell us it was our fault for driving so far. 
It is interesting that most of the complaints on YELP and other review sites mention Roger, specifically by name. As Robert B. says 4/22/2013 beware of the wolf in sheep clothing. I wish I had read these reviews before attempting to do business with your secondhand car lot, but I guess we just try and trust people.

There is always a long wait for your car in service.  It takes a very long time to process your paper work to drop off your car. Last time I was in for service my car was not finished when promised despite having an appointment.  I prefer to go to a dealer and this is the only Volvo any where near me but I will not be returning

This is our new favorite Korean restaurant in STL. Low prices, delicious food, and friendly and prompt service--the young man who served us was super personable and gave us recommendations for where to get inexpensive soju nearby. We will be back.

What a fabulous experience - the lobster bisque was incredible!!!! We went during the 4pm to 8pm happy hour and had a fantastic meal with drinks and were blown away at how low the bill was! The service was good and we felt very welcomed.
Fun, lively atmosphere and the food is consistently great!   This place does attract a crowd so come early or be prepared to wait.  It's worth it!!

I know that Drago's Seafood Restaurant is the home of the original chargrilled oysters, but I had also heard about Acme Oyster House and wanted to do a little comparison. My taste test determined that they were both really good, cheesy and scrumptious, but I found that the Acme oysters were a little bigger, and relied less on the cheesiness and focused instead on overall flavor.

In addition to the oysters they are famous for, Acme Oyster House has a good selection of New Orleans treats. My boyfriend went for the Fried Fish Po-Boy which he thought was pretty good and said he would come back for.

On the side, he ordered some French Fries. They were blah and he said he would order a different side next time.

I ended up eating Red Beans & Rice. I thought it was delicious. It reminded me of something we eat in Jamaica called Stewed Peas.

The food was exceptional, as was the service. Our waitress was very friendly, engaging in conversation and making sure we were comfortable. Not sure if it was her doing or the chef's but the half dozen chargrilled oysters came with seven instead of the six, but it was awesome.

Acme Oyster House seemed to have edged out Drago's in more ways than one, so if I ever have the craving, I am heading to Acme.

Best American-style sushi value in the area, which wasn't what I was expecting but the living social voucher drew us in. The atmosphere is very nice, and I thought the sashimi ceviche was outstanding. Didn't think the cuts of fish on the nigiri in the sushi deluxe were nearly as good though.
My "go to" for a quick, healthy bite and delicious juices in downtown Indy!  They're open pretty late at night too and serve amazing cocktails.  Definitely one of my favorites; I highly recommend it.

Great local chain, this particular place boasting better parking than its downtown relative.  I was saddened to see on this visit that the crab benedict had been taken off the menu and instead opted for the eggs and bacon basic breakfast.  My plate had several strips of thick cut bacon and eggs cooked perfectly, but their hash-browns could have used some seasoning oompf.  We were quickly seated, the environs were clean and spacious and the staff was accommodating.

Wow.  Gluten friendly 1/2 lobster 1/2 crab roll.  I couldn't decide which was better, so I had to order another.  It's still a tie.  I also tried the gf lobster chowder. Fantastic. Love this place.  Ladies working there were super awesome, friendly, and were good at what they do.  Do not miss this place if you're in Philly.  

Note they are fine for the gluten intolerant, but it is not a gluten free establishment.  They are aware and will inform you of this: cross contamination could be an issue if you have a serious gluten allergy.

An incredible array of locally brewed beers - the orange creamsicle nitro IPA was truly unique and delicious. So smooth. Great space for kids with board games and colouring available. The craft brewed soda could be a bit more flavourful and the pizza we had was good, but not worth the trip (this is way south for us). Still, the beer and atmosphere were good enough that we'll likely be back.

The premise is clean organic eating which I love!This establishment is counter service during the day and table service at night. First trip I had the Smoked Salmon & Scrambled BLT it was $14 and it was only ok. I drank the free water on the table. There was a lot of bread and I ended up eating the sandwich open-faced. I wish I had gotten a juice or smoothie to try but after $14 on a sandwich that wasn't an option this time. My coworkers ordered other meal options but no one was blown away. It was just ok.

On my second trip I came for dinner with my family because my sister loves this place and I have to say it has improved since opening. I got the chicken salad sandwich and hot cauliflower. I am in love and wish I could eat it everyday! 

 I will say the ambiance was fabulous and this place is truly adorable! If you think you might be into it, I say just go for it and try to form your own opinions because you might like it more than I did.

There is EiO & The Hive parking right outside but it indicates that there is a 20-minute limit which doesn't seem like enough time.

After making my rounds through Indy's hair salon circuit, and losing a couple great stylists to moves and career changes, I have been a faithful customer of Bang for the past few years. Bang's environment is comfortable and non judgmental. Rachel and Melissa have created a down-to-earth and creative space welcoming of anyone. I was referred to Rachel by a friend, and haven't turned back since. She's incredibly sweet, and great at understanding what I want. I've always been very satisfied by my cuts and my overall experiences. Rachel was also very supportive when I made the decision to stop dying my hair, whereas past stylists were not as understanding. So grateful to have Bang and Rachel in my corner!
BONKERS! The lamb Swarma was insanely good. Small joint but it makes up for it with awesome food and good vibes. Huge portions for a solid price.
Delicious good and great customer service. A must stop for anyone who's hungry and in the area!

The smoked brisket is AMAZING. I would definitely go here if you're in the area. It has to be some of the best BBQ in Philly. If you can't find parking on the street (good luck) there's a parking garage across the street by whole foods. Everything that everyone in my party ordered (5 people) was very good.

Must try for all desert lovers!! The staff is absolutely friendly and will help guide you through all the delicious choices!  I got the brownie bowl with the bear batter and it was amazing!! Especially with the warm brownie that's balances the cold ice cream. Don't miss out on this!!

Rarely would I go out of my way to review a place on a second platform but this place is phenomenal. The Chinese food and the sushi are ON POINT. Being from NY I'm picky about Chinese and I've been impressed every time. Better yet is their service. Honestly top notch. I order direct and their website is user friendly saving all the food service delivery fees of Uber or the like.
Absolutely loved it here, I could get lost in this place! If you're a lover of antiques you'll want to pay this place a visit! Lots of variety as wel

We Had a great time. People were sitting out side they had air and mist blowing for everyone outside so they would t get hot. We  decided to sit inside because we had a party of six. Our waitress was outstanding. We ordered  2 appetizers the flaming cheese saganaki... Amazing, and Tzatzikii which came with pita bread. Yummy yummy yummy!! I could have licked the bowl but my family would never have gone out to eat with me again. I got the chicken gyro platter... Loved it... it was so much food. It comes with fries and a Greek salad. Three people in our party got the regular gyro platter. Everyone of them had to get a take home box as well but they loved every bite... they wanted to eat more but felt they may have to roll out the door. The salmon was very good and she ate every bite of it! My nephew ordered the  cheeseburger and Greek fries and he was as satisfied as a teenage boy with a phone and a burger would tell me but there wasn't anything left on his plate   The waitress came through and put on the music and danced threw napkins up in the air and all over us yelling  OPA and dancing around the room celebrating my daughter. They threw plates into a aluminum bucket  braking them in Greek tradition yelling  OPA and clapping! And dancing! It was great fun and such a sweet surprise for my daughter. We will be back! The food was great the atmosphere was fun and the staff was so friendly!  ( also we were more than 6 feet apart from any other table ... we felt very comfortable)
This is the best sushi I've had in Philly! After many attempt to find good sushi in this city, Kai wins it!

We ordered food to go because the restaurants at Union Station all had 1.5 to 2 hour waits. The food  at Maggie's was so good, we ordered it twice.  We had the black bean burger, which is served on a giant pretzel bun.  I ordered it with lettuce, onion, pickle, tomato on the side and they packed up the condiments in a foil packet, so the bean burger wasn't soggy.  We also has a cuban which was great, pretzel bites with cheese, french fries, onion rings, chicken wings, and pepperoncini dip.  The orders were all completed accurately, the food was delicious, and it was prepared quickly.  We called the orders in, and 20 minutes later they were ready to be picked up. The serving sizes were large. The pepperoncini dip was my favorite. Will definitely get food from there again when we are back in the area.

Marc is the kind of guy you usually ignore. He's the piano man. He's the guy who plays the music to fill in the gaps of conversation while you fumble for words to say to the stranger who you've regretfully invited to eat with you, whom you've just met on Tinder, hoping for an escape from this nightmare you've found yourself in. 

And then it happens... the man at the piano plays a sweet tune that brings a smile to the face of your date. It's an oldie but goodie. She begins to sing along and you find yourself awkwardly smiling and looking around because you don't know how this is going to turn out.

She encourages me to sing along: "You know the words!" she says.  Of course I do, it's Journey... I hesitate.. she gives me a prod.. So I give in. 

Fast forward 10 mins and we're at the piano, drinks in hand, arms around each other... and Marc, belting out tune after tune. An hour went by and the lights came on. It was the end of the night and I didn't want to leave.  I tipped Marc and took a card... and then gave the man a big hug. I think we connected that night.

I just found his card in my jacket pocket. It's been almost year since I saw him, but now that I've found him here on Yelp I had to share my story, I can't wait to have another great night, sharing a piano bench with him. 

As for the girl.. she took the midnight train going anywhere..

I ordered a custom birthday book from the inquirer website on Black Friday and I was disappointed to see that it did not arrive by Christmas. I emailed their customer service line and they immediately refunded me 20% and wrote a long apology about the unforeseen circumstances and how Covid was affecting their processing. The emails felt very personal and I liked how the customer service line also had their pronouns in their signature, they seemed very inclusive and welcoming. I emailed again a month later wondering where my book was because they said it should've been shipped that night I emailed before and they refunded me another 30% on my book and yet again had a long apology talking about the circumstances. They offered me a full refund if I wanted that instead even though they don't do refunds on my product typically. Overall their customer service was phenomenal and I wanted to write a review to say that I appreciated their time and effort and they know how to handle customer service extremely well.

I absolutely love how she does my eyebrows there. They are typically pretty quick. I'm in and out within 20 mins. I'm not sure if they just warmed food up or something. But this time in the wax room coming from the back was a bit of a unpleasant smell. It cost about 10 bucks to get eyebrows done. They have a list of different services. I have gotten my nails done here and I was very pleased with them.

Delicate & delicious "short eggs" spicy marinara casserole took me back to my childhood. Friendly, efficient staff and hip clientele plus great coffee and, oh yeah, CLOTH napkins. Very classy and enlightening.

This coffee shop/bar is a very acquired taste. I like the set up and I like how it has organic and vegan options however if you're not a true coffee lover I would not recommend this. I had the Horchata latte and it wasn't exactly how I expected it, it was a lot stronger and Horchata is very light and sweet, they use organic cacao and I believe that's what overpowers the flavors. I enjoyed my latte, would I order it again I'm not too confident.

I am a regular at Zizzo's, because it has the best brewed coffee in town. I probably go at least 1-2 a week just for a 24oz large coffee for 2.50!! A delicious cup of coffee (or technically three) at this price is unbeatable.

I'm definitely a coffee snob and I care deeply about the roasting. My husband is from Seattle and my mother travels quite often to Colombia. Zizzo's is my favorite because they always have a light roast, medium roast, and dark roast coffee of the day to chose from. 

Let's talk about light roast. I have a deep appreciation for light roast coffee for a couple of reasons. First, it has the highest caffeine content. Second, it's hard to do light roast that has a good prominent flavor. All of Zizzo's light roast coffees are amazing. I personally love the Mexican Altura and the Guatemala Antigua roasts.

The medium roast is the Santa Barbara blend and it's great too. A solid go-to. I'll occasionally get a dark roast, and have never been disappointed. Occasionally they have a Tanzania peaberry, and I can never pass that up.

Their food is okay(but delicious at their other location), the clientele are friendly, they love dogs, and I've never ever had bad service. Tammy is my favorite barista, she seems genuinely happy! 

This was all about the brewed coffee, but their espresso drinks are also really good. I like the Mexican mocha the best. I don't recommend the biscotti, but the other baked goods are fine.

They also give my pup a dog treat, and that makes me happy!  I also forgot to mention they have a few great beers on tap, and a fun system where locals buy each other beers in advance and Zizzo's puts their names on the wall and what someone has purchased for them.

The food here is alright, but the customer service and location quality is awful. No one is ever friendly and they don't want to give you the time of day. The service is extremely slow, even when there aren't many people inside or in line. I've waiting 15 minutes just for a salad. When you walk in it smells like a moldy thrift store and the bathrooms are always disgusting. The toilets and sinks need to be cleaned. Not to mention the employees often hang out in there on their cell phones. No wonder the service is so slow. Also, there are no rain shelters over the drive thru windows. The inside of my car always gets soaked and the employees seem to get annoyed that I have to roll up and down my window while I'm waiting. Even McDonald's has rain shelters. McDonalds. Come on.
I love the quesadilla here so delicious . Whenever on this side of town I stop here . The green salsa is hott and I love it

Very friendly and welcoming Staff. Deelish food. In business since 1971; a long-time staple in the community, within close proximity to the Wells Fargo Center/Citizens Bank Park/Lincoln Financial Field.

Excellent. Super friendly, clean, fast service, fresh. Selection is great, smoothies, coffees and muffins, cookies, bagels and tarts. Great location, only half block off the park area. Definitely coming back!

This is our hands down favorite pizza place. We love their crust, breads, and sauce. Even better than ordering their pizza is their dine in experience. We hit brunch here today--they do brunch starting at 10am on the weekends with bottomless mimosas and bloody mary! We came right as they opened. I ordered the soup and a calzone,  he ordered the Megan breakfast sandwich. The general manager, as my soup was taking a little longer than they anticipated (which wasn't long at all), offered us complimentary biscuits with a to die for honey butter. We loved all of it and had a fantastic time! Their facility is clean, professional and very relaxing. Our wait staff was also very good amd timely with our drinks and overall service. I can't say enough good things about this place!
This place is so much fun with so much variety of food!!!!!!!!!! Lot go the stuff and homemade, freshly made. My old high school reunion from C. High was thrown here. Oh boy did we have a blast
These guys were pros. Drove up, guided my truck into the bay, got some info and got to work on the oil, fluids and safety check.  Pretty good for an out of towner or local.

This market is a super trendy spot to grab all types of food.  I grabbed some olive oil and balsamic vinegar, ice cream, cupcakes, and coffee.  It was a wonderful detour from the errands I had planned for the day.  I'd like to come and spend more time in here.  Better than posting up at Starbucks by far!!  Definitely a place to see and be seen.
The Quality and wide variety of choices of food was amazing. The service was top notch! I will be back many times for sure for that price!

A taste of home in your mouth they hit the mark on good west coast authentic Mexican food and real sangria we are Cali born girls and Los Arroyos gets our stamp of approval and our waiter Deven was/is absolutely amazing & attentive

Great environment to have small group dinners. Kids will enjoy this place because the cooks are very entertaining (if u do habachi). Place is super clean and friendly. They do sing happy birthday and give a small cube complimentary cake.
Delightful place. Our waiter helped guide us through the menu with perfect recommendations. Everything was so delicious.

I have dined in four times now and every time it's been consistently delicious. If you're from the Northeast it's always a challenge to find a great deli sandwich.

Pickles plus has the real thing, their corned beef and or pastrami sandwiches are lean, carved thin and piled high on freshly baked breads, pumpernickel, or rye. Great, spicy deli mustard. Everything's home made. I love their home made potato salad, unlike other area deli's whose condiments come in pre made manufactured tubs.

Fridays I make a special trip for their homemade New England clam chowder. Nice and creamy with lots of clams.

Pickles plus has one of the best Greek salads I've tasted, it's huge. Very courteous servers who go the extra mile to ensure you're satisfied. I understand they have an excellent breakfast and that's what I'll try on this Sunday morning.

Located in Northwood plaza at McMullen-Booth and Enterprise Rd.
Great time! Great atmosphere and delicious food. Just keep in mind they mainly serve tapas/small plates so it can get pricey. Great to grab drinks and a few bites.

I had my husband's birthday dinner held on June, 27th for a party of 9 people.  Took over 3 hours from start to finish, which is a long dining experience... I ordered 2 Raw Samplers for the table.  As I (the hostess of the dinner) was about to eat an oyster; I noticed a little worm moving on the inside of the shell.  I did not want to alarm my guests as they all ate parts of the sampler.. I gave the oyster to our server, Diego P and wanted to at least let the server know what was being served.  Not once did the manager stop by throughout  the course of our meal.  

As the checks were presented and after payment was taken, I asked to speak to a manager.  The GM claimed she stopped by twice, but didn't know who to approach about the situation.  This is completely false... The only people that stopped by were part of the service staff.   All I was looking for was an apology and a reassurance that the seafood is delivered fresh... She just continued to claim she stopped by the table...  

Those little details in a guest's dining experience makes a big difference if to return or not...

I am not allowed in this store, because I need everything here. NEED. And, with their absurdly friendly, helpful, informative staff I can justify all of it. 

They have every gadget and useful kitchen tool you can find, both utilitarian and whimsical, as well as fun gifties and appliances. I'm willing to pay an extra dollar or two for the service and the variety of options.

This is another wonderful Yelp find.  I am not from Nashville, so the only way I found this is through the app.   I live in Texas and can be a little picky when It comes to brisket.   This place does it very well.  I was super impressed.   Their hot BBQ sauce is also a must try.  A bit of heat with a bit of sweetness. 
Great service here all the way around!   Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

We got to the distillery after a tour had started about 10 minutes prior so we didn't get the full tour. What we did see was interesting and the sweet tea and spiced rum drink to go along was refreshing. I did enjoy the tastings, although it is hard to drink rum with no chasers (for me) in the middle of the day. The entrance price was reasonable but make sure you call a cab about 20-30 minutes before you're ready to leave or else it takes forever for them to come.

this is a little out of the way, but really worth the visit.  the audio guide was really informative, and voiced by steve buscemi which made it that much better. the penitentiary closed in 1971, so it was really cool to hear stories about it from people that were actually in the prison.  the architecture alone is worth the visit.  i definitely recommend this for anyone interested in history, architecture, or the paranormal, cause it's definitely a creepy place.

Let's start with their menu, it was extremely confusing. I didn't know how to start and what to order, took me 15 minutes to figure out their menu. We ordered spicy asian wings, 2 bibimbap, and the black bean noodles. Their wings was not even hot, and you can tell it been sitting in the freezer. Bibimbap and black bean noodles was plain. I do not recommend this place. There is another korean restaurant that 10 times better than this place, i think it called Kimchi Time.

COVID 19 pickup order while doing a job in Treasure Island. the food was good and while waiting the bar tender was able to serve me a beer at the door. Though it was raining... still good! We will come back when the establishment is open fully..

Dillinger is kinda difficult to find if you've never been there before.   They're located in a nondescript shopping complex but you need to turn before you get to the sign otherwise you'll have to loop around.  The first time I went, I was not very impressed with their offerings or the atmosphere.  It was very hot and they did not have any ac (or so it felt like).  They've got maybe 5 tables and a bar, which can be kind of limiting if you're with a group of people.  I've been to 2 beer geek bakery pairings and have gone several times since then because their beer is very good and they usually have a pretty diverse selection.  I've actually never had the same beer twice there.  Most recently, I tried their saguaro patch, which was everything I could have hoped for in a sour beer.  They also have very good IPAs and ales each time I've been.  I would recommend them and currently they've got a pretty good deal on Groupon as well.
I got their Sweet Greens smoothie and it was perfect. Not too sweet but just enough sweetness to make it taste great. Just what I needed.
I took my husband for his birthday on 10/17 and we really enjoyed our 1st time eating there!

These guys are wonderful and what a breath of fresh air after trying to deal with a couple of other Reno CPAP supply (medical supply) companies who seem to not give a damn and who farm their billing and customer support to really really bad call centers (impossible to get a resolution).  Thank God for these CPAP and More (who my doctor actually recommended).  They are knowledgeable and on top of the game.

What can I say about the best Philly Steak and Cheese... yep I said it... I know the tourists rage about Geno's and Pat's rivalry... but that's exactly what it is... for the tourists who don't know any better... like a moth to a flame...

The real debate is John's or Tony Luka's... I don't think there should be a debate...

What you have here is the genuine article of goods... if you are coming to Philly for their cheesesteak... the best one... than you have to have it here and maybe at Tony Luka's... I still think John's is better!

You can't go wrong with either the classic Philly or the Hoagie! Just whatever you are in the mood for that day... the line gets fairly long if you come at prime meal times! I would suggest going early or late to beat the crowds. 

There are some seating areas outside or an enclosed outdoor seating area... I can't wait to come back for some more!

A neighborhood bar where the regulars welcome you with open arms. It was refreshing to have a Bartender with such an incredible/attentive attitude!  Ashley was wonderful!  The drinks are priced right and the modern Digital Juke Box has every song you are looking for. If you like Nevada gaming the Local has that as well. Recommend if your looking for that hometown feel.
The food was so authentic and delicious. the sushi super fresh and the service was awesome! we had the chicken on fire and the fried rice and various sushi. spring rolls also. we will be back!

Searching for a lunch spot on the north county side of the tracks can be a challenge. It's not often I get out of the office for lunch, so we stopped in at the Taqueria to give it a try. 
Upon arriving, there was an overwhelming smell of fertilizer when we got out of the car. Unfortunately, that odor followed us into the restaurant. That put a little damper on things from the start. 
The service was very friendly - and the chef was genuinely interested if we enjoyed the mushroom quesedillas. (We did) My meal was not the most memorable, but the cheese dip was pretty good. 
The set up of the place was a little odd- I would describe it as a taco bell el maguey hybrid. I'm glad I ventured out in a new part of town, I just hope the grass is really tall and green next time I stop by.

Perfect place for a special occasion, such as a birthday for a special person. Ordered calamari for two as appetizer w/Merlot wine, snapper w/risotto and spinach, prime rib w/baked potato and asparagus. Closed with Glenlivet single malt scotch, chocolate bourbon pecan pie, and coconut cake baked on premises! Did not have to ask for bread w/olives and olive oil, water with lemon! Waiter not informed by staff that coconut cake should come with candle for "birthday girl", but quickly remedied situation. On top of this, live music to serenade us! A hidden gem in Ewing Township!
Best Cheesesteak place hands down. I drive 25 minutes from Philly to go here

New Year's Eve 2015 was just another night at Basin, and I love that.

We had a reservation, and were seated immediately. FYI there is a specialty cocktail list on a chalkboard above the open kitchen. Our waiter didn't mention it, but we found it anyway. 

I got the duck ragu and he got the yellowfin tuna. The duck was great and I wolfed it down, but the tuna was DIVINE. Buttery, perfectly cooked and served over a Mediterranean kind of salad. Yum, Yum, Yum.

We used a restaurant.com coupon so with one cocktail and two entrees it was only about $40.

Decided to try this place since Sun Diner was closed. Our waiter Cole was excellent! We ordered the dirty chips, wicked chicken sandwich, the Mac n cheese and trio plate. Everything was excellent. Cole was on point refilling our tea and water glasses. He recommended the Mac n cheese it was great!! We loved the trio plate the smoked trout was fantastic! Great atmosphere! We will return again.

Our dinner was absolutely delicious! We started with the tasty masala dosa e.g. Indian crepe with potatoes. Our entrees, butter chicken and rogan josh lamb tasted freshly prepared and full of flavor.  So happy to have excellent Indian food in Wayne. We'll be returning sooner than later.

Came back a second time tonight and must say that we don't agree with the other reviews. Lamb kebab, chicken saag (requested medium spicy), garlic naan complete with mango lassi hit the spot!

Fresh seafood, cheap prices, awesome customer service and tasty desserts; what more do I need!?!

I had an order of Salmon nuggets, Fries and Steamed Broccoli. The nuggets were very light, the broccoli had garlic butter dripped on top and the fries are beer battered. Yummy yummy yummy. My bro had Flounder, Broccoli and Mac & Cheese. I'm not a big fan of their mac and cheese but love that their seafood is not heavily breaded.

Thread lightly with the desserts....I can only confirm that the strawberry cheesecake is delicious, everything else, ehhh, idk.

Oh and you can't eat in; I mean, you can stand and eat by their counter but that's like eating at a bus stop! =|

We stopped in for the live music.  No tao beer, only bottles was disappointing.  The service was even more disappointing.  The location (kitty corner from Bridgestone Arena), the live music and the atmosphere bring it up to three stars.

Service and food was ok. When we walked in we were told that the service was going to be slower than normal do to a large party that had not arrived yet. Drinks were left empty and required us asking to have them filled. The food portions were large and impressive.

The food is good and the atmosphere was even better. The beer pitchers are perfect for 2 if you're looking to snack and hand around for a couple hours. Whether you're a partying post-grad, chatting with your other mom-friends, or catching up with an old friend, this is a good spot.

I am always in search of the perfect espresso shot, and I heard about this place so decided to check it out. This is not your local Starbucks, this is a coffee lovers shop, they brew cups individually and they have different roast to choose from. I decided to just try the espresso. Pulling the perfect shot is not as easy as it looks, first of all it requires excellent espresso, the perfect grind, the perfect dose of espresso in the pod, the right amount of tamping pressure (30lbs), a good, and well calibrated espresso machine, and finally the timing of the pull, it can't be too long or too short. These guys are pros, the espresso was excellent, excellent crema, and body. I won't go into describing the flavor of the espresso, because well then I will just sound like a douche, lets just say it was good.

Free delivery and cheap, decent Chinese.  
Don't plan on eating here - that's for sure.

I had long marveled at the fact that Franklin was such a black hole for good coffee.  Starbucks was everywhere, good coffee shops had shut down, and even the few place you could go were mediocre at the very, very best.  Downtown was especially bereft anything resembling good coffee.

So, I was driving down Bridge Street, and I see "The Coffee House," and suddenly, I realized that hope abounds.  To be fair, I do know that recently another coffee shop has opened downtown, but I hadn't been able to get a coffee there, so I'll call "The Bubbly Gorilla" to maintain anonymity.  I actually had stepped into the Bubbly Gorilla, but the line to the counter was practically to the door, and I just didn't have time.  This is not the establishment's fault, and I will get around to it whenever I have an hour to invest in downtown Franklin

With all that said, I do enjoy The Coffee House very much.  I could see it as a casual relationship whenever I am in the area, say as a local buddy I visit if I have time.  I go to see it whenever I am in town, maybe get a cup of coffee, but The Coffee House will never be my serious coffee relationship: it's just too far from where I live.

When I made my order, the fellow that I had was competent, thoughtful, and considerate.  I'll be the first to complain about brain-dead  teenagers at making my coffee, but my experience did not reflect this problem.

It has a nice comfortable layout.  Various rooms for various purposes.  The record room was a really nice touch.  It's literally a room where people can listen to old albums.  Other dining areas were nice too.

I will echo those who complain that the counter area is not well deigned.  There's just room to maneuver around if someone is standing at the ordering area.  It's a serious flaw, and they should really figure out a better solution.  The also use Bongo Java coffee, which is tasty, but I can get it very easily elsewhere.  So many places use Bongo Coffee in Middle Tennessee that a coffee shop trying to distinguish itself should really go a different direction.  That's just my opinion, though, and The Coffee House does still makes it very tasty

Franklin was desperate for good coffee options, and it looks as though they're doing a lot better.  I can't wait to try the Bubbly Gorilla, but I already know that if it is a disappointment, The Coffee House at Second and Bridge is a great place to visit.  Do not ignore this place if you're in Franklin and like coffee.

Lives up to the hype!

I've been thinking about going to Sabrina's for brunch for a while now, but I've been unwilling to deal with the wait. I finally gave in. I went on a Sunday morning. They told us it would be a 30 minute wait, but they probably got us seated slightly faster. I ordered the eggs benedict and it was absolutely first rate. Everyone at my table loved their dishes. The coffee was excellent. Service was efficient (not overly friendly + got shit done). If you're not in a hurry, Sabrina's is well worth your time. I love when a place lives up to its hype. Will definitely go back.

Glad I gave it a go! A decent place with good food and friendly workers. Bf and I had the One Shot breakfast sandwich w/bacon and the Ultimate breakfast sandwich. Both were yummy (we preferred the One Shot). We also shared a bacon cronut which was a nice "appetizer" to our breakfast. I had a coffee and he had a chai, which was also tasty. The wait for the food wasn't terrible. I also like that you order at the counter, they bring you the food, and they pretty much leave you at peace (kinda like how they do at Cosi's, but more personable). I'd come back!

Great Food, TERRIBLE Service. 

23

Yes, 23. That's how many servers passed me in the 7 minutes after being seated before one came to my table (of course, some of them were actually serving).  That put the experience off to a bad start, what with my low blood sugar and all. I was about to walk out, feeling snuffed and ignored, more so when the table next to me was immediately greeted upon seating.  

When the server finally arrived to take my drink order, things began to look up. The Wisconsin Cheddar Bites arrived and were excellent!  Hot. Crispy. Tasty. Not quite worth the wait (because the wait was so long) but still delicious, with a tasty, chunky Marinara.  

But then another 23 minutes of waiting for my main course and then they got it wrong. Once they finally got it straight, the manager brought it out herself, IT WAS GOOD!  Tasty. Fresh. And Generous. The Baby Backs were fall-off-the-bone good (but still had the silver skin on) and the BBQ Chicken was done just right. Their Honey BBQ Sauce is very good, but you'll want to ask for extra. 

Vicky, the Manager on Duty, checked on things and seemed to care, but still the Service left so much to be desired. Unfortunately, I didn't have a Penny to leave for a tip.

I wish I could give this place 0 stars! It was HORRIBLE! Do not waste your time or money at this establishment. The manager was beyond rude and disrespectful. I will NEVER give this place another dime of my money. When asked about the poor customer service, the manager told us he didn't care about customer service, they were just there to make money. The food was cold and poorly seasoned. When we brought this to the establishment's attention, we were basically told they didn't care if we liked the food, we had to eat it. He never offers to make it right or to switch it out for something else.

We've been to the Blue Dog a few times, to both locations (in Chalfont and Lansdale) but as Lansdale had a beer we really wanted to try, we hit them up for some dinner.

The crowd was quite light, with several booths open so we made our way to one in the center of the restaurant and proceeded to take in the menus. The Blue Dog has a decent amount of pub food, but it's rather limited in variety. You won't find juicy burgers or the like on here -- the only burger I saw was on a pretzel roll. Also, no cheesesteaks (a Philly staple!!). The beer menu is pretty deceiving as well. You are handed this large menu with what looks to be about 40 craft beers on it and you think "SCORE" until you get to the point after the 11th beer and it says "Coming Soon..." *womp womp* and then there are arrows of ones coming soon pointing upwards. 

The food was ok.  Not that it was bad, but it wasn't anything to write home about.  The French onion soup is perhaps the best I've ever had in awhile, but the sandwiches (I had the chicken italiano and he had the filet Panini) were loaded and soggy. There was no way you could eat it as a sandwich. I had multiple versions of fries on my plate, too (steak, regular, small .. very odd and inconsistent). I do have to say that our server was top notch and very helpful and attentive.  The dessert we had (homemade chocolate peanut butter pie) was probably the highlight of the evening. Very good but chunky (has nuts for those who aren't a fan).

I believe the pub has a bunch of events throughout the week - we happened on Trivia night. I guess the locals enjoy it, I've been to better (Steppy's in E. Norriton on Wed.nights). The MC was a little too creepy for my taste and the questions weren't really trivia relatable - just stupid knowledge.

As for the take-out area, they have a lot of decent beers, many locals that are bottled. If you drink those in-house, it's a $2.50 upcharge per bottle.  You can also try Capone's in E. Norriton for some really great brews as well and I don't believe they have an upcharge for drinking in the restaurant.

Nearly two hour wait for delivery, after order confirmation estimating 45-60 min. Did not get what I ordered. Not that it mattered, it was inedible anyway. Solid pieces of cheese that were once melted, but cold by the time we got it. Salad was the only enjoyable part. Will not order from here again. Big disappointment.

The fact that this place is so close and a BYOB earns huge points for me. I loved the entrees like the chicken parm and alfredo dishes. The service here is very friendly and fast to get the food. The breakfast here was not because of the more than adequate portion size but I guess I am more used to my omelette's from NJ diners filling it with veggies and the like. Again the service is friendly and attentive but take note that after you get your check, dont expect change soon or you credit card to be run through in a rush unless you can wave the service down to run it through. Perhaps its not to rush you but again, I'm used to other restaurants hopping on that fast. This wont stop me from coming back though.
Momma's is my number one favorite cheesesteak in all the land. That is all I need to say about it.

Table ordered loco moco, teriyaki and katsu with Mac salad and musubi. 

First off a Hawaiian place without Hawaiian sun is never going to be good.

Spam musubi is terrible. Absolutely offensive to someone who has consumed thousands of them. Rice is horribly mushy and over cooked and not seasoned, spam has hardly been cooked or seasoned. Where's the furikake?

Loco moco is ok, tastes like powdered gravy. 

I would say, do not come to this place.

Edit: Mac salad is terrible. Invest in your business, send the manager and cook to Hawaii. Please. My mama would shake her head.
The staff was very good, the good suggestions. They were right on the money,  the chile verde fries  really good.

The quality of massage is good overall - The best session I had was with Maggie. She gets a five star. The atmosphere is nice; they offer you tea if you arrive early and the waiting room and massage rooms are clean and comfortable.

Their membership and cancellation policies are lame, though. They require that you cancel by a certain point within the month for it to become effective for the upcoming month and you have to do it by signing paperwork in person. I was there once and the receptionist was struggling with someone on the phone about how they absolutely needed to cancel in person. After the cancellation, if you have unused massages that you paid member price for, they charge you the difference to make up the non-member price. I get it, it just feels shitty and duplicitous.

Not too impressive. The basic service is good. However, the cleanliness is not what Red Lobster used to be.  The food is disappointing. Don't think you are ordering something that looks like the photos in the menu. Very disappointing.

We ate dinner at New Leaf for the first time last night and we will be back. The food was delicious, the fried rice excellent, the sushi very fresh.  The place was crowded for a new restaurant in a strip mall in the middle of nowhere but not loud at all. 
Add to this that this is a BYOB and the prices are reasonable. We are definitely going back to try other dishes and I recommend this place.

We live close by and used to love the Cheddar's in Mt. Juliet were we use to live. 

It's Friday night so obviously very crowded. They sat us in section that has 2 parties in it. One table with about 10 people, and the other with about 18. Experience (as a patron and working at restaurants) tells me that, other than the obvious noise, food quality drops drastically when that happens as cooks struggle to get all the food out for that table at the same time, and other orders are either rushed through, or die in the window as they are ignored being the mountain of plates for the party. This is a good test of a kitchen, but let's keep an open mind. 

Our waitress Tiffany was very nice, friendly and helpful. She said she would put our order in before party which she did. Very nice. 
We ordered the Texas cheese fries, and the grown up grilled cheese. I usually have the Monte Cristo but wanted to try something new. Had a Caesar salad for my side. 

We ordered before the big party so our food got out fast. 
The Texas cheese fries were great as expected. No complaints there. 
The grilled cheese had roast beef in it, which tasted very bland and over cooked. The worst part was the cheese. It was sliced cheese which was by far not high end to say the least. 

Caesar salad was fine. Not bad, not great. 
The croissant on salad was awesome and sadly the best part of the meal. 

Not sure we will return. Not good enough for the price and so many other great choices with a 3 mile radius.

Our friend took us on an eating tour of philly, and this was one of our first stops.

The line looked long but it moved super quickly, this restaurant is tiny and we ended up taking our food to dizengoff to eat. I wish there was more seating inside because this restaurant is so popular.   Prices are decent for the food, we ordered a 3 piece, every order comes with a fresh donut!! We also ordered 2 of their flavored donuts. 

We chose the ranch powder flavoring, and got some extra spicy sauce on the side. Sometimes when you order fried chicken, you end up with a soggy mess because of the sauce. Not here!! The chicken is crispy and super tender inside. I could have used more ranch powder though. I wasn't a huge fan of the donuts because  I only like yeast donuts. These cake donuts are super fresh though, since they are made to order!!

This restaurant is a must go in Philly!!

I have been coming to Boyette Animal hospital for 4 years and I've finally decided to call it quits. I kept telling myself they were good enough because they are close to my house, have convenient drop-off and pick-up hours and they could usually work you in quickly on a Saturday if you had an emergency. But none of that outweighs their inept reception staff, long waits for scheduled appointments, long hold time on the phone, ridiculous fees for followup appointments, high prices for basic things like vaccinations, poorly trained vet techs that give you bad information, and doctors that don't communicate with one another and honestly, aren't the best in town.

I usually see a different vet every time I visit (there are several on staff), so I have to bring them up to speed on my dog or cat's medical history every time I go. It's annoying. I could schedule my appointments with the same vet each time but their random hours don't work with my schedule so I have to go with whoever is available. In the course of 4 years, I've seen 6 different doctors. 

My main complaint is the treatment. My dog developed a cyst-like wound in the pad of his foot about 2 years ago and was having trouble walking and had a lot of discharge from his eyes, like allergies. I brought him in and they treated him with antibiotics for the wound. The size of the cyst was reduced but it never went away. I kept bringing him back because the cyst would swell up, he still had trouble walking and his eyes still had discharge. After about a year and a half of antibiotic ointments and sprays, steroid shots and finally some anti-inflammatory medication, his foot was permanently mangled and his joints were shot. Three of his nails turned inward because of the cyst and he can't walk without a limp.

Frustrated, I took him to another clinic. I was immediately told my dog was 10 pounds overweight and that was causing stress on his joints, making it hard for him to walk. After a full x-ray, it was determined he had degenerative joint disease and needed to go on arthritis medication. The vet recommended a homemade low-calorie, grain-free diet to help him lose weight and reduce the allergy symptoms. I was told the cyst in his foot could be surgically removed but the deformity was permanent. I would just have to continue to put ointment on the cyst when it came back. Most likely with the weight loss and arthritis medication, the foot would be less stressed and the cyst wouldn't be irritated. 

I've gotten far better results and much more reasonably priced care within one visit to Dr. Easom at Christina Animal Hospital in Mulberry than I have in the 4 years and dozens of visits at Boyette.

I am definitely a fan of Dakota!  

Having dined here about 5 times, I can honestly say that it deserves a 4-star review and if you find yourself on the eastside of town, you should definitely eat here.

The atmosphere is great!  I love it!  Traildust Town is unique and quaint and simply fun.  If it's not too hot, or if the misters are going, sit on the patio and enjoy the periodic gun fire from Pinacle Peak.

Enjoy the apricot tea!  It is amazing!

The staff has always been kind and attentive and knowledgeable.  I've never had to wait for a table, but it's never seemed deserted either.

The food is decent.  If the food were spectacular, I would give it 5 stars, but it is simply decent.  It always seems fresh and healthy, but there's just nothing special about it.

To conclude, please dine at Dakota, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

I have been coming here since it opened and it has consistently been the same. The drinks can be great and the food-yeah not so much. I have always been willing to look past a ho-hum meal due to the drinks and the service, and that lasted until my  most recent visit. My husband and I went on a double date with some close friends expecting just a nice night out. Instead what we got was overcooked (and absurdly priced) steak and when brought the attention of our waitress-she just simply started ignoring us. No refills on drinks, no offer to take anything back, nothing. So we went to the manager expecting SOMETHING. What was our result? The manager informing us that his mother had the same meal earlier in the night and she loved it so he couldn't understand what we were complaining about. Needless to say now that I am aware that my palate isn't as refined as someone's mother, I am also aware that I will never go back there. Save your money.

Delicious! I had the Spicy Tuna burrito and it was more tasty than I could have imagined!!!! The laid back, positive attitude of the staff coupled with the delicious, fresh food reminded me of being in Santa Cruz. I WILL be back soon!

Good gelato that is not overly sweet, not foamy or artificial tasting. Their vanilla bean is pretty good, with a slight crunch like I expected. 

Interior is pretty cool and hip.

Overall Value:  Super crispy, juicy chicken at a reasonable price.  Far superior to Bon Chon and most other Korean Fried Chicken that I have had.  And they have a fairly large menu -  we will definitely come back to try some of the other items (and get more KFC, duh).  

The Food: We got the half chicken Korean fried chicken ($12.95), which you can get in two flavors - we got honey soy super spicy and sweet chili spicy.  We also got a tuna taco ($5.25), which they were nice enough to cut in half, they through in a free crunch ball (normally $2.75) because it was our first time visiting, and we got a medium matcha green bubble tea ($3.50).  The chicken was SUPER crispy and still very moist inside - it was phenomenal.  This was especially impressive because the half chicken isn't just wings or drumsticks - it's a half chicken that is cut into smaller pieces, so you are getting pieces of chicken breast too.  But these pieces were still impressively moist and flavorful as well (and I usually much prefer dark meat).  The sauces were both good, but my only complaint is the spice level on the super spicy was kind of weak.  If you are going to call something super spicy, it needs to have a bigger kick.  

The tuna taco was also quite good and had a really fresh flavor with the guac, cilantro, salsa, sour cream etc. A minor quibble is that because there is so much else going on in the taco, it overpowers the tuna a bit, but still good a decent size (it better be for over $5!).  The crunch ball was awesome.  Again, SUPER crispy outside and delicious filling with kimchi and rice, covered in flavorful sauce.  Matcha green bubble tea was delicious as always.  

We skipped out on fries because we thought it would be too much for two, but probably should have added fries to the order.  Half chicken wasn't quite big enough for the two of us, even with the taco and crunch ball (we eat a lot though).  We will go back to try the Korean Oven Chicken when that is available (there was a sign that said coming soon), and also try some of their many other dishes. 

Service:  So friendly and helpful.  On top of giving us a free crunch ball, they also were patient with us and gave great recommendations for the menu, and let us sample the sauces.   

Space and Pace: Fairly large interior with plenty of seating.  We came on a Friday night around 7:30pm and it wasn't too crowded - great spot to meet up with friends and get some awesome chicken.
OMG!!!! So so so delicious! Fresh, tasty  and simply perfect! I also recommend their hogie room, great experience...

Tried the Donut Sunday!!! Had a warm donut with vanilla soft served ice cream chocolate chips, graham cracker crust and warm chocolate drizzle!!! Best thing ever! Service was great, asked if it was my first time? Yes it was! So they helped so much! 
Fast,Affordable & Great service.

We were here for Devour. Had the steak medallion trio and a glass of Shiraz. The steak was cooked to medium which was correct, but the outside temperature was quite cool like it had been sitting for a while before being served. I know it was Devour, but the meal was still quite pricey so my expectations were high.  The server was very friendly and food was served promptly.

We were saddle shopping and stopped by Legacy Feed to buy supplies and view new and used saddles. Bob, the owner, was so incredibly kind and helpful. No pressure sales. Love this store! Highly recommended.
Amazing.   Best restaurant experience of the trip.    The chargrilled oysters and fried seafood are top notch, and the place is fun.  Plus we showed up early, around 5:30, and there was no line.

Beautiful, great food and service!  I've watched this restaurant being built over the past few months and was very excited when it finally opened up.  Reservations were easy to make.  Best part was when we arrived, we got a wonderful table outside right away.  The service was friendly, prompt and accurate.  The food is amazing.  My boyfriend is very picky about burgers and really enjoyed their burger!  I got the fried cod Banh Mi.  Being Vietnamese, I am a Bahn Mi snob.  Theirs was very good.  My only disappointment was the bread.  Don't get me wrong, the bread was delicious.  However, the most important part of an authentic Banh Mi is the bread and this just wasn't the right bread to use.  Nevertheless, it was delicious!  Although we sat outside, the interior of the restaurant is just as gorgeous.  This will be our go-to place for sure!  Great job and congratulations!
Your food was ok yesterday just ok, the fondue was delicious other than that our $300 meal was ok

There were 8 tables in the restaurant this morning. I saw at least 4 servers walking around. There was also a breakfast buffet set up. It took 5-10 minutes for someone to even greet us at the door (we were the only ones up there), and the lady told us to figure out if we wanted the buffet or eat off the menu, then left. When she came back, she told us to sit at one of two clean tables. Another customer said that they were out of half of the stuff on the buffet. We got to our table and sat for another 10-15 minutes, were passed by multiple servers and the General Manager, and not one person greeted us or said anything to us at all. We got up and left.

Very respectable sushi establishment, in comparison to normal run of the mill American sushi joints.  The sashimi is always fresh and tender. The rice is seasoned nicely. And the rolls are very good too. I usually get salmon, tuna, and yellowtail sashimi with a corona (not covid) roll.  The sashimi is sliced very thick, but I really don't mind as I slice it to my liking at home (take out) so that I get more pieces. :-)

Their mission is amazing.  www.insideoutcares.org 

They are absolutely delightful.  
INside our was established to brings awareness and understanding of human trafficking to our communities instilling a commitment for action to benefit those impacted. 

They came to Donnelly and served the Valley County community.  Such an incredible outreach and so informative.

Is "too much toast" ever a bad thing? I doubt it! At Toast, in New Orleans, you may suffer from "too much toast" syndrome, but by suffer, I mean benefit greatly from... until you enter into a debilitating food coma 30 minutes after finishing your meal. I love toast (the bread). I love to toast (the bebidas alcoholicas). And I definitely love to Toast (eating brunch at Toast, the restaurant). All three of which, I can do at once, at Toast! On my recent visit there, I ordered the Croque Madame, and instead of the side salad, I substituted a side of bacon because... bacon! It was so good, and so filling, I couldn't finish my meal! I haven't tried the Aebelskivers yet, but can't wait to do so, along with pretty much everything else on their menu, to be honest... I also want to toast to Toast with toast, at Toast... some day soon!
Myanna is by far the best nail technician I have ever been to. She is amazing. Always does a great job! She is a perfectionist! One Nail Lounge is the best !!

I visited this post office to renew my passport.  I was first in line.  You basically stand in line with the rest of customers.   I was happily surprised to know that the postal clerks all take care of US  passport issues. The mail clerk that assisted me, her name is Robin. Robin was excellent! She was very knowledgeable, patient and very professional.  She made me feel special, like I was the only customer. Well done Robin. I was in and out of the post within 20 minutes.  Started my day on a high note.

We had an amazing experience. Our guide was Louis and he was so well informed and helpful. He has a great sense of humor and tons of interesting knowledge about the bayou and about wildlife in the bayou. We enjoyed every minute of the tour. We saw at least 5 gators some far away resting on logs, one in the water with some water Lilly's, and even one that we were allowed to touch and hold on the boat. We also saw birds native to the bayou, a bald eagles nest, and a wild bore. Great experience. We got the experience for a great price ($20/ person) on Groupon.

Everyone at Pit Stop is kind and accommodating towards my 15 year old dog. She has very bad arthritis and tends to have some accidents at home so it is important for her quality of life that she remain clean and comfortable.

The groomer James is very sweet and understanding to her needs. She wags her tail and definitely has a pep in her step when she sees him. He knows her condition and is thoughtful enough to carry her up and down the stairs to the grooming salon (trust me she's not a small dog!
