She's around 45 lbs) and she always leaves very clean and smelling nice. he even takes time to put a cute bandana on her.

I definitely recommend this location, if my dog was younger I'd definitely look into the daycare as I've heard great things about it. It's great to have such a caring place so close to my apartment.

I signed up for Snap Kitchen food service delivery. I received my first order of 6 meals and did not like the food. Mostly because of the quality of the ingredients and overall taste. Since I'm not too fond of the taste, I canceled my subscriptions. However, when canceling instead of it canceling right away, Snap kitchen charged me for another order. I called their customer service number to ask them for a refund and to stop delivery. Their customer service rep was not very empathic or concerned. I will now have to contact my credit card company to ensure they do not charge my credit card moving forward. 

Due to their lack of good customer service, I  would not recommend Snap Kitchen to anyone. Perhaps try out Freshly or HelloFresh, who I also use and have only had positive experiences.

This place has ridiculously long lines as it is one of few places open in the STL airport. I'd rather eat vending machine food rather than come here again. The people were rude and literally laughed at me when I said I didn't want a bun on my burger due to dietary and allergy restrictions. I asked for extra lettuce, which I didn't get. I didn't get any sauce and the patty was rubbery and tasted like sawdust. I mean, I get that it's fast food, but c'mon!

We found this place on Yelp after our first option nearby was out of half their menu. Upon first glance of their special rolls menu, I knew we had picked well. We got three rolls for 2 people and that was perfectly portioned--the Spicy Dancing Kani Roll, Sakura Roll, and a basic Philly Roll. 

The specialty rolls were slightly bigger than the regular Philly Roll (as expected). I highly recommend both specialty rolls and next time would opt for all specialty rolls since their menu had many more delicious options.

Ambience was casual but nice...it was apparently the date-night spot for the two tables of first (or second daters) we were seated between. 

When I'm in Philly, this is definitely on my short-list of affordable eats, and I'd happily return.
Amazing!  Hosted a private party in the upstairs area and everything went perfect.  The food was amazing, the drinks were amazing and everyone had a great time!  I highly recommend for birthdays!

Amazing. 
Went in after a week of hospital visits and the plane ride from the terrible north, and just, couldn't have asked for more.

We did the duet couples massage, and I swear, I've never been so obsessed w my boo after an hour of silence and other people touching me. My masseuse was arguably the best I've ever had, and boo liked his too (he only kind of complained that he had was she avoided his butt muscles, which is the first time I've ever heard him say that). 

We were greeted with robes waiting, the showers are out of control, and offered something to drink while we chilled out and got out calm-down vibe on. 

Only complaint from me? ...once you were done with your drink, there wasn't really an opportunity to ask for another. Like, boo didn't realize they had champagne, so boo drank mine (that's real love), but then there was no more. Just me and tap water, which given how fly the place was, def made me feel I was bringing the classiness way down.

But if that's the only complaint, you'd be an idiot to overlook this place. Srsly. Class it up. Day spa life.

I am so happy this little cafe moved to a new location by my house! I loved my Bavarian Honey Ham sandwich with a delicious rice pilaf for lunch! I had sweet tea and later got a coffee to go, all of which were delicious! My boyfriend had an awesome roasted chicken panini and the regular unsweetened tea which he seemed to enjoy to the last crumb. I am definitely coming back to this place! I can't wait for the dinner/tapas menu to begin when it gets cooler!

PIZZA IS AWESOME
 Service could use some personality. The girls seating people did not even great us. We almost turned around and went to Hooters .. But, a friend really recommended the Pizza. So we gave a shot and loved it.

I'm not sure why, but the entire restaurant smells like really, really bad body odor.  I guess you sort of get used to it once you are in there, but it's REALLY noticeable.  Not sure if its someone that works there, or something old that is in there, but its kind of distracting and gross.  Aside from that, the food was AMAZING.  We had pork dumplings which were delicious, two different rolls and green tea ice cream.  I have no complaint with the food or service - both were excellent.  My only complaint would be the smell in the restaurant.  If you can get passed that or stuff like that does not bother you, then this is a definite place to try.  The sushi is phenomenal!

I don't normally patronize Channelside, nor do I normally bowl. Frankly, I can't honestly remember when was the last time I was in Channelside or when I bowled. I am a germaphobe when it comes to wearing bowling shoes and using balls that everyone and their brother has touched. 

It was not my night to pick out our outing, so I was told we were going to Splitsville. After cursing myself for not overriding the decision, I armed myself with Lysol wipes and hand sanitizer and mentally prepared myself to go. 

The business has disintegrated so much in Channelside that Splitsville is only open on Thursdays through Sundays. After psyching myself up to go bowling for the first time in years, I must admit I was a bit disappointed tonight that Splitsville was closed. 

I cannot blame Splitsville for only being open on select nights. After all, these Channelside businesses need to make some sort of profit. I only pray Jeff Vinik's bid gets approved by the end of this week so that there is some sort of revitalization of Channelside. 

We plan on returning soon so I will need to stock up on my Lysol wipes and hand sanitizer and start mentally preparing myself again. I will update my review upon our next visit!
Love love love this place!! My husband and I have only been in Hendersonville 12 days and we've already eaten here twice. The place is super nice, great service, and really good food!!
Service is awful...I had tacos and a vodka soda...taking forever to get my check...just got it. Don't go when it's close to closing.

I have been a Cabelas fan for years and it is nice to have one in Reno.  However this Scheels puts the Cabelas to shame.   If you only have time to visit one or the other,  go to this Scheels.   It is two stories tall and has a lot more stuff than the Cabelas.

Excellent beer, good service, great food, great atmosphere.  I had burger with loaded fries--I had to smoke a cigarette when I was done.  My better half gave the meatloaf high marks.
Not withstanding -- taste is individual.

This place was recommended to me from a local. We decided to try it out and the food was really good!!! the service was OK. There wasnt live music at dinner time but hopefully next trip! The fish marigny was to die for! Broiled shrimp and baked potatoes very tasty as well.

The State Capitol looks unassuming and dull from the outside. DO NOT MISS THIS STATE CAPITOL! 

We booked a 9a tour on a Friday in January and were the only tourists. Kristine gave us a wonderful tour and was quite knowledgeable. She took us into the house and senate chambers as well as the supreme court. 

This is a beautiful building that has been restored and is very will maintained. Most of the materials used are from Indiana which is impressive. The building was completed in 1888 and is filled with beautiful art. 

The most exciting part of the tour, though unplanned, was when our guide alerted us to the Governor walking through the rotunda. We asked him to take a picture with us. He was very nice and chatted for a minute. 

We've toured Illinois and Wisconsin's capitols and Indiana's is the most beautiful of them inside.

I highly recommend going kayaking in the swamps! It's a nice and quiet getaway from all the drinking and music on Bourbon Street. 

There are 2 swamp tours to choose from:
1. Manchac Mystic ($59 not including tax)
2. Honey Island ($65 not including tax)
- Use promo code ONLINE to get a discount

N.O. Kayak Swamp Tour provides the option of getting picked up in the French Quarter for an additional $20 per person but my group of friends decided to rent a car for the day to partake in other adventures. Super cheap option by the way! If you are driving, make sure to have someone navigate how to get there. There isn't an exact address but the instructions they send you are accurate so you won't have a problem. 

The kayak tour starts with a brief introduction and tips on kayaking. My friend and I were lucky to be the only ones that got the single person kayak and the rest were double riders. Some of my friends struggled with coordination so it's probably a good idea to let the staff know beforehand that you want a single rider. The swamp (Manchac Mystic) was beautiful! We learned a ton about alligators and other wildlife. We were lucky enough to go on a semi sunny day so we were able to see at least 4 alligators. I have to admit I was a bit scared at first but our tour guide advised us that 'gators are actually pretty dormant and since they're cold blooded, they try to conserve as much energy as possible. Also, the ones we saw were adolescents so they weren't too big. 

The tour altogether was 2 1/2 hours and it was a great arm/shoulder workout but it won't completely burn you out. Make sure to take water, mosquito repellent, sun block, and cash for tip. I'd definitely try this again at Honey Island!

Nice interior design and decoration. Lovely mural and well customized menu. Great quality ingredients but the taste is a bit off balance. The deviled duck egg is too sour. The burger and fries are very salty. The risotto has a lot of veggies and taste rich and creamy. The barley can be less cooked so as to be much more chewy. 

Very curious about the brunch menu, so will come back and have a try. The staff there are very friendly, and kindly suggested that reservation for brunch would be a smart idea. 

Overall, the contradiction between trendy interior and heritage building gives unique feature of the place. A great place to grab a drink and chat with friends.

We made a quick stop in here on our way to a Yelp event. The service was fast and our food came out hot. The staff were decent to us even though you could tell one didn't want to be there. Prices are reasonable. 
I don't go to this location often but the inside looks like they've recently remodeled. It was clean and had a contemporary feel to it. Not a bad place to stop if you need something quick.

I had a bad experience with a different stylist after asking for a silver ombre. She turned my hair green, then red, and then sent me a rude response when I asked for a refund. The owner of Essenza, Darcy, and a different stylist, Jessica, were incredibly sweet and did everything they could to try and make the situation right for me. I really appreciate how generous and concerned they were, and I think it reflects highly on Essenza's quality of customer service and care.

Jessica was able to remove the myriad of colors that were in my hair and even out the blonde without damaging my hair at all. She was very transparent about the process and each step to ease my worries, and she did a really great job on everything!

Haven't been here in a while and have never been disappointed coming here for breakfast!

Great service and it's pet friendly and family friendly and the portions you cant beat.

We will be back for sure and the kids loved it as much as the adults!
Really tasty hole in the wall. If you are in the area it is worth the stop. Good prices.
Great little market - they even offer Corpolese tomato pie! They have great hoagies for awesome prices as well as specialty ingredients. I believe it was cash only though?

We ordered "to go" and brought it home due the restaurant having a full sitting area at the time. (half were eating and the other half hanging out working on laptops) We had to trash all the food we ordered as it was mashed up and kinda slopped together when we opened it. A gold star for the chips and green tea though. We I would not give them any stars at all for anything else. We try to give a place a second chance because anyone can have a bad day, but this WAS the second chance. Probably will not go there again. Burger King next door is actually a better choice if that tells you anything.

Dropped in on a v cold nite.
Ordered a special. Bowtie chicken soup.  V poor.  Luke warm.  Broth thin, no flavor.  3# bowtie pasta, 1 slice carrot no chicken in sight.
Pork cutlets, spinach and rice, fries, macc n' cheese.
Cutlets heavily breaded and fried in old oil. Spinach and rice, tasty but cold.  V GD macc 'n cheese.
Jello.
Waitresses helpful.
Huge room for improvement.
Front of house v cold.

Service is a little disjointed but the food is delicious and plentiful.  Have been twice once sola and once with a group and had a really good meal.  The free appetizer is such a nice gesture and when servers aren't huddling they are nice.  

The hummus and salads are fresh and the meat Kebabs were flavorful.  Would recommend the lamb for sure.  

I hope that the shop will be successful and I hope that they continue to expand the menu.
Very willing to adapt to make rolls gluten free, although they did not have gluten free soy sauce.  Really yummy creative rolls with rock and roll artist namesakes.

WONDERFUL - two nights in a row.  Visiting from the Bay Area I was excited to find that Sierra St. Kitchen had such a high rating and was within walking distance of our hotel.  We enjoyed the first night so much that we returned a second night in a row.  From start to finish this restaurant definitely deserves 5 stars!  The quaint ambiance is perfect with an open concept, warm lighting and Frank Sinatra playing in the background.  We thoroughly enjoyed the craft cocktails and amazingly delicious food.  The level of flavor is on par with the great energy warmth this restaurant exudes.  We thoroughly enjoyed bruschetta, Cesar's salad, beet salad, shrimp tacos and tiramisu.  The service is spectacular, you won't want to miss the experience.

Been to Zahav many times and have never been disappointed. Pricey, yes, but you get what you pay for here - quality food, excellent service, superb wine list and cocktails. The sharing special menus include salatim and are a good deal. You'll leave with leftovers.

The hummus is among the creamiest, dreamiest ever. And the fried cauliflower is sublime.

I give Zahav the highest marks for everything-- and I'm a tough critic.

When we gutted our kitchen we must have ate 10-15 times in 6 weeks.  We have been patrons since the first year it opened.  

Very good food and a good beer selection.

What a blast! I took my brother who is a brewer on the Saturday tour for his birthday. We visited Urban Chestnut, 4 Hands and Perennial and had an amazing time going behind the scenes of some of St. Louis' best breweries. As a non-drinker, the experience was still amazing and the samples at each brewery were the perfect way to get a feel for each brewery's personal touch. Can't wait to go on another hop!

This Bar Louie is pretty awesome!   Great Location right in the heart of International Mall and next to my other fav spot Blue Martini.   Love the look of it inside the booths are round and comfortable. Plenty of seating for you and all of your friends.   Plenty of large screen TVs for watching sports at any angle.   The service is excellent as well.  My meal was very good!  Great place, location and excellent service!  I will be back.
Love this little family Owned business...really is the best in Greek Food and will keep going back over and over.

Attention tea lovers!! I first discovered Davidson's Teas because the yoga studio I go to offers a variety of Davidson's Tea to their guests. After the first tea I tried (I believe it was called African Honeybush) I needed to find out where I could get more of this tea!

First, I googled Davidson's Tea and found their website which has a HUGE selection and many different options when it comes to what kind of tea they have and how many bags are in each box. I knew I wanted to get a variety so I could figure out which ones I liked the best. On the website they offered a tea "sampler" for each category of tea (black, green, holiday etc.). Each sampler has 40 tea bags and you could get three sampler boxes for only $20. Sign me up!!!

I called the store here in Sparks to see if they offered the same price in store & the woman I talked to said everything that's offered online is also offered in store. I went in the next day and the two women that were working were so extremely nice and helpful. I knew I wanted white and green tea but I couldn't decide on the last box. They guided me to the honey tea based on my other two selections and I couldn't be more happy. 

Each of the three samplers has four different kinds of tea so I'm still slowing trying each one! I'm so excited and I can't wait to go back for more!
Amazing staff! Super friendly and taste is so good! So worth coming in and dine in! :0) thank you for the food and great customer service. We will be back soon!

This place is always good go to for a family celebration, or just to hang out with friends.  The atmosphere is a little loud, but obviously people are enjoying themselves.  We have always had a good experience.  The beers are good, don't get too attached to any one flavor because they are all seasonal.  I wasn't sure which beer to choose at our last visit, so our waiter brought both out for me to sample.  I recommend if you aren't a quick beer drinker to ask for a frosted mug to keep it colder longer.

The food is always delicious, and is enough for me to have another meal the next day.  We took minors our last visit, and the staff was extremely pleasant with them, they had a good time also.  This is a well liked establishment, so the waits could take a while, my favorite part of waiting is the porch swings they have out for people to enjoy.  Always enjoy going back.

These guys are excellent! I took my 2008 Porsche Boxster to them because there was some sort of fault in the Tire Pressure Monitoring System. They were not only the fifth garage to try to repair the problem, but I wrote several technical questions on the Porsche Club website and got NO RESPONSE! They fixed the problem quickly, professionally, and at a reasonable price. The Porsche Specialist has won a loyal customer. Oh, and I left my Porsche Club membership drop and told them why and again THERE WAS NO RESPONSE!
The best in Tucson! Fast beautiful service. Tailoring is an art - Brenda & Manuela are just a joy!

I suppose this is a fine store if you're a woman looking for workout/yoga gear, but my husband and I went in looking for workout tights for a fitness class he's taking and the service was not great (outside of the initial greeting). The store itself is geared mostly towards "women's wear" with only a small selection of men's clothes near the front. It was interesting, sitting in the change room, watching female customers being doted upon with different sizes and being asked if they needed anything while I was relegated to do the running for my husband myself (which kind of sucked because I'm allergic to the elastic in most their clothes and left with red welts on my hands). I would have asked for help, but the "changing hosts" seemed content folding and chatting about staffing issues when they weren't helping the ladies. We did find what we were looking for -- there were 2 pairs of tights in the entire store, that I dug out of the clearance rack.

Who doesn't love a good doughnut? I know I do... Especially when they are fresh. I mean, made in front of you fresh. I'm a huge fan of Krispy Kreme and how their donuts come out hot and fresh right off the production line. So on my recent trip to Philly, when I heard about Federal Donuts, I had to give them a try.

Very interesting flavors are available to you. You can get a Cinnamon brown sugar, Strawberry lavender, or Cookies and cream.

Of the 3, I think my favorite was the cinnamon brown sugar. I guess I just love the churro type of combination.

I give Federal Donuts a solid 4 out of 5 stars because I enjoyed the donuts and like the coffee shop kinda vibe. Interestingly, they are also known for their fried chicken sandwiches. It's a great place to try a number of different things.

Ordered food from here twice. Been disappointed both times. The food doesn't taste authentic, the owner or I believe is the owner treat the employees as if they are nothing( from the time I've been there). If you want the food to have that Middle Eastern touch, at least train your cooks to perfected. The falafel tasted so bland, the wrap had an old taste,  as if it had been left outside for a very long time. Fries were too greasy for my liking. All in all it was a great disappointment. I tried to give them another opportunity to be disappointed again.

I have tried many salons in this area after having moved here a year ago. I can finally say I found my spot!!! This salon is clean, staff is friendly and my manicures are always done perfectly. My manicurist- Amy is very dedicated to getting my nails to look like the Pinterest pics I show her. I never leave dissatisfied. She is absolutely amazing.

We've been keeping an eye on Dr BBQ for awhile now.  Tonight we finally made the trek over from our part of town. 

We were a party of 5 and seated after a brief wait. We stood in the entryway and were very entertained watching all the food the kitchen put up on the line. 

Everyone at the table ordered a variety of foods so we could try lots of dishes. 

Hands down the ribs were the fan-favorite. Pulled pork was the runner up. Also tried pork brisket, beef brisket and sausage. 

The sides were sadly all just meh.  The hot dishes were cold and cold dishes were lukewarm. We are big fans of bbq beans and we all agreed while the bean combo presented well, they lacked flavor. based on the servers suggestion, also tried- Mac and cheese, potato salad, collards, purple slaw, blue cheese slaw and fries. None were homeruns. 

Service was super speedy. The sauces are impeccable! Our table polished off a full bottle of sweet sauce.

Not sure I would drive over just for dinner again. However, if I was headed to the Trop I would likely give it another try.

If it was located anywhere else, this venue would probably earn a three from me but the location and prices cannot be beat. 

We ventured here a few minutes after it opened this morning around 11:15. The outdoor patio right next to the rail were already slowly getting filled up with patrons. We were lucky to secure the last table right next to the rail. Our host was very nice and told us our server would be with us shortly.

Sure enough, our server popped in to get our drink orders. 

The three of us shared a combination of things from the menu.

We ordered the Fried Clam with Tartar Sauce, She Crab Soup Bowl, Grouper Tamales, Super Cajun Grouper Sandwich with Fries (+$0.99 for fries to substitute chips), Tuna Poke Tacos.

My least favorite was probably the fried clams because of the inconsistency of batter to clam ratio. Some pieces were just pieces of batter. That being said, the clam pieces were delicious. 

The grouper tamales were average. The grouper was delicious and so were the sauces they served with it: rojo and salsa verde. I didn't like the masa mixture. I thought it too thick and bland. 

The she crab soup was delicious but super rich. I don't think I could have eaten the entire thing by myself so thankfully it was shared among the three of us. 

The grouper sandwich was delicious and very flavorful. I wasn't a fan of the fries that came with the sandwich. They were cut way too fat and not crispy enough for my liking.

My tuna poke tacos were very flavorful. I really enjoyed the sweet thai chili sauce and cabbage slaw that was underneath the tacos. The fish was generously portioned. 

My boyfriend ordered their Beer of the Month special which was $2.50 for a bottle of Banks Beer. He said the beer was watered down and not flavorful but considering the price, I wasn't surprised. 

Overall, it was a great experience and I can see why people love coming here. I loved sitting right next to the rail enjoying the oceanfront views.

Service was great. Our server got my tuna taco order wrong but was quick to fix the issue and apologize even though we ordered a lot so it's easily misunderstand as another dish on their menu.

Wow. Just wow. I have been going to Evan's relaxing station for a while and it was great. I've always seen little rainbow but never gone in until last night. First of all they have much longer sessions available and the prices are great. Next, they actually do have you take off your clothes and they use oil, hot stones, hot towels and the like. It was seriously amazing. I had Jenny and I highly recommend her to you. Seriously seriously great place.

This beach is smaller and usually less crowded. Across from john's pass it's a great way to enjoy the beach and take a walk to check out the shops or local food stops.  I've been going in the morning until just after lunch and it's just what I need to relax at the start of my day!

I live in Drexel Hill and found this place on Yelp, so I thought I'd give it a try . You can't drive too far for delicious ice cream, and coming from Cincinnati, OH with Graeter's Ice Cream, great ice cream is something Philadelphia is missing. I'd give this ice cream a four-star rating, but the small business and Judy push it to a five. I had a hot fudge sundae with two flavors. It was delicious! A HUGE amount of ice cream, too. HUGE! The ice cream was pretty creamy and flavorful. The next time--and there will be a next time--I will try just some scoops of ice cream so I can really experience the texture and flavor. 

This a definitely worth a visit for ice cream!

Went to the Philadelphia location. The one star is not a critique of the chiropractor. Andrew was perfectly fine. I gave 1 star because it is literally in the middle of the staff office in a CrossFit gym. No door. No privacy. Very weird. Maybe works for some, but not me.

Couldn't go last year and luckily had time this year to attend. Came by with two other friends who likes avocados and although I'm warned it is a small festival, it was a bit larger than I imagined. However, I still think it's just an average festival.
 
With the main selling point as an avocado festival, I imagined all the stands or vendors would have at least one avocado themed food. Several of them did not. This was off-putting to see since I would imagine the festival is just finding vendors to fill up spots and grow while not staying to the purpose of the festival. Aside from that, the avocado theme things I tried were the avocado beer, avocado tri tip sandwich, holy-guacamole with salted chips, avocado ice cream, and sampled the avocado cream pie. Kind of wanted to try the deep fried avocado, but I saw someone carrying it and decided that it wasn't worth it for that price. As a sum, the food is pretty much basic festival food. The only creative ones I liked trying were the beer, ice cream, and cream pie. The beer is IPA based and not overly hoppy - an easy to drink beer. Although, the cream pie and ice cream are overpriced for the amount given. I definitely wouldn't consider getting them another try due to the price point. The tri-tip was nice to have and enticing due to the smell, but it was just plain store-bought guacamole instead of freshly made guacamole. The holy-guacamole was severely overpriced for what it's worth. Other items such as elote (in a cup as well), hot dogs, tacos, fish tacos, and etc were sold as well. Avocado brownies were sold out unfortunately.
 
There were two avocado sellers and they were severely overpriced. If you are fanatical about it, go for it, but I rather buy them elsewhere at more normal prices. 

There were goods vendors on site as well as a ferris wheel. There were several stages for live music and the festival itself spans 2-3 blocks. At the non-beach end of the festival, there was an educational booth about avocados where I thought should have been the main attraction instead of the food vendors. I enjoyed seeing all the different varieties of avocados and reading up some history.
 
All in all, if you like avocados, you'll still come to check it out. Be ready for overpriced food and not enough seating of course. I definitely think 1-2 hour at most - depending on how large your group is and how willing you are to spend money to buy the food. I can't wholly recommend it as a popular attraction, but if you are close or visiting the area, it's worth a check. I wouldn't plan a trip with this solely in mind.
Being from Phoenix and traveling north, the great tacos become harder to find.  We found them here.  Great atmosphere with quick and tasty food.  Loved it!

I have been a patient of Dr. Diasti for quite awhile.  I love him and his staff.  The MA's are great.  The front office always is nice and courteous.  He has great nurse practitioners.  He and his staff really care.  When I needed to get in quickly, they were able to accommodate me.  Great office!

Went there for dinner tonight and had the chicken pot pie , you could tell it we home made. it was very good and I would get it again. The food came out very hot, it didn't take long for the food to come at all. Oh and the fish and chips is very good. The service was very good.

At the checkout aisle that we had to wait over 15 minutes they completely messed up my purchases. Some items rang up more expensive than what they were marked. After I noticed it I had to wait for a manager to fix it and even then it was screwed up on my charge card. I walked out of there with a handful of receipts and disappointed in their customer service. They need to train there employees how to use a register.

5 stars for their pizzas. Thin crispy delicious slices of heaven. One star reduction for customer service mainly due to their random closing of the restaurant. Three times in the past few months we went with note "closed for the day" taped to the window. They also randomly close early or open late. They don't have working phone number so no phone-in-orders and you never know if they're open or not.  Go at your own risk!   But if you go and they're open OMG their pizzas are fantastic.
This hospital fucking sucks. I've been here with my boyfriend for 3 days and he still hasn't seen a doctor and it take the nurses hours to get him medicine. Go somewhere else.

I have always liked a community with an HOA. I believe a HOA can improve home values and so on. Furthermore, they are a great asset to ensure all homeowners maintain homes in a consistent manner. However, in Concord Station, we have Terra Management as our management company. My communication with them has been poor and challenging. In 2017 countless emails and telephone calls went unanswered. Escalation attempts to the management at Terra went no where. Furthermore, recently, in the past 60 days, I experienced similar communication challenges. It is important you determine which management company a community uses before you buy a home there. That is because if you have a concern, I believe, communication with the management company is paramount. In the case of Terra Management, my experience is very poor and I do not feel this company understands and values communication

They want cash only!
Didn't like it and won't comeback again because of the wait and the food was not worth for the wait! 
My order was a chicken noodle, it came with only a little ingredients. I personally don't like the chicken breast and the taste of the soup. Overall it was too salty.

My response to Mark's reply:

Apart from the self-promotion, the fact remains that the work done is problematic at best. When discussing the AC, you offered it would suffice to flush the condenser, not replace it. Furthermore, it was the compressor a previous shop had recommended be replaced, NOT the condenser. Hence why we agreed to replace at some expense the compressor. 

When talking about these issues, I said to you, "talk with your parts vendor and get back to me with some suggested resolution" as it was obvious from the video I sent you the compressor was a defective part. In fact, you also added it wasn't the first time that had happened to you with this vendor.

What you could do is refund the cost of the parts and labor for defective parts, poor communication and the incredible inconvenience caused us. That would be the level of customer service you claim to offer but lack here with this customer.
======================================

I'm not happy having to write a negative review, but really have no choice. Driving from LA to Mexico through Tucson, our truck developed excessive overheating and failed air conditioning. We contacted these folks, went in for an estimate, agreed to price and time, and waited for the repairs to be done. Along the way, we were shown a bad thermostat, junked up coolant/radiator water and cap. We agreed to replace liquids and parts, and the AC compressor "kit" at over $500 for parts alone.

The parts arrived late and the work was completed several hours later than what was stated. The AC blew cool, not cold air, so, we paid (with a "new customer discount"), and went on our way, headed to NM. It was evening at this point, so no need for AC and engine temp stayed within normal range.

The next day we crossed into Mexico and by 10:30am, we found the AC didn't work and the coolant was over flowing. Contacted them twice, phone and text, sent videos and pics, and asked for a suggestion for resolving, as we were deep into Mexico and not headed back to Tucson. Twice more the truck overheated to above normal levels through our trip requiring hour long stops and fluid replacement.

After the initial contact, we have heard nothing back - it's now 2 weeks. AC still doesn't work, truck still overheats and looses fluids frequently (no leaks), and we paid almost $1000 for what turns out to be a huge mistake in having our truck "repaired" there. Perhaps more attention to quality control, results, and customer service after repairs would have saved us and them this negative review and further actions I know have to take.

Totally lives up to all the other great reviews.  We were in town visiting family.  Day 1 tried their cheesesteak with Cooper cheddar and fried onions - so super good.  The roll was the perfect combo of soft, little bit of crunch and the perfect amount of chewy.  The steak, cheese and onions were perfect. 

Then day 2 on our way out of town tried their grandmas pizza with pepperoni - also awesome!  We got it fresh out of the oven but it'e even better after it sits for a while.  We're driving back to VA and I keep reaching into the backseat for another slice (no, I'm not driving).  The sauce is so good, but so is the crust and cheese, plus the fresh basil - mmmmm, mmmm!   Not sure when we'll be back in Philly again but when we do Angelo's will be our first stop for sure!

Chicken and waffles- delish. 
Bacon Pancakes-delish.
The Bourse-gorgeous! 

Great breakfast.

Honestly, this place was a pretty big waste of time and money. My girlfriend, friends, and I went here for New Years last night.
We paid $85 to get in for an open bar which seemed fair before we arrived. When we got in, they had limited their bar to really cheap beers, a few alcohols, and pretty much no real mixed drinks. The bartenders there didn't even know how to make most drinks more complicated than rum and coke... The music was mediocre at best and there were some snack foods.

The most obnoxious part was when we decided that we could at least try to have a little fun hanging out and playing shuffleboard. The table had one of the end boards broken by some drunk girl about an hour earlier, but the table was still playable, so we just pushed the board back in and played. The bouncer came up and tried getting in our faces and blaming us about the table. Multiple people stepped in to let him know it wasn't us and then we asked if we could still play on the table since it wasn't going to get worse. He stayed being douchey and disrespectful to us and then the manager told us not to play on the table so that nobody else would get hurt. So we ended the night sitting down on the chairs and trying to get drunk off of the weak drinks they made at the bar.

TL;DR Don't waste your time or money at this place, at least not for New Years. The bouncer is a total chach, the bartenders are inexperienced, the music is mediocre, and the place is nowhere worth what they charge.

A restaurant that really deserves 5 stars.  I know I'm generous in my reviews.  I probably give 5 stars more than I really should.  This place absolutely deserves a 5 star.  

1) Excellent Service
2) AMAZING food
3) Price is super reasonable
4) Free valet parking

I wish I lived in stl so I could go here all the time.  I don't think I want to go to another restaurant in St. Louis anymore.  I wish I could come here for all special occassions.  

We had reservervations and had to wait 20+ minutes.  We didn't even complain and they brought us champagne at the bar to compensate us for the wait.  I mean, that is what I call great service.  

We took our mother here for mother's day weekend and I'm still thinking about the food.  If you want to go to a restaurant where you can enjoy the food and converse about the food, this is the place.
Such a nice find! Very busy for lunch when I joined them. Definitely check out their happy hour for margaritas but if you don't want to sit at the bar I'd def recommend a reservation.
We've been here the past 3 times we've visited Clearwater. I love seeing the beach, love the drinks and the waiters are so chill and nice and funny! I'd definitely recommend going there.

Good food, fast service, affordable, and very nice decor. Seating arrangement not great. They should have more tables for 4.

The veggie bowl with fried tofu was pretty good. Loved the full size portions. Hearty, healthy meal.

Third visit, and House of India is now on my short list of go to restaurants. I will not claim to be an Indian food expert, but they are great at getting me to come back.  I have enjoyed all of the entree's recommended by the staff, and feel like I'm getting the feel for a new type of cuisine.  Happy has been our server the last two times, and his attentiveness and recommendations are appreciated.  Service is never lacking, and I feel like I have my own little gem in limerick.  I will continue to be a patron of the restaurant, and I highly recommend that you give them a try!

Visit #4, Sunday at 11, right as they opened, offering a family style buffet option, (food comes from the kitchen to your table, you don't get up to go to the steam table) 14.99 per person, one appetizer, five entrees, desert and chi tea. VERY GOOD!! Loved the chance to sample different dishes, and as always, Happy never disappoints!!

Christie's is a great little gem tucked away on 19th street. The sandwiches are great and you can tell the ingredients are fresh. The customer service is superb. The owners always ensure you leave satisfied. I'm so happy I discovered Christie's.

THE BEST grocery store for all the staples. Milk bread eggs are all dirt cheap compared to Schnucks or Walmart. Limited selection leaves me running to one of the others for miscellaneous items but still prefer to make this my first stop and main store. Helpful hint: make it a regular practice to try their house brand "gourmet" items... some are fantastic!

We are visiting from another state and my husband made us a reservation about a month ago to this supposedly 4 star restaurant. Well, tonight they we way off. It started out ok . We had amazing service until Randy the lead waiter took over. He was way off for sure . Foreshadowing, he almost tipped over my wine glass. Thank goodness for Nick , he was amazing and made sure we had water and anything else we needed. Then captain Randy shows up. Don't most steak houses have you cut into your steak before you eat it? Well, that didn't happen here. Fast forward to dessert . When Randy asked what we would like for dessert, my daughter asked for the cookie cake, he left and came back and said well sorry. We ran out of That last night. Weird , don't you make your food fresh each day??? Ten minutes later, he says that he was mistaken , they DO have the cookie cake. Ok , so we get our dessert and have that and then we have been finished for quite sometime before Randy graces us with his presence again. When he does show up and all the dishes have been cleared, he reaches over and spills water all over my husband . No apologies. My daughter and I are handing him napkins and the awesome guy who brought us coffee and water helped get it all cleaned up. He is the one who actually apologized!!! We said. Well you didn't do it. Such a nice guy. Randy came back with our check though and still nothing mentioned about his crappy service. We were done by then. Way too many cool restaurants to go back to this one . Just no!

Always great food and customer service. We come a few times a month and the food is never disappointing. Their cheesy bruschetta with cashew cheese, vegan grilled cheese, FLTA (vegan BLT), teriyaki chicken bowl, pizza ala bismark are the best! My boyfriend is vegan so this is a great place we can both enjoy because they have so many choices and dietary accommodations. 
Had a little mixup one night where we were skipped on being seated, I was a little hangry and I got a little annoyed (I'm embarrassed it showed), but they gave us a free appetizer to make up for it. It was a honest mistake, but we appreciated the gesture. This is our go to place for sure.

The food & staff are fantastic!  Mother's Day rush with over an hour wait & Freddie took care of us like we were his only table.  Every time he passed he asked if we needed something, even with arms full of dishes.  The biscuits are huge & could almost be a meal on their own.  Ask for Freddie!

Love me some Ruby Slipper, for some reason when in NOLA I only come to this location. Although there is always a wait, they are pretty close to quoted waitlist times.

Once seated the average time from ordering to dining is pretty standard.

The drinks are great and food is good too. I drank my margarita so damn fast I forgot to take a pic of the presentation  but trust me order a Morning Margarita better than coffee..get your day started proper

I was in Philly only for a night, and chose Reading Terminal Market (RTM) to spend my precious hours in philly and it did not disappoint. It is akin to an Anaheim Packing place, Grand Central Market, or any other kind of space with lots of food items inside.
RTM hits all the points: Philly Cheesesteak (of course!), organic market, deli, bakery, dessert options, and veggie/vegan stands. 

1) Spatros Cheesesteak- apparently it is traditional to have yours with cheese whiz, and I got mine with mushrooms and sweet peppers as well. It was very flavorful, and it was a solid cheesesteak. Nothing too spectacular, but i you're looking to check of trying a cheesesteak at its namesake, it'll have you crossing it off your list

2) Beilers Bakery- I had such a hard time choosing what to get from this place, as everything looked sooooooo good. I ended up with the blueberry bread, which was divine. It had fresh blueberries and it took lots of mindpower to stop myself each time I got started

Altogether, this is a bang for your buck while you're in Philly and should come here for some ambience and food if you're in town!

It was a long wait but one of the waitresses said there was an issue in the kitchen. They couldn't keep track of the few customers that were seated in the balcony, they forgot to take their orders so after about 15 minutes they walked out. 

When we got the food, it was delicious. Chicken parm, corn and crab bisque, and muffuletta was great. 

Upon checking out, there was a dispute among employees which broke out into a fight outside in the street.
Delicious, fresh ingredients. Adorable restaurant with kind staff. Love the feel inside. Unique feel. Our new go to spot!

All the hype this place gets... I was excepting to be blown away. The decor was great and very country. The service was not good at all. It was the end of breakfast and they were all getting ready for lunch. The servers were at a table by the kitchen and all on their phones. They were looking at dresses as I past to go to the restroom.  I am a server and we are not even allowed to have our phones on us ( but we do and hide them) let alone on the floor for the customers to see. Ok on to the food. It was mediocre. I ordered the Benedict with biscuits sausage and gravy it said fried eggs instead of poached so I asked mine for scrambled. When it came the scrambled eggs look like it came out of the carton and not fluffy like real eggs and the taste was bland. I had to add hot sauce and pepper for some taste. The potatoes were good with the bbq sauce on it. The sausage was dry and my cousin did like like his always he said his was very dry..Not sure I will ever go back. If I do it would have to be a different location.
I saw Rob for a head shave and face shave. He was thorough and careful, would gladly come back. I'm in the middle of a move to the area and will make this my regular barber shop.

A wonderful lunch and even better service.  Alexis was very professional and made our lunch even better. We enjoyed outdoor dining on a comfortable temperature day. Everyone in our group was satisfied with each menu item ordered. Excellent iced tea. They offer plenty of appetizers. They have a weekday lunch menu. They have a shared parking lot but plenty of parking available. So glad we stopped in.

Love this place. Very unassuming. Great wraps and sandwiches (turkey club!). For a quick to go dinner they also make Dominican chicken or red meat platters with rice and beans which come in giant portions and taste delicious and like home cooking. The tostones or maduras are always a good side to add on as well! The prices are cheap and amazing for the amount of food you get. The mom-who is the cook, and the daughter who runs the register are always so sweet and helpful too! They also have regular convenience store products. Also--bring cash if you want to tip!
If there is a better Thai restaurant in town, I have yet to find it. I live on the north side of Indy, but I'm more than willing to make the drive!  So good!  I highly recommend this restaurant.

If you have not tried this place you have to but I will warn you it is addicting and super easy to pop 10 of these suckers in your mouth. They will make them to order, yeah that is right they make the mini donut and then top it with whatever you want when you arrive. There so many choices, and you can even make your own

First of all, if I had the opportunity, I would rate this place a zero (no stars) but not able so they get 1 star. Honestly, we ate there a week ago and I am still disgusted at the experience. When we were seated, we were told that we could not order wine by the glass. Ok, so we ordered a bottle of wine (party of 4.) We were then presented with a menu featuring 4 courses for $55 per person. My first course was scallops with a cilantro sauce. Please note, the references to portion sizes are NOT embellished but actual. The plate came out with 4 scallops the size of dimes with droplets of green sauce. I could have EASILY piled all four scallops on one fork. My husband ordered the tartare. This came out in the portion of MAYBE a tablespoon and 1/2 over ONE cracker. The next course was a sweat bread ravioli. Yep, you got it. ONE ravioli and barely enough stuffing to even taste it. Third course was lamb. 4 Slices of thinly sliced lamb with absolutely NO flavor over approx. 3 tablespoons of some lentil mush. Not to bore you with what everyone ate, but the final straw was dessert. Chocolate layer cake with espresso mousse. What a joke. I wish I could draw a picture. The cake came out on a 12 x 12 plate and the wedge was the size of a medium size strawberry. The express mousse was no more than a tablespoon. The waitress then proceeds to ask us if we would like more wine and then informs us that we can order the wine we are having by the glass now... Really?? Why now and not at the beginning of the meal? The tables are very close together, and we spent the better part of the evening shouting because the table of six next to us were right on top of us. The lighting is dreary at best. And here is the best part: with tip, our bill was over $400. We ate on our way home. My husband and I are not big eaters and appreciate smaller portions when dining out, however this was an insult--really. What a disappointment.  I will be surprised if this restaurant makes it a year. Certainly the neighborhood where this is situated cannot afford these prices. Shame.

This place is amazing. And so delicious. 
I had my family of 8 and we showed up before the early rush, service was good, they were able to accommodate such a big party. The food is so yummy.
Lobster roll delicious. Oysters were fresh and had lots of flavor. Catfish po boy was good too. Service is a little slow, could be a little better hence only 4 stars.

this store is going to the dogs, it is under stocked, under managed and under staffed. went there Sunday and the store was packed and only had 2 registers opened. went to buy oranges and bunch of them was spoiled. the shopping carts and most of them are broken and the brake comes and off all the time. empolyees are over worked and security in the store is not any where to be found. i've been shopping at this store since it opened in 2003 and i believe its time to shop somewhere else .

We called this morning at 7:30 am with a forced air gas heater that was doing nothing but blowing cold air. Bill said he could have someone over in the afternoon, however Lee Gravelle was able to make it at about 10:00 am. He quickly diagnosed the problem and replaced the non-functioning flame sensor. He tested the ignitor which was on its last legs so we had him replace that too as long as he was here. We had an air filter which was very unusual and had tried to have it replaced before, but without success. Lee was able to modify the air return and replace the old filter with a standard size. Everything now works perfectly, and we are very appreciative of the excellent service we received. We highly recommend Lee and Silver State.

We ducked in just for drinks when it wasn't busy. My husband's never been to Philly and I wanted to show him the gamut this city runs in a short time. I knew it'd been an old bank built in 1925. Today, this place may appear unassuming from the outside, but definitely has WOW factor once inside, the kind you just don't see anymore in newer buildings. The ceilings, the columns, the marble counters, the wrap-around staircases, the wrought iron, a beautiful dining mezzanine, the old vault, etc. etc. This place is a CLASSIC.

We order old-fashioneds everywhere we go. The ingredients the bartender used were simple and humble, but she made hands-down the BEST old-fashioned I'd ever had in Philly. So well-balanced between the whiskey, the bitters,  and the simple syrup. She finished it with a bit of fruit cocktail. Now I always ask if I can add fruit cocktail if I need to doctor up an old-fashioned. They always look at me like I'm nuts, but don't knock it till you've tried it, and guess they haven't been to Del Frisco's in Philly!

Thank you so much for the wonderful experience for my husband and me on that cold afternoon, with the mid-afternoon light filtering through those stories-high windows, and our drinks warming our bellies.

This is our favorite "go to" place for takeout chinese. The food is always great, and done quickly. They do special orders (for example: leaving out certain ingredients on request) and the family operating the restaurant is friendly and quite efficient. We get takeout virtually every week, and never get tired of it. Expect high quality food at reasonable prices with virtually no wait.

Always satisfying and hits the spot. I noticed a few new creations on their menu and thought I would give it a try. The waiter and waitress were able to answer our questions and made sure everything was okay. The food came around and it did not disappoint. Their bimbimbap burritos were filling and big. I expected it to be a small portion but I was definitely wrong. Come hungry if you plan to try it, I didn't make it half way through it. Keep up the good work.

Food is awesome. Mezcal margarita is my first 'big girl' gourmet cocktail, I think. You will never regret ordering the Cavatelli. We didn't even know it was vegetarian, until we ate there 3 times. Chef & service very good.

My husband and I ordered the shimp poboy and shrimp and oyster poboys TO GO for lunch yesterday. This place is crowded but you can avoid the long ling if you order TO GO at the bar.  One of THE best poboys in NOLA, def liked it for the shrimp and oyster or shrimp poboys. I also liked Verdi Marte for All that Jazz poboy!
Excellent service. I had the lamb, chicken, and beef kabob platter. It was nicely done.

I went to shack shake for the very first time and was a bit unimpressed. Growing up on the west coast with In'n'Out, shake shack did not measure up. The burgers were delicious, but my mouth kind of dropped when I saw the size of the burgers. I wouldnt say I eat a lot but it would take 2 of those to fill me up.

 I also have a beef with the shakes. Since its called shake shack, I figured the shakes must be pretty good. Well they were, or at least the chocolate one was. But again, for 5 bucks the quantity was not there. Since I am a college guy, looking at the relatively small burger and small sized shake made me sad :(  

Note: I would probably go to five guys instead, but Shack shake is always worth trying so if you haven't gone, try it!

This was my first stop here and it was amazing! We are from out of town and stopped by for a platter without calling ahead. The young woman working and her coworker were so nice and Patient with us! The food and dips were so delicious and fresh out of the oven! We will
Be back and just wish there was a location near us in Baltimore! We were there at 10:30 today so let the nice people who
Were working at that time know they made a difference!

I live down the street and have ate here numerous times over the years. The staff are friendly, the menu is large, and the portions are large too!  Last weekend, my wife, daughter and I went and got two very large, fresh made Horchatas and a Loco nacho and 1 order of chicken nachos.   The red salsa is VERY tasty and hot.  At $9.00 a plate, it was WAY more than we could eat.  I eat a lot too.  We were, once again, impressed with the price versus amount of food that you get.  I do see some folks on here complaining about the prices and cleanliness.  If you want a spotless place to sit down and dine, try an INDOOR dinning place....don't come to a walk up window and bitch because the tables and chairs aren't clean.  That's just dumb.  Another thing, this isn't some cheap walk up taco window where you get a small portion of meat, onion and cilantro for $1.00.  Their tacos are about 3x the size of a standard street taco and you get a lot of meat with it.  So for those wanking about the prices, do a fair comparison if you are going to whine about that!  To top it off,  my daughter left her purse there with her easter money in it.  I pretty much assumed it was gone.  The next day, I walked by and just asked the owner if someone turned it in...he went to the back and came out with her purse, everything inside.  Honesty earns you a lot pal...we'll see you again this week for another meal since you were so kind.
By far a hidden gem, this place is amazing down to the service and the food, must go to.

So fun! We came here with a group of 8 gals for a bachelorette party and had a blast bowling for 2 hours on a Saturday night. This old-school bowling alley is small with about only 6 lanes, so you need a reservation in advance and the max per lane is 8 people. The best part is it's BYOB, just know in advance we brought a cooler and you have to get it down two flights of stairs from street level into the alley and that can be a little tricky. We ordered pizza and had it delivered, but you can also bring your own food and snacks. The staff was friendly and helpful, and we had so much fun. 
Just when you think this place couldn't get any better, it also benefits a nonprofit!

I have thick, frizzy, wavy/curly (2B) hair. I usually switch it up between chin-length and a few inches below my shoulders. 

Every time I go for a cut, I always have to ask the stylist to thin it out, because if I don't have layers, my hair is a frizzy pyramid. Unfortunately, every time I've gotten layers, my hair is flippy and shaggy, a complete mess. When I blow it out, I look like I have The Rachel, circa 1994. When I leave it curly, it's even worse.

So, I went to the Parlour on a friend's recommendation and got an appointment with Crystal. Before she started working on my hair, we talked for quite a while. She said that she and I had the same texture hair and she knew exactly what to do to make it look less shaggy but not poofy.

She also told me that it either had to be just above or just below the spot where my neck meets my back because it would flip up otherwise. Nobody else has EVER told me that, and my hair has always flipped. She really took my hair texture into consideration when she was cutting it.

For the first time in my adult life, I don't have old-timey Jennifer Aniston hair. Crystal did such a good job that my shortest layer actually looks LONGER. I don't know how she did it. She must be a wizard. 

The real test was after I got home. I re-wet my hair and styled it myself. Because anyone can look good when leaving a salon. But I was able to style it on my own and it still looked good.

I also got highlights and I almost gave this a 4 star review because the highlights are a leeeeetle more subtle than what I had in mind. But they were expertly done, and I'm honestly so happy about the cut that I'd give 6 stars if I could.

Used the no wait app to get in line and we were able to walk right in for our table without wasting time standing around. Service was great and our waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable. I have never tried oysters and let him recommend one, The Duxberry,  it was absolutely delicious and so fresh tasting. I like that you can order only 1 or as many as you like instead of having to pay for a full serving. I had the Connecticut style lobster roll and my husband ordered the crab roll. Holy cow this is what lobster is SUPPOSED TO taste like. Perfect texture and not overcooked at all, buttery and rich. The crab was excellent as well and the brioche buns they are served on are just heaven. The hush puppies we ordered as an appetizer were crispy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside and just  slightly sweet. Just as they should be. We can't wait to return multiple times and try the rest of the menu!

I had the pleasure of dining at Booty's Street Food recently with members of my family.  Due to the extensive menu we were able to sample many different things and enjoyed them all. The cocktails were slamming!; with original drinks I have only seen at Booty's. I loved the way the "Loos" (rest rooms) were decorated as Booty features 2 different artists works monthly allowing them to showcase their talents by decorating the rest rooms.  My only complaint is I live too far away to enjoy Bootys on a regular basis, you lucky Nola gang!!!. Next trip I will have my Booty on a stool at Booty's Street Food. oh yeah and loved me some Stumptown Coffee!!!!

Jacquelynn is the BEST! Highly skilled professional and so nice! I have been getting spray tans for years now and I finally found a place I love and for an awesome price! I have gotten so many compliments on my tan every time I get one; especially on my wedding day, Jacquelynn knew exactly what I wanted. I recommend Beauty by Jacquelynn to anyone and everyone!!!
Best Cajun Po Boys in Indy reminds me of home, Nawlins! My family and I have been here several times. Gumbo is excellent as well as the shrimp and grits. Staff is very friendly.
The Hub Hash is probably the best Corned Beef hash I've ever had, like, ever. Fantastic service, great food. On to the ice cream!

Rather than cook after a long day, we decided to go to Steak n Shake in Maplewood.  We were seated quickly, no problem there.  We placed our order, again no problem.  I really wasn't all that hungry and just ordered the small fries and a drink, while the person with me ordered a sandwich and fries, plus a drink.  Now here comes the problems.  We weren't offered water, but I thought my drink would be out quickly.  Nope, not even.  So, we waited a half hour, all the time looking back at our food sitting up on the counter.  The cooks were coming out serving people while the waitress was doing whatever it was she was doing.  Finally, we got our food and drinks.  My fries were barely warm, but I douse them with ketchup so figured since the ketchup was good, I wasn't risking waiting another half hour by complaining about the quality of the fries.  (Besides, I know better than complain to the one handling my food)  We weren't offered refills on our drinks, and by then, I just wanted to leave so I didn't ask.  Before we were finished, our waitress came and grabbed up my companion's plates.  We were never given a check, so we just went to the counter and paid our bill.  The family behind us had kids that were asking for something they had ordered and never got.  I guess we weren't the only ones that were less than pleased.
I have come here several times and every single time it has been a disappointment. We got wings one time and it was sooooo dry and overcooked. I could barely get passed 2 wings.

The food was excellent.   Ordered pepper steak, house special fried rice, crab Rangoon and wanton soup.    My only disappointment was the chicken in the house special fried rice.     Excellent food, I will certainly get food from here again.

Laughably bad service.  Nothing special about the Cobb Salad or the lunch Sirloin my friend had.  Waited so long for drink refills, extra dressing, the check that we considered just writing it off and leaving.  I think Waffle House would have provided the same quality and assuredly better service.  Too bad, I had really wanted it to be a good experience.

Overall, I had a good stay. My room was clean and taken care of daily. The service was OK. Location was great, close to a lot of shopping and not a far walk from some good places to eat or drink. My view was of a busted building though.... but I won't complain. Nice place to stay!

One of my favourite restaurant in Delaware. 
Been here a few times already . It always seem to be busy. Just my luck,  I usually end up waiting at least 40mins for a table. 
However,  It's worth. 
It's a great place for tex mex. It can get pretty loud at time. 
Food, portion wise, is a lot. Therefore,  try not to eat too much of the complimentary chips and salsa.
  
I usually get their Gumbo. Don't know what about it that makes me keep on ordering it everytime i'm here. It's really that good.   

I recommend stopping by here if you're near Delaware park casino or Christiana hospital.

Took my girlfriend and her two boys thursday evening. We got a plain pie. The guy behind the counter sent us next door where they have indoor seating, a TV, and bathroom. Bathroom was clean. They brought the pizza over in maybe 10 minutes or so. It was thin crusted and tasty. I liked the sauce, which was a little on the sweet side like I like it. More sweet than acidic. Very nice thin,  crisp crust, which doesn't fill you up like thicker crust pizza does. 
I would add that the people behind the counter were very friendly and helpful, which made the experience all the more pleasant. All in all, a nice place.

As a resident of Mt. Airy I had such high hopes learning that a jewish style delicatessen would be opening in our neighborhood; sadly I have been disappointed by this new establishment.  Growing up in a Jewish household I have had a lifelong love affair with all things delicatessen from local to NYC joints that serve the glory of corned beef, tongue, turkey and pastrami sandwiches piled high on luxurious rye bread.  This new place is very far from attaining this level of delicious.  
Firstly, they opened too soon.  No signage, no register (an appliance that can be procured for under $100 at any staples or rest. supply store), no phone number, cash only, unprepared staffing and an unfinished location still not complete from their construction.  
The corned beef is decent as far as meat of this style goes but far too lean to remain moist and tender; the pastrami tastes just like the corned beef with no discernable flavor difference that you expect from a peppered and well seasoned pastrami.  The "rye" bread they are offering is a sad excuse, something that resembles a square loaf of wheat and tastes nothing like true authentic rye; there is a great artisan bakery in Chestnut Hill that could source great rye if the ownership looked into them.  The portion size for a sandwich that runs around $10 on average is quite minimal and nothing that any true deli connoisseur would come to expect from a deli. Their pickles are satisfactory, at least the dill pickles.  The "pink" pickles made with beet juice, not so much. 
The second point of contention I had was with the health code standards.  The main "chef" preparing the meal was in compliance with washed hands and gloves whereas the would be owner decided to assist him in setting up bread for our sandwiches having not washed his hands or put on gloves but after touching his head and face; these are clear health code violations.  Employee open beverages held behind the counter on food prep surfaces as well; all big pitfalls to those unaware of proper health code operating standards.  
On paper this place is a great idea but not well executed and pushed to open too early.  It is unacceptable to not have any sort of register to run transactions, phone for ordering or even full scale signage or menu boards and expect to operate soundly and successfully.  
I would recommend Knishes and Dishes in Lafayette Hill, a mere 10 minutes away and with incredible meats and the Rye bread needed to compliment those offerings.  
My advice to the ownership:  take a minute, regroup, do your research, prepare yourselves and your team to be able to run this establishment properly.  
This neighborhood is spawning some great establishments as well as being the steward of some years old fantastic spots; Mt. Airy and the residents here deserve only the best, remember that.

Went on Sat 3/18/17 approximately 1:15 p.m. Maybe 12-14 customers there. Floors were filthy. Server couldn't find a table that didn't need bussing, so I sat at the counter instead. 5 mins went by without anyone greeting me. I left without eating. So much for their new tv commercials.
The non stop God damn beeping makes me never want to come here ever again.  Holy shit.  That and the snobby b workers what a fast food dump store.

Taco Bell prices with authentic Mexican food quality. Best meal I've had while filling my tank. 

The location is quite deceiving, border-lining a joke. Hostess/cashier was cute and very friendly. They communicate very well with you as to what they offer and can do for you. 

Food was prepared and served swiftly and cleanly. Love the side onions btw... 

Keep up the great work guys! Definitely my secret Mexican food spot when I'm on this side of town.

Love it!

Great local restaurant with great food, great service, great atmosphere.

We had...
two orders of Shrimp Scampi for the ladies (make sure to stir the sauce back over the noodles before eating or it'll seem bland),
the South of the Border Cobia special, 
a bowl of Gumbo, 
a bowl of She-Crab soup, 
hamburgers for the kids, 
a slice of Pumpkin Cheesecake, 
a slice of Key Lime Pie, 
ice cream for the kids, 
white Sangria, 
Negra Modelo...
And it was all very good. 

Our waiter, Ryan, was as good a waiter as you'll find.

I would say that the desserts and soups were a little more expensive than they should be by about a dollar. But the beer was well priced for similar restaurants.

In sum, great Florida spot. This is the local flavor.  Highly recommended.

Everything except the oysters and the history of the building is terrible. We were placed in the entryway with red lightning that hurt my eyes the entire dinner. In addition, the waiter was not attentive to us, especially to me who is a female and kept giving the check and receipt to my boyfriend, though I was paying and ignoring my presence.

Dined here last night, my wife and I both had Filet Mignon ordered Medium and came to table well done, no pink. It was good steak but horrible preparation as over cooked. Ordered a flight of wine for $30 got three tiny glasses, should've ordered one glass at $16 it would've been more quantity. Service was ok, not exceptional at all. We'll try someplace different tonight. Did not feel it's a good value for money spent.
Decent enough sports bar, looking for a cold beer and bar food this is your spot.  Decent burgers and fried food.

Well, it's not disgusting, but the price is on the accurate to high side. Hasn't been kept up at all. This place hasn't seen a coat of paint since the early 90's. Attention owners: put a little money into this place. Staff is courteous, but I want to dip my body in alcohol and I ain't the squeamish type.
Awesome appetizers, interesting combinations for pizzas, overall very good!  And when you join their mailing list, you get pretty good (and fun) monthly coupons.
Great family red gravy Italian restaurant.  Big portions, taste good and a very fair price.  Nice basket of bread with each table.  We've been more that 20 times and always leave happy.

Not as good as a proper sit-down restaurant, but they're not trying to be.  What it IS is a lot better than standard fast food.  Most of the menu items are vicious calorie bombs, but they're tasty and fresh.

If you live in Tucson and never tried Boba you definitely need to get on that bandwagon ! Its especially amazing for those  hot summer days :), think of it as eegees or icee but 100X better and more Asian ^°^ it comes in many different flavors and if you aren't feeling a snow or slush you can always get tea/milk tea or snow :3!

Although Mike's made my list of Nashville must-trys on a recent trip, we accidentally stumbled upon this place on a walk of Broadway on a recent trip--and boy, are we glad we did! Mike's is a small ice cream parlor, one that barely fits the patrons and its popularity. There is some effort that went into decorating this place like an old school ice cream parlor, with it's small tables and chairs, counter tops, and unique wall décor. 

Mike serves a wide selection of handmade ice cream in a variety of different ways and they are extremely generous on their scoops. Between the two of us, we shared a single scoop of pralines and cream on a waffle cone and it was almost too much--and we're both like our ice cream! The ice cream is very creamy and incredibly delicious. In this particular flavor, there were generous amounts of praline--a few in every bite, and lots of caramel swirls. Our ice cream was truly divine and it seems like everyone else's ice cream was also delicious as no one could make it to the register without first taking a bite! 

Although we didn't venture this way, I noticed a few cool things that could spice up your ice cream treat here, such as a cookie cone or a Nutella sundae...but who needs spicing to this already delicious treat? Definitely a must try and completely worth the calories!!!

We stopped in to the Macaroni Grill for a friends birthday lunch and this is where she wanted to go.  I'm a sucker for ravioli and I had heard they have really good ravioli.  They share a parking lot with Barnes & Noble and Great Basin Brewing so I imagine parking can be an issue during busy times.  They have two dining options - the first is with their traditional menu where you sit and a waiter takes care of you, the second is their express dining.  It's sort of a lunch line where they make the food fresh, but it's a limited menu and they do it for both lunch and dinner.  We went with the traditional dining and were seated promptly.  Our waiter was friendly and he kept the drinks and fresh bread coming.  The bread was delicious, piping hot with rosemary and they have olive oil and balsamic for dipping.  I ordered the Mushroom Ravioli for lunch and it was really good with lots of mushrooms.  However, I think the plate may have been left under the warmer a bit too long.  The plate was scalding hot - no biggie but the parts of ravioli without sauce were very dry and almost crunchy.  That's really the only reason I'm giving them 3 stars instead of 4.  I was really looking forward to that cheat lunch and it just didn't live up to my expectations.

Fantastic job on bed liner!  Great looking product at a great price.  Highly recommend! 

Although I am happy with the liner I'm not so happy about the tape residue left all over the truck.  Just discovered today the baked on residue on the roof that took about an hour to remove.  Advice to the owner:  don't buy cheap tape!  Pass on the dollar store and buy real tape that doesn't leave a mess to clean up.  Or at least clean it up when it's fresh.

I've been several time now, a few of my friends are also big fans of this place now, because of me :) The chicken tights are so delicious. We liked the slaw too. The food truck is right in front of craft brewed so you can enjoy craft beers and smoked chicken, it doesn't get any better than this, does it?  There is a nice outdoor sitting area too.

I love the patio ! Its all outdoor so put your hair up. It's a very casual place and the drinks are great . No kitchen but most places deliver there. Check out ladies night it's a blast with great specials. And if you love college football get there early on Saturdays with your Gator gear on

Product was not on shelf so employee went to back to see if in stock and he never came back.  Then we saw he was up front checking people out!!  Products were not on shelves in front of correct prices.  Store is poorly lit.  Will not go back.

I had a great experience at the State street shop. Good recs and very helpful on both my purchases. The other store downtown i was faced with a salesman who could not answer any questions and just tried to up sell me on everything. There prices are competitive.Definitely want to go to the State street shop.

Ordered some late night grub from here for delivery when in Nashville after a night out. They were great! I ordered a wood oven, 18 inch, gluten free margherita pizza. I was mostly just intrigued because I have never seen a gluten free pizza that size. Shortly after I ordered, I received a call from the restaurant saying there was an issue with the order and they were going to send two smaller gluten free pizzas instead of one larger one. Sooo that's how you do it! ;) Oh well, I think I made out with more pizza anyway!

Pizza was a hit. Only downsides were a little too much garlic and it did not reheat well. But it was FABULOUS night of delivery. Very much enjoyed! Plus our delivery driver was also super friendly and perky despite the almost 3 am delivery time.

I walked in and was not greeted at all. They had multiple tables cleaned off and clearly spaced for seating. They sat a family that walked in right before us. Then had 2 other tables open and available and then told us they were reserved. We were also told that you can not make reservations. So I am very confused. The past couple times we have been in, the food has not been cooked well. The service has not been good. Very disappointed and most likely will not be back.
Great neighborhood place to enjoy a cold beer (great options) and excellent bar food. The wings with the whiskey dry rub are delicious!
Great food and waitstaff. Decent rotating craft beer selection and daily meal specials. Great place for a family. Gets a bit loud though.

Do not go here. They "assign" you a PCP that is never in the office and then when you have an acute medical problem they schedule you only to cancel you the night before. The refuse to see you if you actually need help. Their office staff is incompetent and doesn't communicate with each other. They are there just to make money off the population the see. I will never go back nor will I fleece refer anyone to any of their facilities.

DO NOT come here if you're expecting a quick pick up like any normal sandwich shop. 2 customers in the shop and it took 30 minutes for a single cold sandwich to be ready. 

What was most infuriating is the last 10 min of the wait was because they ran out of a specific topping but left the sandwich on the side while they worked on other orders. I finally went to ask if that was our order and apparently they were waiting to check if I was ok with a replacement or the pickled vegetables. I stood waiting inside the restaurant the entire 30 minutes - the fact that they couldn't have just asked is ridiculous.
Cafeteria food. Kinda crappy service . Gross greasy condiment bottles . Mad I wasted 30$ bucks one a cocktail and burger. I'm not picky I get it's airport food .... But this was beyond gross

Says it's open when it's not. Do not recommend- I'll be at McDonald's 

I use Yelp to see what's open, when I arrive and it's closed that's out of my way and unprofessional so update your business.
Great atmosphere, great bar staff,  great food, great draft beer selection. Can't go wrong here.

I have been extremely disappointed in Bar Crawl Unlimited.

Many people were upset that they would not issue refunds to the New Orleans Margarita Bar Crawl at The Old Absinthe House on Bourbon Street in July 2019.  The event was cancelled the day before it was scheduled, with no refunds given.

People wanted refunds because Hurricane Barry's landfall was scheduled in New Orleans for the night of the bar crawl that had been canceled.  After many negative Facebook comments, Bar Crawl Unlimited generously offered a refund to everyone for that special case.  HOWEVER, over two weeks later, no one I know has actually gotten a refund even after many emails and calls to Bar Crawl Unlimited.  

The only way anyone got their money back was to file a fraudulent business claim with their bank.  The Bar Crawl Unlimited Facebook is currently blocking anyone on Facebook that is leaving a comment asking for a refund, or suggesting that the business is weird for deleting comments asking for this refund that has been promised.  Comments asking for refunds, and comments containing negative reviews have all been hidden by the business' social media moderators.
